loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn, a father of five children, is 54 years old and a widower. He is a resident of the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. 

For 12 years, his main sources of income have come from a half hectare of rice farming and raising pigs. He is able to earn up to 11,500 Cambodian riel per day through his business. He earns extra income catching fish. 

Sorn is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). His loans, which he has repaid, have enabled him to provide sufficient food for his kids. 

Sorn has formed a group to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, he will spend his portion on fishing materials to catch more fish. He hopes that he can earn more income to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials to catch more fish

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 55, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jesse and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Regina is a mineral water distributor. What she does is buy mineral water in containers from wholesalers, and sells it by the container (5 gallons per container) for a profit. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Regina hopes to expand her business and have a stall. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Bless

texts.en: Bless is 43 years old. She is married and has five children. She lives in Mitacas, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Bless is a businesswoman who has a shop that sells assorted  groceries and beverages. She has been doing this for five years, earning a monthly income of 5000 PHP. Bless is requesting a new loan to be used to purchase construction materials needed to build a house. Bless has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for eight years.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials needed to build a house

loans.name: Sherif

texts.en:
Sherif is a thirty-two-year-old father of four children who lives with his family in the Ashkali community. He is the only financial provider for his family, earning his living by providing transportation services and using his horse to transport goods for his neighbors.  Sherif also works on the land with his tractor. He is busy every day because he is keeping up two jobs which helps him to be in good health, explained Sherif.

The loan of 1,000 Euros that Sherif is requesting is to buy new tools for his tractor to work on the land for others which will help him to generate more income. In the future his goal is to give his children better education. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy new tools for his tractor

loans.name: Tinevimbo Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 35-year-old James from Harare. James is married with three children and two are attending school. He has no dependents other than his children. James is into buying and selling shoes and jeans. The business has been in operation for five years. He says the main challenges faced are that when rains are massive they have to close up, since the area is not covered, and also competition from other sellers. 

James has requested a loan of $500 to buy new shoes, tackies and jeans for resale. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to increase the family's cash flow and quality of life. In the future James plans to run his own renowned boutique.

loans.use: to buy shoes and jeans for resale

loans.name: Sabran

texts.en:
Sabran is a 43-year-old hardworking women living with her husband and two children in Rawalpindi Pakistan. They have three buffaloes and her husband sells buffalo milk to their neighbors and other people, which is the only source of income for their family. Sabran wants to sell milk, yogurt and butter in the market on a large scale for which the production should be increased. 

Sabran is facing a very difficult time as her monthly income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to buy a new buffalo in order to increase the production of milk and get her monthly income increased. After getting the profit, she is planning to send her children to school. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Satas' Group

texts.en:
A 42-year-old divorced mother of three kids living in a village located in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, Satas struggles for a living as a single mother for the sake of her kids via food selling: noodles and porridge. She has been with this business for two years and can earn about 26,400 KHR per day.  Her previous loan was her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has supported her business in a timely manner. 

Now, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. She and her co-member are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. Satas is the leader, and she will spend her loan portion to expand her food selling stall to a bigger scale. She hopes that she can make more income and attract more customers.

loans.use: To expand her food selling stall

loans.name: Khishigsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Khishigsuren, 36 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land.

Khishigsuren has been running her bakery shop since 2007, and has secured permanent clients and accumulated a vast amount of experience. In addition to her original bakery shop, there is another one that she owns which is not connected to the main sewerage system. Being separated from water has reduced this shop's efficiency due to the necessity of having to transport water from a great distance. It has also had a bad effect on the immediate environment due to soil deterioration from gray water and chemicals.

Khishigsuren is therefore requesting a loan of 3000000 MNT to cover the cost of connecting her second bakery shop to the main sewerage line. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of connecting her bakery shop to the main sewerage system

loans.name: Marbel Luz

texts.es: Marbel de 33 años de edad, habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 5 y 12 años. Ella desde hace 8 años dejó de ser empleada y se dedicó a generar ingresos mediante un trabajo independiente, para apoyar la gestión de su cónyuge en el hogar, aumentando entradas de dinero y controlando los gastos. Su negocio nació pequeño pero con muchos sueños, hoy en día dirige vendedoras que distribuyen artículos de tocador y de aseo personal, los cuales promociona mediante guías especializadas de productos. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito mientras sus compras las hace de estricto contado, esto hace que su capital de trabajo sea insuficiente, para responder a la demanda del mercado, por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará Colonias, cosméticos, lociones y accesorios, con lo cual ampliará su capital de trabajo y la cobertura de sus clientes y esta es justamente la razón de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en: Marbel, age 33, lives to the south of the city with her husband and their two children, ages 5 and 12.  Eight years ago, she left her role as an employee and started to generate income through independent work, in order to support her husband in the home as well as to increase income and control expenses.  Her business was born small, but with many dreams, and today she manages saleswomen who distribute toiletries and personal care articles, which she promotes through specialized catalogs of the products.  She makes her sales using cash or on credit, keeping strict accounting of her purchases, which causes her working capital to be insuffient for the demands of the market.  For this reason, she is requesting a Kiva loan.  It is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase colognes, cosmetics, lotions, and accessories, which will increase her working capital and satisfy the demands of her customers, which is exactly the reason for the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase colognes, cosmetics, lotions, and accessories.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat, 38, is a hardworking, diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and three sons. Her husband and sons run a car decoration and spare parts shop. This is the family’s only source of income. 

The family is currently facing many problems with the business, as the stock of car accessories is almost depleted, and they have no funds to purchase more stock. 

Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business. He will purchase a variety of spare parts and decoration kits, like car chargers, fog lights, engine parts, rims, seat covers and neon lights. 

With profits from the business, Musarat will make arrangements for the marriage of her son and for the expansion of their business. She is very hopeful that the loan will be productive for the family and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase spare car parts

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time a 10,000 PHP loan, for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rosario hopes to have her own store and dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has one child. She is 46 years old. She lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga. 

Mercy has worked as house helper for more than two years with a monthly wage of 2500 PHP. Mercy is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials needed for kitchen completion. Mercy has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for eight years.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials needed for kitchen completion

loans.name: Shugufta

texts.en:
A loan of 20,000 PKR would help Shugufta to get a new sewing machine so that she could work efficiently as the old machine is not working properly. 

Shugufta has been doing tailoring work for seven years and she has excellent tailoring skills. Now, with the aid of a new machine, she would be able to stitch more dresses, resulting in an increase in her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in Oroquieta City in the Philippines. She has been making and selling fruit salad for a living for numerous years, earning 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) monthly. 

In 2011, she joined the Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase ingredients to make more fruit salad. 

In the future, she hopes to be able to expand her business to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make fruit salad.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar is a 48-year-old married women who lives with her husband and daughter in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her biggest dream in life is to marry her daughter into a good and respectable family. For 10 years, Anwar's husband has been driving a taxi, which is the only source of income for the family. But for the last 20 days he has not been able to generate any income as his taxi stopped working and needs to be repaired. Anwar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to repair her husband's taxi so that he can continue his work. This will not only improve the taxi's condition, but will help in improving the family's income as well.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on her husband's taxi

loans.name: Gulebeste

texts.en:
Gulebeste  is 48 years old. She is a mother of five children. Gulebeste is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee. She is a farmer.

Gulebeste has been doing this work for ten years, and she has been doing it by herself since she started. She really enjoys her work because she feels free and independent. At the same time, it’s going very well for her, and this helps her to feel calmer. 

Her plans are to expand her cropland, care for it, and integrate more technology so she can obtain an excellent harvest. Her goal is to save enough money to send her children to the university so that they can get training and be able to take over the family business when they inherit the land.

She has already taken two loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, she has applied for her third loan of 1500 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers to treat her soil and get a good harvest. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to treat her soil and get a good harvest

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en: Haleema is a 38-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and four children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2010, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business as the demands of his clients are increasing day-by-day. Therefore, his wife, Haleema, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband's store. He will purchase a variety of products, including flour, milk packs, eggs, pulses, detergents, oils, etc. to cope with the increased demand of clients. Mrs. Haleema and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to purchase items for her husband's general store

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 39-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and four children in Punjab, Pakistan. Since 2000, her husband has been running a general store, which is the only source of income for the family. Yasmeen also helps her husband in his business; he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of products, like flour, sugar, eggs, and rice for his general store. This will help him to satisfy his clients more professionally, as well as increase his savings for the better future of his children. With the profits expected from this loan, Yasmeen intends to expand her husband's business so that she can purchase a sewing machine for her personal use. Yasmeen and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products, like flour, sugar, eggs, and rice for her husband's general store

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento MUJERES VENCEDORAS está  compuesto por ocho  integrantes seis mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Yolanda  tiene 58 años, y un hijo de la edad de 13 años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos  en su tienda de barrio que se  encuentra  en la zona de Puente Topater,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de variedad de productos como galletas, dulces, abarrotes y refrescos para surtir su tienda ya que por la buena ubicación tiene mucha venta,  La Sra. Yolanda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona que venden los mismos productos que ella, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo incrementando sus ganancias para seguir creciendo en su actividad, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Vencedoras is made up of 8 members, 6 women and 2 men. 

The president of the bank is Yolanda. She is 58 years old and has a 13 year old child. She works selling various products in her neighborhood store which is located in the Puente Topater area.

This is her first loan with the institution. She is going to use the loan to buy a variety of products such as cookies, sweets, groceries and drinks in order to supply her store. Since her store is in a good location she has lots of sales.

Yolanda faces challenges in her business since it is competitive as there are other stores in the area that sell the same products that she does. Her desire for her business is to continue increasing earnings and that her business continues growing. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for its support.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her store

loans.name: Fely's Group

texts.en:
Fely is 49 years old. She is married to a fisherman and is blessed with six children. She lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. 

Fely is engaged in "nipa" weaving as a her source of income. She is able to gain a monthly income of 2,500 PHP through this business. 

Fely is requesting a new loan to be used to pay for her child's school tuition fees. She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for 7 years.

Fely is a leader of a  two member group, although they have separate responsibilities.

loans.use: to pay for her child's school tuition fees

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 31 years old and lives at West Point, an area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and she stopped her education at grade 7 and attended a tailoring school. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past four years she has been operating her own tailor shop in the local market. She works six days a week from 7 AM to 5 PM. She likes her business because she has a lot of customers, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared taxi every time to get her cloth and other tailoring items to her shop. 

Marie is requesting a loan to purchase cloth and a new tailoring machine for her business. She plans to build a house her own house.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and a new tailoring machine for her business

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is from Kinangay Sur, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old, and married with one child. 

To make a living, she manages a charcoal making business. She has been engaged in her business for four years, and her income has increased to 5,000 month from these activities. 

Zeny is again requesting a loan of 60,000 from GDMPC micro credit; it will be used to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is Fatu, from Liberia.  She lives in Paynesville North, which is a suburb of the capital city of Monrovia.  Paynesville North has the largest market in Montserrado county, and the area is home to “round time marketers”, traders who travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county.  As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Montserrado County, including Monrovia.

Fatu is 50, and married with six children.  Her children are between the ages of 5 and 35.  One child is currently living at home, and in school.  

Fatu has owned a table business selling beans, groundnuts, and pepper for the past ten years.  On average, she works ten hours at her business.  She started her business through her mother's help, and she transports her merchandise by taxi. Her favorite part of the business is it keeps her busy. 

She will use the loan to purchase more goods such as beans, groundnuts, and pepper; she cites the high price of goods as her biggest challenge.  
 
In the future, she would like to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as beans, groundnuts, and pepper;

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
Jacqueline, de 42 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos en la casa de su madre desde hace 15 años. A lo largo de su vida aprendió todo lo concernientes a las actividades agrícolas y también ganaderas,  hoy en día siembra maíz, papa y alfalfa en menores cantidades, la alfalfa le sirve en especial para alimentar a sus animales. Pero la actividad que más le agrada es la crianza de ovejas y cuyes, las cuales vende periódicamente para tener ingresos permanentes para invertir en el bienestar de su familia, manifiesta que le agrada su trabajo porque siempre tiene disponible para vender lo que produce en su almacén y para su consumo familiar, tiene deseos de adquirir más terrenos y tener mas animales de ganado ovino. Pues hace poco sufrió el robo de sus animales, pero está segura de volver a mantener el mismo ganado de antes, gracias a su experiencia.Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo ha logrado obtener muy buenas ganacias gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan , por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas. 
Jacqueline, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de varios ejemplares de cuyes y ovejas para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 42 years old and hard-working.  She has been living in her mother's house with her two children for fifteen years.  Throughout her life, Jacqueline has learned everything there is to know about farming and cattle raising.  She now grows small quantities of corn, potatoes and alfalfa, with the alfalfa being particularly useful for feeding her animals.  However, the work that she likes most is raising sheep and guinea pigs, which she sells from time to time in order to have a source of income to invest in her family's well-being.  Jacqueline tells us that she enjoys her work because she always has enough in stock to sell and to feed her family.  She would like to have more land and sheep.  Recently Jacqueline was the victim of a robbery: her animals were stolen but she is confident that, thanks to her experience, she will be able to raise cattle like before.  This is Jacqueline's third loan with Kiva and she feels happy just now as she has been able to make very good profits with the financial support that she has received.  Jacqueline promises to make her repayments.

Jacqueline will invest the 1000 Nuevo Soles in buying a number of guinea pigs and sheep in order to increase her number of livestock.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and sheep.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 48 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Roberto con quien tiene 7 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor en su casa propia.Como buena madre de familia, se dedica a varios negocios junto a su esposo. Gloria se dedica a la compra y venta de balones de gas. Este trabajo le agrada mucho pues tiene tiempo para cuidar a sus hijos. Es la única comercializadora de la zona, por lo que tiene muchos clientes y recibe muy buenos ingresos ecónomicos.Ahora espera poder aumentar su capital de trabajo para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con KIVA y se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le brindad para seguir adelante, por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas de manera puntual. Gloria, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de más balones de gas para su venta.
texts.en: Gloria is 48 years old and is a straightforward woman.  She lives with her husband Roberto, with whom she has seven children.  She lovingly cares for her children in her own home.  As a good mother, Gloria works in different businesses, along with her husband.  Gloria makes a living buying a selling gas bags and she enjoys this work as she has time to look after her children.  She is the only seller in the area and so has many clients and earns a good income.  Gloria is now hoping to increase her working capital to increase her earnings.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is very happy with the financial support that she is receiving to move forward in life.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  Gloria will invest the 1000 Nuevo Soles in buy more gas bags to sell.

loans.use: to buy gas bags.

loans.name: Deddeh

texts.en: Deddeh is 34 years old and lives in the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single with two children aged 9 and 6 which live at home and attend school. Deddeh completed 12th grade. She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past six years she has been operating her own shop in the local market selling rice, oil, flour, sugar, etc. She sells six days a week from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. She likes her business because she has more customers, and she started this business with money given to her by mother. She used a shared taxi every time to get her goods at her business shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase goods for her business. She plans to build a house for her children. She likes to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her business

loans.name: Jessamin

texts.en:
This is Jessamin, 50, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Raperta, his business partner, and a father to her children. He, together with his wife, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jessamin operates a vegetable growing farm. He grows vegetables and some bananas on their farm.  The farm is located in Cavite, in the highlands  suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. He regularly sells his product to a market, and to the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help him continue the operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for his business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of the farm. 

Jessamin hopes that his business will continue to grow. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week; he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer and farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for buying items like beans, maize flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of cassava, meat, tin tomatoes, bags of onion, fresh tomatoes, and also to hire girls to help pound the “fufu” (starchy vegetable paste) for her.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 55 years old, married, and a mother of seven. Her husband is a carver, carving wooden tables, chairs and beds. He earns insufficient income to meet the family expenses. In order to cover everyday expenditures and educational expenses, more income is required, so Shahnaz contacted BRAC Pakistan and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. Her husband will utilize this loan amount to purchase wood, precious stones, polish, aluminum and carving tools.
 
Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and that it will bring positive changes to his business. Their dream is to maximize their profits from this business and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy wood, aluminum and polish

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling rice in Esiam (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 2 years. Aba is married and has no children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses. Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 41-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 21.  One is currently attending school and lives at home.  Cynthia completed ninth grade before starting her business; she describes herself as a caring person.

She lives and works in Paynesville North, which has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to 'round time marketers', the local term for traders who travel to the interior regions of the country to purchase goods to sell throughout the county.   Because of this, there is a large number of wholesalers operating in the area that distribute to the markets in the county, including supplying the capital city of Monrovia.
 
Cynthia has had a dry goods business for the past four years; she sells sprays, tubs, buckets, etc. She started her business with her mother's help. Cynthia works 12 hours per day at her business, and her greatest challenge is she does not have enough goods to sell. She likes her business because it makes more profit everyday. 

She intends to use the loan to buy more sprays, tubs, buckets, etc.    

Cynthia hopes to build a house one day; and she wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more sprays, tubs, buckets, etc.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 40 year old businessman married to Saveria, a grocer. They are blessed with four school-going children who are eight, six, four and two years old, respectively. Joel has been practicing cash crop farming as a primary business for the past seven years. He also does masonry work and earns an approximate monthly income of KES. 38,000 from his businesses, which he uses to provide for his family. 

He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to cultivate the land and also buy farm inputs for the coming planting season. 


With the expected profit, he will construct a permanent residential house for his family. His hopes and dreams are to build rental houses and educate his children.

loans.use: to cultivate the land  and also buy farm inputs for the coming planting season.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 50-year-old business woman from Liberia.  She is married and has ten children between the ages of 13 and 30.  One is currently attending school and lives at home.  Gloria completed tenth grade before starting her business; she describes herself as a hard-working person.

She lives and works in Paynesville North, which has the largest market in Montserrado County.  The area is home to 'round time marketers', the local term for traders who travel to the interior regions of the country to purchase goods to sell throughout the county.   Because of this, there is a large number of wholesalers operating in the area that distribute to the markets in the county, including supplying the capital city of Monrovia. 

Gloria has had a table business for the last four years, selling pepper, oil, rice, Vita, etc.  She started her business with her mother's help, and she works 12 hours per day at her business.  Her greatest challenge is she does not have enough goods to sell. She likes her business because makes more profit everyday.

She intends to use the loan to buy more pepper, oil, rice, Vita, etc, and she wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.    

Gloria hopes to build a house someday.

loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, rice, Vita, etc,

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 45 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo Miguel y sus 2 hijos en la casa de sus suegros. En estos momentos se encuentra atravesando una crisis económica, pues alquiló un terreno en donde sembró alfalfa, los dueños del terreno vendieron todo el pasto verde. Causando que ella perdiera todo lo invertido pero aún así no se decae. Pues aprendió de este problema razón por la cual ahora es un poco más cuidadosa, pues sembrará alfalfa en su propio terreno agrícola, como es poco, piensa comprar a terceras personas el pasto ya crecido. Ya que su principal ingreso económico se centra en la comercialización de fardos de alfalfa, las cuales diariamente envia a otra ciudad.Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente feliz por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su negocio, por ello se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Lourdes, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Lourdes is 45 years old and is a happy woman.  She lives together with her husband Miguel and their two children in the home of her in-laws.  At this time she is facing an economic crisis.  She rented some land where she planted alfalfa, but the owners of the land sold it while the crop was still green.  This caused her to lose her entire investment, but she is not defeated.  She learned from this experience and now she is a little more careful, thus she will plant alfalfa on her own agricultural land, which is small, and she also plans to buy grown alfalfa from third parties.  Her main source of income focuses on selling bundles of alfalfa, which she sends daily to another city.  This is her third credit with Kiva and she feels happy for the financial support that she receives in order to continue her business.  For that reason she promises to comply with the punctual repayment of the loan.  Lourdes will invest 1000 Soles (Peruvian currency) in the purchase of organic fertilizer in order to feed her crops.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Shalom Sisters Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 32-year-old Patience from Harare. She is married with three children, two of whom are attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Patience is involved in buying and selling kids' shoes and kids' wear. The business has been in operation for seven years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of stiff competition from other sellers.

Patience has requested a loan of $500 to buy new kids shoes' and preparatory clothes for the winter season for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her children to better schools and improve the family's standard of living. In the future, Patience plans to have her own shop in town.

loans.use: to buy kids' shoes for resale

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana, a 49-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband and seven children. Her husband is a tailor by profession. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs. He wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. Rehana has requested a loan from Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine for her husband's work. This will help him to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of clients more professionally. Her husband wants to expand his business if he gets a good amount of profits in the future. Rehana dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Eloy Alfaro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 40  años de edad, está separada pero de esa relación tiene tres hijos de 22, 19  y 12 años de edad, la menor estudian en colegio y vive con ella.

Doña María para salir adelante junto a su hija y darle lo mejor a ella se dedica al comercio, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa,  allí vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, plátanos, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija le ayuda en su trabajo cuando está desocupada de sus tareas del colegio, pero por lo general es Doña María la que mas pasa en su negocio ya que es allí donde le gusta estar ya que allí además de ganarse la vida se entretiene y se entera de las novedades que pasan a su alrededor. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 4 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio que le permite sacar adelante sola a su hija.

Su sueño es que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
The communal bank Eloy Alfaro meets twice a month in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisany. This place is known for its famous Panama hats.

María lives here. She is 40 years old, separated, and from this relationship has three children aged 22, 19, and 12 years old. The youngest is a student and lives with her.

In order to provide for her daughter and offer the best for her María works in commerce. She has a grocery store in her home. There she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, bananas, legumes, vegetables and fruit. She works every day from 6:00AM until 8:00PM and sometimes even later. Her daughter helps her when she is not busy with her homework from school but generally it is María who takes care of the business since it is there where she likes to be as besides making a living she enjoys hearing the neighborhood news. She has been doing this work for four years and is doing very well.

She is going to use this loan to invest in the purchase of groceries to supply her store. She has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because she began her business with her first loan allowing her to bring up her daughter on her own. Her dream is that her daughter becomes a professional.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
This is Teodora, 60, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ceriaco and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teodora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. She also sells fish. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan to help her to continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Teodora hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of having a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and it is there where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Sucayat

texts.en:
Sucayat is 50 years old and married with 2 children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee.

Sucayet has had her own agricultural business for fifteen years already. She has built a greenhouse on a small piece of land, and she is growing vegetables. When her crops are ready she goes out and sells them in the different markets located near her home.
 
In Azerbaijan, there is a daily demand for fruits and vegetables because of traditional meals.

She has already taken out 2 loans from Aqroinvest in past. With a good loan history, she has applied for third loan of 1,900 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat her soil and get a good harvest. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat her soil and get a good harvest.

loans.name: Herminia Andrea

texts.es:
Herminia es una mujer de 46 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Herminia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Gastronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Herminia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas de su ciudad, como el plátano, adicionalmente vende menús variados de platos típicos de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Herminia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su pequeño local, ella desea comprar madera, calaminas, listones y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder tener en mejor estado su local, adicionalmente comprara bebidas e insumos para preparar la comida que vende, así pues Herminia seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Herminia is a 46 year old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her two children, who she loves and who are the principle reason for her life.  She is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts to helping her family get ahead.  She has always been both mother and father to her children.  Sadly due to a lack of economic resources, and the necessity to work, Herminia has not been able to study the professional career of Gastronomy that she would have liked.  In her free time she likes to cook delicious desserts to share with her family.  

On her own initiative, with much hard work and dedication, Herminia works in her small business selling fruits from her city, such as plantains.  She also sells varied set-price meals of traditional dishes from her city.  She works every day for around 12 hours and she believes that things are going well because of her good spices and for the kind way she treats others.

Herminia is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will be able to improve her small restaurant.  She wants to buy wood, corrugated iron, batten, and other items, which will serve to improve her restaurant.  She will also buy drinks and food in order to prepare the meals that she sells.  In this way Herminia will continue working and pushing herself to achieve her great dream of seeing her children become good professionals.

loans.use: To purchase food and to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Pedro Ismael

texts.es: El señor Pedro, hombre humilde y trabajador, toda su vida se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra, cultivando Piña actualmente tiene una manzana de cosecha y requiere de Insumo para darle un optimo  mantenimiento, con este credito que se le ha otorgado comprara: Urea, Triple, Completo, Fertilizantes, etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva le han brindado ya que su economia a mejorado y sus condiciones de vida son distintas.
texts.en:
Pedro is a humble and hardworking man. He has spent his whole life working the land growing pineapples. 

Currently he is cultivating a plot of land and needs supplies to give it optimal care. He will use this loan to buy urea, and fertilizers such as Triple, Completo, etc.

He is thankful for the support from Afodenic and Kiva funds as his financial situation has improved along with his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Pedro pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Mecánica de Mantenimiento, en sus ratos libres le gusta ayudar a su mamá en su tienda de abarrotes y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pedro trabaja en una empresa algodonera, como técnico obrero, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para terminar la construcción de una habitación,  la cual será más segura para que su familia pueda habitar, así pues Pedro seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su casa, así su familia tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 21-year-old man.  He is single and he lives in the city of Pisco with his parents and his siblings.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who really wants to better himself.  Thanks to his efforts and his parents' support, Pedro was able to pursue a technical degree in mechanics and maintenance.  In his free time he likes to help his mom at her grocery store and sometimes he makes delicious noodles with red sauce to share with his family.  

Through his own initiative and with a a lot of hard work and dedication, Pedro works as a technician at a cotton business.  He works every day for around 10 hours and he believes it is going well because he is good at his work and he treats others well.

Pedro is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to improve his home.  He wants to buy construction materials to finish building a room, which will be safer for his family to live in.  Pedro will keep working and applying himself to achieve his greatest dream of finishing construction on his house so that his family can enjoy greater safety and wellbeing.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Victor Armando

texts.es:
Victor es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos,  el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Victor pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Mecánica, en sus ratos libres le gusta trabajar en su taller y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Lomo Saltado para compartir con su familia. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Victor trabaja como en su pequeño negocio de venta de repuestos, adicionalmente brinda servicios de mecánica a vehículos menores, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Victor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su taller, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar la fechada de su taller mecánico, también desea comprar dos vitrinas, las cuales utilizara para exhibir mejor sus repuestos, así pues Victor seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio para tener una tienda de venta de repuestos generales.
texts.en:
Victor is a twenty years old, single, and lives in the city of Pucallpa with his parents and siblings.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who really wants to better himself.  Thanks to his hard work and his parents' support, Victor was able to pursue a technical degree in mechanics.  In his free time he likes to work in his shop and sometimes he makes a delicious lomo saltado, a Peruvian stir-fry, to share with his family. 

Through his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Victor works at his small business selling replacement parts.  He also services small vehicles.  He works every day for around 12 hours and he believes it is going well because his prices are good and he treats people kindly.

Victor is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to improve his workshop.  He wants to buy construction materials to improve the storefront of his mechanic shop.  He also wants to buy display cases he will use to better advertise his spare parts.  Victor will keep working and applying himself to achieve his greatest dream of expanding his business to include a general parts store.

loans.use: to make improvements to his mechanic shop

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of six children. Her husband owns a card-printing shop, which is the only source of income for his family. Currently they are facing a serious loadshedding (power rationing) problem in the area. Because of that, Shazia's husband is unable to meet the demand from his customers on time or to generate a good income. He wants to buy a generator for his business, so he can work easily. For this reason, his wife Shazia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of buying a generator. This will help him to fulfill the needs of customers on time and to continue his work.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for her husband's card-printing shop.

loans.name: Amil

texts.en:
Amil is a 34-year-old young client. He has two children who attend school. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. Amil is growing fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants, and other vegetables and fruit. He says even though this business is very hard, he and his wife have been handling it for five years without any difficulty.
 
Amil grows vegetables and fruit and sells them in the bazaar. His income from selling these items is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as to get more land for cultivation. Amil is looking forward to increased sales in the coming summer because people purchase a lot more fruit.

Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN. This loan is to buy new fertilizer and seeds to help him to grow more vegetables and fruit. He hopes to earn more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history; this is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen. She previously took out a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, and to pay for maintenance on their multicab unit. Her earnings were a big help with their personal, household and business expenses. She would like to apply for another loan, of 10,000 PHP, to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance on their multicab unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Helen hopes for a continuous success of her business and dreams of having a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her multicab unit.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel es un hombre de 50 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su joven hija, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su hijo, ya que Fidel siempre ha sido padre y madre para ella; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Fidel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones de Cerdo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Fidel trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y útiles de escritorio, el tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa donde realiza sus ventas, Fidel trabaja todos los días, puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Fidel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora para su hija, la cual se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas y Fidel desea  brindarle una mejor herramienta de estudios, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran empresario.
texts.en:
Fidel is 50 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona with his young daughter. He loves her and she is main priority in life. She is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic. He puts all his efforts towards bringing up his child, as Fidel has always been father and mother to her. 

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the need to work from a very young age to help his parents, Fidel could not study for a professional career in Civil Engineering, but he wanted to. In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends and sometimes cook the delicious Chicharrones de Cerdo (pork cracklings) to share with his family.

On his own initiative, with a lot of effort and dedication, Fidel works in his small grocery and stationery store. He has a little facility in his home where he makes his sales. Fidel works every day, working approximately 10 hours, and thinks that he is doing well because of good prices and the friendly treatment he offers others.

Fidel is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the support he can buy a computer for his daughter, who is studying to be a professional in business administration. Fidel wants to provide her a better tool for her studies, and he will continue working and striving to achieve his dream of becoming a great businessman.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his daughter to use in her business administration school studies.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La Señora Juana, de 58 años, vive con su esposo , en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo , Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 15  años a la venta de productos alimenticios y también tiene a la venta lo que son cargas de leña.
Doña Juana vende de lunes a domingo en donde sus clientes le visitan todos los días  su negocio está ubicado en el local de su casa.
Doña Juana está solicitando el préstamo para compra de  productos alimenticios como manteca, huevos, aceite, papel higiénico, pollo, carne, embutidos, pastas de tomate, espaguetis y refrescos, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar mas su inventario y por ende sus ganancias, para así poder salir cumplir con sus compromisos. 
Doña Juana su sueño es mantener siempre su negocio. 


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013.
texts.en:
Juana is 58 years old and lives with her husband in their home in a community of San Lorenzo in the Valle Department of southern Honduras.  She has been selling grocery products for 15 years and she also sells bundles of firewood.  

Juana is open Monday through Sunday, with her customers coming to see her every day.  Her business is located in her home.

Juana is asking for a loan to buy grocery products such as lard, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, beef, canned goods, tomato paste, spaghetti, and soft drinks.  With the help of this loan, she hopes to increase her inventory and, accordingly, her profits, so she will be able to meet her obligations.  

Juana's dream is to keep her business going.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013.

loans.use: to buy lard, eggs, oil, toilet paper, chicken, beef, canned goods, tomato paste, spaghetti, and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 44-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business, manufacturing plastic filters, eight years ago. Parveen is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband’s use. He will use the loan to increase his supply of filters, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Parveen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's production of filters.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 42-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and five children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Since 2010, her husband has been running a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family’s needs. Due to the large family size and their low monthly income, they are facing many problems. Her husband needs additional capital for the growth of his business. She has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can invest in her husband’s shop. With the loan, her husband would expand the general store. He would add some more space to it by building one more room. He would also buy a variety of goods, such as rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk and utility items, for his store, to satisfy his clients more professionally and to increase his savings to better the future of his children. The profits would be used to expand the business and pay household expenses. Azra and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her husband's store and to buy  a variety of goods, such as rice, sugar, soap, cereals, milk and utility items, for the store.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
La señora  Celina de  34 años de edad, vive con su esposo  y sus hijos, no tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 04  años al negocio de venta de camarón y pescado  su venta la realiza en los mercados de Tegucigalpa.
Doña Celina viaja con el producto en bus de San Lorenzo que es donde vive hacia Tegucigalpa tres veces por semana  y   en su casa también vende con los amigos y vecinos.
Doña Celina es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de sacar adelante a su familia está solicitando el préstamo para compra de 600 libras de camarón, con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ganancias porque tendrá más producto que vender sus clientes.
Doña Celina es preferida por sus clientes por su buen producto, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y su sueño para este año es empezar a construir su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013
texts.en:
Celina is 34 years old and she lives with her husband and their children.  She does not have her own home.  For the past four years she has been working at her business selling shrimp and fish.  She does her selling in the markets of Tegucigalpa.

Celina travels with her product via bus from where she lives in San Lorenzo to Tegucigalpa three times a week and she also sells at home to her friends and neighbors. 

Celina is a hardworking woman who wants to get her family ahead.  She is asking for this loan to buy 600 lbs of shrimp.  With the help of this loan, she hopes to improve her profits because she will have more product to sell her customers. 

Celina's customers prefer her because she has good product.  She is very happy to keep working with Prisma and her dream for this year is to start construction on her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2013

loans.use: to buy shrimp for her business

loans.name: Agamammad

texts.en:
Agamammad is a 50-year-old Fuzulu refugee, who is married with three sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Together with his wife, Agamammad raises cattle, fattens them, and sells them at a profitable price. He has been in this business for 25 years 

Agamammad sells meat at the central bazaar. In Azerbaijan, there is a high demand for meat, because it is used in a lot of meals, such as kufta (soup), kababs, dolma, etc. He is very kind, caring, and also very energetic in his work. Due to financial difficulties, Agamammad chose not to study beyond high school, but to continue the family tradition and enter this business. 

His income from raising cattle is 195 AZN per month. In order to fully support the family, Agamammad is looking to expand the business and make it very successful. With a good loan history, he has now applied for his fourth loan, this time for 1800 AZN. With this money he plans to buy small calves. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 19 years old, and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married, and has one child. For the past two years, Evelyn has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and bread. 

To help expand her business, Evelyn has asked for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities to sell in her store, such bread and cooking oil. This will help Evelyn to generate greater profits and take good care of her child. Evelyn hopes that in the future she will be able to build a big house for her family. 

Evelyn is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities to sell in her store, such bread and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocío, de 42 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Luis. Ambos tienen 5 hijos a los cuales cuidan en la casa que compró hace 5 años. Sus actividades son diversas, durante algunos dias se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de alfalfa en la plaza de su localidad y otros dias recolecta gran cantidad de pasto, ya sea por ella misma o por terceros. Asimismo se dedica a la siembra de maíz, papa, trigo y alfa, en sus terrenos agrícolas,los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación, a pesar de las actividades que realiza. Paralelamente a ese trabajo, se dedica al cuidado de sus animales entre cuyes y conejos, los cuales comercializa a los clientes que llegan a su misma zona. Ahora desea, abocar todo su tiempo y esfuerzo en mejorar sus condiciones laborales para poder trabajar con más calma y tranquilidad, por ello comenzará a prepararse en los temas de agricultura y ganadería.Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logrará obtener muchas ganancias, todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan.
Rocío, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de maíz y papa.
texts.en:
Rocío, 42 years old, is a trusting woman. She lives with her husband Luis. They have five children and care for them in the house she bought five years ago.

Her activities are diverse. Some days she works buying and selling alfalfa in the neighborhood plaza and some days she gathers large amounts of fodder either by herself or with others. She also works growing corn, potatoes, wheat, and alfa on her agricultural land, which she puts a lot of dedication into, despite all her other projects. Along with this work, she takes care of her animals such as guinea pigs and rabbits, which she sells to customers who visit her area.

Now she wants to devote all her time and effort into improving her working conditions in order to be able to work with more peace and tranquility, so she is beginning to get ready for farming and animal husbandry. This is her third Kiva loan. She is happy as she can earn higher profits, and thanks everyone for the financial support.

Rocío with invest the 2000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her crops of corn and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Crisales

texts.en:
This is Crisales, aged 32, who lives in Silang, Cavite in the Philippines. She is married to Sonny, who is a driver, and they have children together. By the grace of God, she has managed to support their children's schooling. At the moment, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Crisales oversees the operations of their jeepney business (small bus - see footnote). She has a one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which earns  boundary (rent) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts, and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She is planning to expand her business and therefore expects an increase in her business income.  

Crisales dreams of having a better life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work. At the meetings, she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

Footnote: Interestingly, jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and make their microfinance loan repayments.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 33-year-old energetic and diligent woman. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory and she has three kids. 

Due to their low monthly income, Shagufta is passing through a difficult time. She is a well-educated woman and would like to help her husband generate income by opening an academy where she could teach students for a fee. In this way, she would be able to utilize her teaching skills and increase the family's monthly income, which could solve many of her problems. 

With this Kiva loan, she would buy chairs, tables, and necessary furniture for her students. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open an educational academy

loans.name: Faiq

texts.en:
Faiq is a 31-years-old single man who is a Fuzulu refugee. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Faiq is a farmer who grows fruits and vegetables--including tomatoes, potatoes, and eggplant--to sell in the bazaar. He is very kind, caring, and energetic in his work. He chose not to study beyond high school, but instead continued the family tradition through this business. Even though this work is very hard, he and his mother have been handling the business for 5 years without any difficulty. 

His income from these fruit and vegetable sales is 150 AZN. He has plans for future, including his desire to acquire more land for cultivation, to marry, and to have a big family. Faiq has taken two loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, he has applied for third loan of 1800 AZN.

loans.use: to buy more land for cultivation.

loans.name: Senziwe

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! 

This is 44-year-old Senziwe from Bulawayo. She is married with four children, who all go to school.  Senziwe runs a retail business selling clothes and footwear for men, women and children, and blankets and comforters. She buys her stock abroad where items cost between $1 and $20, and she sells them for between $5 and $60. The business has been in operation for one and a half years. 

Senziwe says the main challenges that she faces are the lack of working capital to boost her business, as well as competition from bigger retailers. She has requested a loan of USD 500 to restock, and change some seasonal stock to winter items. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to supplement her household income, as well as meet other expenses and to boost business capacity. 

In the future, Senziwe plans to have a clothing boutique in the central business district, and to have more stalls in the flea market.

loans.use: to buy stock for resale, including clothes and footwear for men, women and children, and blankets and comforters

loans.name: Norlina

texts.en:
Norlina is a 24-year-old woman living in Calabayan, in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is married, and has children.

For the past two years, Norlina has managed a banana production business, earning 5,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) each month. She is now requesting a loan of 3,500 from Kiva's partner, GDMPC microcredit, to buy fertilizer such as manure. 

Norlina hopes to multiply the income from her banana farm this season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 38 years old, and is a hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and two sons, who run a car decoration and spare parts shop. This is the only source of income for her family. They are facing problems in the family business because their current stock of car accessories is almost finished and they have no funds available to purchase more stock. 

Saima has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can continue his business and purchase a new variety of car accessories and decoration kits, like engine parts, alloy rims, car chargers, fog lights, seat covers, neon lights, etc. With the profits of the business, she is going to make arrangements for the marriage of her son and for the expansion of their business.

She is very hopeful that the loan would be a productive one for them and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Granito De Mostaza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “GRANITO DE MOSTAZA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Mercedes  ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia continua trabajando en una empresa pública, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia a la vez continua con su negocio de atención de eventos (catering), la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, leche, azucar entre otros para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de movilidad escolar, alquiler de gruas, docentes y trabajadores de empresas privadas.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo. 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Granito de Mostaza. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

Mercedes is married and has 3 children. She continues working in a public business. Her work is going well and offers both financial and personal satisfaction. At the same time she continues her catering business. She wants to be able to continue woking as she supports her family this way. She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as flour, milk, sugar, and other  items for her business. 

The other members work as school bus drivers, in crane-hire, as teachers, and as employees in private businesses.

The member who appears in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons.

The member is grateful to those who are a part of this dream and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, milk, and sugar among other items for her business

loans.name: Hoeury's Group

texts.en: Hoeury, age 35 and a mother of three children, is from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She makes a living by rice farming on a one-half hectare area. The current business that she has had for five years earns her about 7,500 KHR per day. This is not Hoeury's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She feels confident that she can improve her living conditions better than before after her past successful loan, which she has completely repaid. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent wooden house for her children. She hopes that she can earn more income to maintain her living condition.

loans.use: To build a decent wooden house for her children

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is Daniel, a 53-year-old variety store owner from Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Analyn, with whom he has children, and together they manage their household and operate the business. They both work hard for their family’s future.

Daniel owns and drives a tricycle (meaning, a motorcycle with a sidecar) that can carry up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. He starts working early in the morning and continues until late in the evening. There are times when he drives from the late evening until the wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and members of the local community, and he earns a minimum of Php1200 every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, Daniel is requesting a loan amount of PHP 15,000. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Daniel dreams of being successful in his business and able to give his family a good life. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora  Gregoria   de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 02 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, sus clientes le visitan en su casa.
Doña Gregoria con la ayuda de dos de sus hijas trabaja haciendo tortillas todo los días de lunes a domingo, es una mujer trabajadora que ha tenido varios con Prisma y  a demostrado buen  comportamiento de pago en sus préstamos.
Doña Gregoria está solicitando el préstamo para compra de maíz, leña, cal, con el apoyo de este crédito la señora desea comprar por mayor la materia prima para realizar su negocio  y de esa forma tener mejores ganancias.
Doña Gregoria su sueño es mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2013
texts.en:
Señora Gregoria is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children. She has her own house. For two years she has been working in her business of selling tortillas. Her customers come to her house.
