loans.use: to buy pesticide for her cultivation

loans.name: Pildausa Ruth

texts.en:
Pildausa Ruth works hard to support her family. Pildausa Ruth is married and has a buy and sell accessories business in the Philippines.

Pildausa Ruth requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional accessories to sell.

Pildausa Ruth has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Pildausa Ruth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional accessories to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rosalina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Nary is 20 years, married and has one son who is still small. To make a living and support her family, Nary and her husband have been farming rice and pineapple as a primary business. The current business earns her family about US $10 per day to meet the family’s need.  
 
This is the third micro loan for Nary with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to cultivate her rice and pineapples to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a hog raising business in the Philippines.

Rosalinda requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 8 years now.

Rosalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel ángel vive en la cuida de Managua trabaja en una institución del estado desde hace 9 años casado hacer su mayor esfuerzo para sacar adelante su familia.

Miguel está haciendo la solicitud de su crédito para solventar  pagos de universidad.
Agradeciendo mucho a los inversionistas de kiva porque gracias  a los crédito obtenidos ha ido mejorando sus condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel lives in the cityof Managua. He has been working for a state institution for the past 9 years. He is married and works hard to support his family.

Miguel is requesting a loan to make payments for university classes.

He is grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the loans he has obtained that that he has been improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is a 44-year-old married woman from Talibon,Bohol. She has 2 children ages 4 and 8 respectively. She's involved in fishing. She sells fish, crabs and sea shells to customers in the community. Her husband is a fisherman. She sells her husband's catch to earn a living. 

She requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy a crab cage, paint and rice. In the future, Dina would like to expand her fishing business to provide her family with good food and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a crab cage, paint and rice

loans.name: Kunduzkhon

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Kunduzkhon works hard to support her family. She has a clothes sales business in the Tajikistan.  She has had this business for 18 years and in this way she earns money for a living. 

Kunduzkhon has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from Imon International organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, she hopes to improve her business in order to provide good living conditions for the family. 

Kunduzkhon is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to buy women and children's clothes for the new season. In order to make her house safer and improve her standard of living, she will continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: “TO BE A SUCCESSFUL BUSINESS LADY.”

loans.use: to buy women and children's clothes for the new season

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is a 55-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has 3 children ages 22, 23 and 25 years old respectively. She raises hogs. She has been raising hogs for more than 10 years now. Aside from hog raising, Nicanora also sells fresh eggs to customers as an additional income.  

She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy 20 sacks of hog grower feed and 50 cartoons of egg trays. In the future, Nicanora would like to expand her piggery business in order to provide her family with proper diets and to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of hog grower feed and 50 cartoons of egg trays

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna is a 45-year-old married woman from Talibon,Bohol. She has 2 children ages 14 and 13 years old respectively. She's involved in seaweed farming. She has been in seaweed farming for 7 years. To be able to sustain her seaweed livelihood, Meraluna requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more seaweed seedlings, bamboo sticks and straw to increase the volume of seaweeds yield. 

In the future, Meraluna would like to expand her seaweed farming business to sustain her family with proper food and a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings, bamboo sticks and straw

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 5-children. Her husband owns an electronic goods shop which is the only source of income for the family. He wants to purchase fans, a washing machine and a television for his business. Therefore Shabana has requested  a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. With the profits expected from this loan, she intends to start a tailoring business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fans, a washing machine, and a television to resell them.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur and his family live in Vanadzor. Artur is 44 years old. He has two daughters; the eldest one is married and she lives separately with her family and the second daughter is a student of Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the department of Foreign Languages, where she studies at the paid division. Artur’s wife is unemployed. So he together with his wife are engaged in farming. They have a barn near their house, but during the summer months Artur keep his cattle in pastures located in the village Berd in Lori region. All the hay for his cattle, Artur mows and gathers himself. Artur says that farming is very profitable for his family. They sell meat, milk, cheese and butter at the Vanadzor wholesale markets.

Artur asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to purchase cattle to enlarge the number of his cattle.  The income from this venture he will use for the needs of his family, and he will also be able to pay for his daughter’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 34-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, and the father of a 1 month old child. He's involved in hog raising. He has been raising hogs for almost 1 year. Due to lack of capital to finance his piggery business, Edwin requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feed and pig supplements for the pigs to grow healthy so he can be able to sell them on time to meet the family's daily expenses. In the future, Edwin would like to invest in another business venture to support his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and pig supplements

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
El señor Carlos José de 37 años es una agricultor que esta felizmente casado y tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, el reside en una comunidad llamada Rio Abajo a unos 8 km al noroeste de la ciudad de Condega la cual esta ubicada a unos 35 km al norte de Estelí, la cabecera departamento. Este cliente tiene unos 10 años de residir en esa dirección y la casa donde vive es propia.

El señor Carlos se dedica a la labores agrícolas desde hace mas de 22 años y se dedica a la producción de hortalizas tales como tomate, chiltomas, entre otros. El tiene su pequeña unidad productiva donde siembra sus cultivos todos los años ya que es esta su única fuente de ingreso que el tiene para la mantención de su núcleo familiar

El se presento nuevamente a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el objetico de solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para asistir  media manzanas de chiltomas que sembrara, la inversión que el hará es en la compra de insumos tales como son los abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas entre otros, que son esenciales para una buena producción.

El se muestra muy agradecido con Ceprodel por la ayuda financiera que le a facilitado ya que sus resultados han sido positivos, atreves de las políticas de la superación de la pobreza que maneja Ceprodel para con sus cliente, el señor Carlos dice que de ser aprobado este crédito podrá asistir a sus cultivos y lograr tener una buena producción y por ende buenos ingresos para tener un mejor nivel de vida que darle a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos José is 37 years old. He is a farmer who is happily married and has 2 children who are school age. He lives in a town called Rio Abajo, 8 kilometers northeast of the city of Condega, which is located 35 km north of Estelí, the capital of the department. He has been living at his address for 10 years and owns the house where he lives.

Carlos has been working in agriculture for more than 22 years. He farms vegetables such as tomatoes and sweet peppers, among others. He has a small piece of land where he plants his crops every year, since this is his only source of income for supporting his family.

He has come to the office of Ceprodel again with the goal of requesting a new loan to help with half a manzana [unit of measure for land] of sweet peppers that he will plant. He will buy inputs such as manure, fertilizers, and herbicides, among other things, that are essential for good production.

He is very grateful to Ceprodel for the financial support they have provided him because the results have been positive. Through the poverty reduction policies that Ceprodel manages for its borrowers, Carlos says that if he is approved for this loan, he could help out his crops and achieve a good production, which would mean a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for inputs such as manure, fertilizers, and labor to cultivate sweet peppers.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en:
Mwanahamis lives in Kilifi, north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and blessed with three children. She is a food vendor. She started selling fried potatoes on the road until she became stationed at one place.

She knew about Milango through friends. She now seeks a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy wheat flour, sugar and flour. Income raised from the loan will help her to raise her standard of living. She also dreams of buying land and starting to farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
This is Rose’s group made up of three hardworking, responsible women and a man, who are part of the main group called Promise. 

Gifty, 46, is married to a driver and they have one child who is 14 and in school. She decided to go into selling enamel bowls, blenders, rice and beans because people of Teshie prefer these items which give her more profit. 

She desires to own a very big wholesale depot store as this will earn her more profit. The loan sought will be used to buy enamel bowls, blenders, rice and beans, and in this way offer her customers better service. She needs GHS 2,000 to be able to expand her business.

They need GHS 6,300 to be able buy more and serve their customers better.

loans.use: To buy enamel bowls, blenders, rice and beans, and in this way offer her customers better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another camera and employ someone at his station

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles lives in Changamwe near Mombasa, Kenya. He is married with a six-month-old baby. He sells charcoal. This has been his business for the last year. Friends introduced him to Milango so that he could access credit. Charles, 30, now seeks a loan of 83,450 Kenya shillings to help him buy a motorbike for transporting his goods. The challenge he faces in his business is the disturbances by the municipal council. Early preparation for school fees is his aim.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married with three children. Two of the three attend school. Mariam, 31, has been selling charcoal for the last four years. She also owns a motorbike to transport people for an income.

She learned of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy 10 sacks of charcoal as stock. Her ambition is to expand and open other branches of the business. The challenge she faces is during the rainy season charcoal is very expensive, which leads to really high prices. She thinks accessing these loans should be made paperless. She doesn’t enjoy filling out these forms.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this, he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Samina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Samina is so very thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tea tree seedlings.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Two of them attend school. For three years, she has been running two retail shops. She sells Maize flour, beans and cooking oil just to mention a few of the items. 

She learned about Milango through friends and in order to access credit, she joined. Now she seeks a loan of 31,500 Kenya shilling to be able to buy five bundles of maize flour, a 50 kg sack of rice and cooking oil as stock for her shop. She wants to grow the shops to a wholesale shop. The major challenge she faces is inflation effects.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 51-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five grown children. She runs a retail store business. She sells various commodities like noodles, canned goods, soaps, sugar, cooking oil and eggs. Aside from operating a retail store, she also operates an eatery. She cooks meals to customers to earn additional income. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy various items like flour, soft drinks, vegetables and meat to fill her store with stock to avoid a shortage. In the future, Elizabeth would like to expand her business to be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy various items like flour, soft drinks, vegetables and meat to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a camera and desktop computer

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar, age 41, is running a food stall in her street with the support of her husband. She makes delicious ‘Dahi Bhallay’, which is a dish consisting of balls made from ground lentils, deep fried and served in a yogurt sauce. She has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within her town. With the increase in the price of vegetables and lentils, she was barely able to produce enough to make a good sale. Two years ago, Kousar borrowed funds for her business from Kashf Foundation, hoping to revive it. Today, she has been successful in consistently making sales and earning a healthy revenue from the business. In order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices. For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married to a farmer. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as to save for a rainy day. Efua currently sells cassava and plantains in Asafora (near Cape Coast). With over five years of experience in this trade, Efua sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thu, her loan will be used to buy more cassava and plantains, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Efua wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy more cassava and plantains to sell

loans.name: Ma. Eloisa

texts.en:
This is Ma. Eloisa. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of Green Barley. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of Green Barley. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to fulfill her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Eloisa dreams of being profitable in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To increase the stock of Green Barley needed for her business.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun is a local villager from Takeo province’s Samrong district, Cambodia. She is 42 years old and a mother blessed with two children. Nowadays, only one son is still in school. For her, 3 hectares of rice cropping and working at a construction site are the main sources of her family income. From the current business that she has been involved with for ages, she has returns of about 33,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day. 

This is the second loan for Lun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid the past loan already, and it has enabled her to support her living in a gradual pace; especially, she can buy decent food for her family and keep her kid in school. 

Now, her son wants to pursue his bachelor's degree, specializing in banking. Therefore, she is applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s tuition fee. She hopes that her son can obtain a good job after graduation to support the family.

loans.use: To pay her son’s tuition fee.

loans.name: Borin's Group

texts.en:
Borin, 36, is married living with her family in a village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He has three children, all of whom is dependent on him and still in school. For the last seven years, Borin and his wife have been raising pigs and distilling alcohol. The current business earns them about 50,000KHR per day to meet the family’s need but they can manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 
Borin’s group consists of two members and he is the sixth cycled client and completely paid back the past loans. The past loans which he successfully repaid have helped him support his family with sufficient foods. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Borin, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy piglets and pig feeds for nourishing them. He hopes to fatten his pigs so as to sell them for a good price to better off his living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Chanly

texts.en:
Residing in the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province, Chanly is 23 years old and he is single. He earns a living through working as an electrician in the local area. Having been in this job for three months, Chanly is able to earn about US$5 per day and he manages to save about US$3 each day after daily expenses. 

Chanly has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, he is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund for a US$400 loan to cover the entire tuition fee for him to study electrical engineering at a local institute. He hopes this loan will enable him to keep studying until graduation in order to get a good job so as to support himself and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fee

loans.name: Savae's Group

texts.en: A citizen from a rural village of Battambang Province’s Thmor Koul district, Savae is 49 years old and married. She has four children. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for 29 years. Savae’s Group consists of two members, and she is new to VisionFund for this loan cycle. She is leading her group to apply for a loan from VisionFund. As the leader, Savae is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland, and she will spend part of it for plowing the field. She hopes to grow healthy rice, to increase her family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and pay for plowing the field.

loans.name: Moern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Moern is 47 years old and married. To support her family, she has been farming rice on five hectares of farmland for 15 years and she supplements her family’s income by working for others for a fee. From the current business, she can earn about 26,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for her future needs.

This is the group loan for Moern’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she is a fourth-cycle client. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Moern wants to use a portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to timely grow her rice so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Phy is 37 years old and married. She has five children, but nowadays only one kid still relies on her as this daughter is still in school.

For the sake of the entire household, she does rice growing on a four-and-a-half hectare area and plants rubber tree seedlings as the main source of income. Phy has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past two loan cycles and she fully repaid the loans. The past loans have enabled her to upgrade her living status at a good pace.

For this new loan, she will spend her loan portion to buy necessary materials to support her rubber tree seedlings and to purchase fertilizer for her farmland. She highly hopes that she can earn more income to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to support her rubber tree seedlings

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Prem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Prem is a 57-year-old married mother of four children. Rice farming and Cassava planting have been the main sources of her family’s income for 32 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs and manage to save about 13,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Prem’s group consists of two members who live in the same village and she has been with VisionFund for three cycles. The past loans have helped Prem better support her family members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. Prem, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice and cassava fruitfully and healthily and also hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: Canh was born in 1961. She has two children. Her son is in sales. Her daughter is married. She and her husband make and sell food to earn a living. He earns about 3,000,000 VND and Canh earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. She has done this work for seven years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is a lack of capital to enlarge her food stall. Her dream is for her food to be famous. This loan is one of steps to help her reaching to this dream. Canh is a dynamic and hard-working woman. She does this job because she is good at cooking. She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,080,000 VND to buy ingredients to cook food in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook food in her restaurant.

loans.name: Palmira

texts.en: Palmira is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She is running a business selling vegetables in front of a main road and she is also planting vegetables. She is making a good income from selling vegetables and she wants to buy more fertilizer with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She started her business in 1993 with her own working capital of 70.00

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for Vegetables

loans.name: Judith Group

texts.en:
Judith is the leader of the group with her members handling different businesses. She is 40 years old and lives in Purok Makiangayon Maningcol, Ozamiz City. She is happily married and has five school-aged children. 

As a her source of income she does fish vending, from which she earns PHP 9,000 a month. Judith reached out to PMPC to ask for a loan to buy five (5) additional "banyeras" (big basin, usually used as the container or measurement of large amount of fishes caught in commercial fishing). She wanted to expand her fish vending activity and earn more out of it. Judith wants to save money to support the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional "banyeras" of fish

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Hen is aged 31 years. She has two children to take care of and they are still in school. To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer for ten years and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee to better feed their children. The current business earns her about 54,000 KHR per day. 

Hen’s previous group consisted of four members and she is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his son appears in his Kiva profile photo.

Atta is a 52-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with two sons and two daughters. Atta works as a local sector employee with a low wage, which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

Atta is requesting a 1,200 USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new home appliances in order to improve the living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer Atta a comfortable life so he can enjoy living in his house. Atta would like to take a bigger loan in the future and buy more furniture and home appliances.

loans.use: to buy some necessary home appliances

loans.name: Boilen Lom Group

texts.en:
“I was shattered and down ten years ago when my father passed away,” says Martha, who is one of the members of the “Boilen Lom Group”.  She is the featured borrower. She is on the extreme left with her hand raised in the picture. 

The group members reside in a village which is about 40 kms away from the capital city of Manipur, in the northeastern side of India. With younger siblings to take care of and a weary mother, life was not easy for Martha. Her friends motivated her to join the group, and she availed the loan and started her own retail shop.

She runs a variety shop at the local market, which is about a three-minute walk from home. She started her business by selling mobile recharge vouchers and gradually refilled her recharge voucher shop with daily essential items like detergent soap, detergent powder, shampoo sachets, etc. for sale.  The shop is also refilled with candies, chocolates, sweets and other cosmetic items. 

She is making a fine profit and also started saving. She gets the stock from the main city market and also from people who trade items through the Army Canteen. She says it is profitable to purchase stock from the Army Canteen. The profit is high because the goods are purchased at a low cost price and can be sold at a market price. 

She wanted to use the savings that she manages for refilling her shop with different items. She says the amount is small; therefore she was still waiting for another few months. God still favors her because when she was really in need for a capital amount, Kiva came into the limelight.

With the assistance of a Kiva loan, and together with her small savings, she is planning to purchase women’s wraparound skirts exported from the neighbouring states like Mizoram, Nagaland and Meghalaya. She says the main costume for women in the state is wraparound skirts, which she believes is a good trade for earning. It will not be a difficult business because the market is large in respect to women’s wraparound skirts. 

Martha says, “It is a wonderful experience for me that people from far-flung countries help us in our needs. Thanks to Kiva and may God bless.”

loans.use: to purchase exported women's wraparound skirts from the neighbouring states, sell them, and make more savings.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Shehnaz is a 51-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has ten kids, and her husband has been operating an automobile workshop for 25 years. They are facing financial problems because of their low monthly income. Shehnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to invest in her husband’s business, so that their income and savings will be increased. The main purpose of loan is for her husband to buy new tools for repairing and automobiles and tuning them up. His customer base would be increased if he had the latest equipment and tools. In the future, with the profits, he wants to expand his workshop by adding some more space to it. Shehnaz is very hopeful that this loan could solve many problems of her family, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: to purchase automobile repairing tools

loans.name: Bahiya

texts.en: Bahiya is a 39-year-old married lady. She is supporting a family of seven with the help of her husband, who is an electrician. Bahiya makes hand-made soaps and bath sponges from natural materials. Bahiya promotes her products by participating in local bazaars, which bring her a supportive income. Now Bahiya is applying for a loan to buy more material and ingredients for making more bath sponges with different sizes and more soaps.

loans.use: to buy more material and ingredients for making more soaps and bath sponges of different sizes

loans.name: Suhaib

texts.en: Suhaib is a 21-year-old single man. He has two brothers and one sister. Suhaib is a third-year university student majoring in business management at a governmental university. He wants to work in the banking field after graduation, but now Suhaib is applying for an educational loan to pay for his next semester's registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester's registration fees.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en: Jomar peacefully lives with his wife and two children in Sto. Domingo. He is 39 years old and manages a small piggery in their village. He fattens and breeds hogs to sell. He is generates about PHP 5,000 per hog. In order to buy vaccines and medicines for his hogs, Jomar is applying for a loan of PHP 30,000. With the loan, he believes that his hopes and dreams for his business will become realities. He also wants to send his children for college educations.

loans.use: to buy vaccines and medicines for his hogs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is married with seven children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. Evelyn is a farmer and she manages a corn production business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 17 years. Every month she earns 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this work. Recently, she borrowed 7,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, Evelyn hopes to see her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 34 years old, married and had two children. Her spouse is a farmer, who is always busy planting and harvesting corn to sell. She needs to sustain her crops with farm inputs so that she will harvest them profitably. But she has insufficient funds now, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. She will buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides) used in farming. 

In the future, Irene hopes to keep achieving good sales and income to lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs (fertilizers and insecticides)

loans.name: Crestina

texts.en:
Crestina is a 52-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is the mother of a 23-year-old son. She is engaged in fishing. She sells fish, crabs, shrimp and sea shells. She has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years. Fishing is the source of the family's livelihood. Her husband is a fisherman.

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing nets to  increase the volume of their catch. In the future Crestina would like to expand her business out of the profits and  to be able to purchase a pump (motor) boat that is beneficial to the fishing business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials

loans.name: Ma. Rowena

texts.en:
This is Ma. Rowena, 20, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She has a child living with her. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Rowena operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and resell them to foundries like factories and others of the like. Ma. Rowena's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 700 in sales everyday.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rowena dreams of having other stalls for her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a candle maker from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol in the Philippines. She is a married woman and a mother of three children. 

Catherine is asking for a loan to buy materials for candle-making like candle wax, yarn, wicks, and others. With this, she will be able to make more candles to sell. 

Catherine hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy materials for candle-making like candle wax, yarn, and wicks.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: A local inhabitant in her mid 40s, Mom is a mother of two schoolchildren. For her, one and half hectares of cassava growing and one hectare of rice farming are the main sources of her income. She has been involved in her current business for ages and is able to earn up to 23,000 KHR per day. Two loan cycles ago was her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She succeeded in repaying her past loan wisely to upgrade her living conditions at a gradual pace. Now, she is applying for a new loan to lease a plot of farmland for growing more cash crops.. Additionally, she will spend some portion of her loan to pay for labor costs, and to buy rice seed plus potash. She hopes that this purchase will support her business on time and increase her income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To lease a plot of farmland to grow more cash crops

loans.name: Sherly's Group

texts.en:
Sherly is 50 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She lives in South Mapang, Rizal in the Philippines. To make a living, Sherly does home service manicure/pedicure. She has been in this business for 3 years earning a monthly income of 3200. Sherly is requesting a loan to be used to purchase piglets and feeds as her new business venture.

Sherly is a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 4 years, and is a leader of the 2-member group, although they have separated responsibility.

loans.use: To purchase 3 piglets and 2 sacks of feeds

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est constitué de quatre  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles  polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans Kalaban Coro qui est un chef lieu d’une commune dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché du quartier. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (Ails, Maggi, Gombos sec  …) et des légumes (Tomate, aubergine, choux…) Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  décident  de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mamou (la 1ème femme à extrême gauche) est une vendeuse de légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 corbeilles de tomate fraiche et 5 sacs de choux pommés. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako avec les forains de divers horizons tels que Kati, Sikasso et environnants de Bamako selon le plus offrant. La revente se fait  au comptant  au marché du quartier à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mamou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of four married women, most of whom live in polygamous families. On average, they are 38 and have five children. They all live in Kalaban Coro, which is the administrative centre of an area in Kati (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other through being neighbours, relations and traders at the local market.

The members of the group are involved in the small-scale trading of garnishes (garlic, Maggi condiments, dried okra, etc.) and vegetables (tomatoes, aubergine, cabbages, etc.). In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Mamou (pictured on the far left) sells vegetables. She will use her loan to buy ten baskets of fresh tomatoes and five sacks of cabbages. She buys her supplies at a market in Bamako from stallholders who come from places such as Kati, Sikasso and the area around Bamako, according to the best offers. She then sells on her goods to individuals at her local market. The majority of her customers are women. 

Mamou hopes that with this loan she can make an average of 30,000 CFA francs per month, which she will use to reinvest in the business and meet her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Marame's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué  de vingt six  femmes qui habitent le même village et ont comme principales activités l'agriculture et le commerce.

La représentante du groupe, Fama a bénéficié de 5 prêts du compte externe qu'elle a toujours remboursé sans difficultés, elle est mariée âgée de 53 ans et mère de cinq enfants.Elle s'active dans le petit commerce.Elle a une bonne expérience.Sur la photo elle est à gauche habillée en rose.


Elle achète ses légumes (carottes, navets,oignons, aubergines, gombos etc.....)dans les marchés hebdomadaires de Ngouye Mbeut et Keur Momarsarr pour revendre au niveau de son village.


Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des légumes à revendre et un bélier pour embouche ovine et ainsi espérer se faire beaucoup de revenus.
texts.en:
This group consists of 25 women who live in he same village and practice farming and commerce. 

They are represented by Ndéye, who previously benefited from five loans from the external account, which she repaid without difficulty. She is the 53-year-old married mother of five children. Her activity is small trade. She has extensive experience in this field. In the photo, she is on the left, dressed in pink.

She buys vegetables (carottes, turnips, onions, eggplants, okra, etc.) at the weekly markets of Ngouye Mbeut and Keur Momarsarr to sell in her village. 

She plans to use her loan to buy vegetables to sell and a ram for fattening. This should help to bolster her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetable for resale and a ram for fattening

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two partners, namely Rita and Christiana, both residing in Dansoman. They have been together as a group from 2012 till now and are doing very well. They are a bread baker and a maize (corn) seller respectively. 

Rita is a 31-year-old bread baker and seller. She is married to Samuel, a 35-year-old baker, too. This has been her work for the past seven years and she is doing very well. Because of her integrity and frankness, all her customers have her at heart. 

Rita has been taking loans from ID Ghana since 2012 and she is in her third loan cycle with ID-Ghana. She has taken out two loans and has fully repaid both.  On her third loan, she is requesting GHS 1,000 to help her buy flour and other ingredients to bake bread and sell to customers. 

The two women need an amount of GHS 1,500 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around their community.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients to bake bread to sell to customers.

loans.name: Solidarité Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Solidarité est constitué de quatre  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 34ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Coro qui est un chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché du quartier. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de jus, d’oignons, des produits cosmétiques (tubes de crème de peaux, mèches, …) et des produits divers (sucre, thé, café, savon, …). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe  décident de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Astan (la   2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse d’oignon dans le marché du quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 330 kg d’oignon. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché avec les forains de Niono. La revente se fait  au comptant  au marché du quartier à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Astan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Tout comme les autres membres du groupe, Madame Astan a pour objectif d’acheter une parcelle à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
The Solidarité group is made up of four married women, most of whom live in polygamous families. On average, they are 34 and have three children. They all live in Kalaban Coro, which is the administrative centre of an area in Kati (the second administrative region of Mali). 

They know each other through being neighbours, relations and business partners at the local market. The members of the group are involved in small-scale businesses selling juice, onions, cosmetics (tubes of skin cream, hair extensions, etc.) and various other products (sugar, tea, coffee, soap, etc.). 

In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Astan (the woman standing second from the left) is a well-known onion seller at the local market. She is hoping to use her loan to buy 330 kg of onions. She buys her supplies at the grand market from stallholders from Niono. She then sells on her goods to individuals at the local market. The majority of her customers are women. 

Astan hopes that with this loan she can make an average of 40,000 CFA francs per month, which she will use to reinvest in the business and provide for her family. Like the other members of the group, Astan’s ambition is to buy a plot of land to use for housing.

loans.use: to buy onions.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 63 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urcos pero actualmente vive en la ciudad Gamitana, ella continua dedicándose a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo yuca, maíz, arroz y otras cosas, ella también continua dedicándose a la compra y venta de madera.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Isabel en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de la agricultura entonces va comprar semillas y fertilizantes. 

Isabel es integrante del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Isabel, 63, lives in a common-law marriage and has five children. She was born in the city of Urcos, but lives now in Gamitana. Isabel is still working in agriculture; she has several plots where she grows different things, such as cassava, corn and rice. She also sells clothes and wood. She has been doing this for some years now and does very well thanks to her hard work.

This time, Isabel is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She will buy seeds and fertilizers. Isabel is a member of communal bank “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” [Gamitana’s New Dawn], part of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca, de 49 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Arturo y 3 de sus 5 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó desde hace 27 años.Tiene 18 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales y en el cultivo de la papa, zanahoria, maíz y alfalfa,toda su familia participa activamente  en estas actividades, es por eso que en las mañanas lleva a sus animales al campo para que se alimenten con alfalfa , después de engordar a sus animales los vende , pero por ahora se concentra en la siembra pues ya tiene pedidos para la capital del país.Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA, se siente feliz pues en este tiempo logró obtener muchas ganancias y todo gracias al apoyo económico que le brindan. Por ello promete cumplir con el pago de las cuotas de manera puntual. Francisca, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Francisca, 49, is a hardworking woman. She lives together with her husband Arturo and three of her five children. She takes care of them in a house she inherited twenty-seven years ago. Francisca has been raising animals and growing potato, carrots, corn and alfalfa for eighteen years. The whole family works in this activity. She takes her animals every morning so that they can eat the alfalfa and once they have fattened, she sells them. However, she is focused now in her crops, since she has some orders from the capital.

This is Francisca’s third loan with Kiva. She feels happy because she has managed to make good profits during this time; all thanks to the financial support she is given.  This is why she promises to pay the installments on time. Francisca will use the 1,000 soles [PEN] to buy compost to nurture her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Elisa tiene 27 años y tiene una relación de unión de libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Pilcopata pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Atalaya, ella continua trabajando en la ciudad de Atalaya y con la venta de comida y venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites, gaseosas, agua mineral y entre otros. 

Elisa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería por mayor como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, bolsas de golosinas y otras cosas más para poder  abastecer su pequeña tienda. 

Elisa es integrante del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” de la Asociacion Arariwa en la selva del Perú.
texts.en:
Elisa is 27 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has a child. She was born in the city of Pilcopata but lives now in Atalaya, where she works selling food and staple products such as rice, sugar, oil, beverages and mineral water.

This time, Elisa is requesting a loan to buy supplies in bulk, like rice and sugar in sacks, bags of sweets and other things she needs to stock her store.

Elisa is a member of communal bank “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” [Gamitana’s New Dawn], part of Asociación Arariwa in the jungle area of Peru.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk, such as rice, sugar and sweets.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. Over time, she has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

Kousar has three children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, a good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. 

This is Kousar's second year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support of it. Now she requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) to purchase another buffalo. She hopes to increase the production capacity of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Asafora (near Cape Coast). 

Aba has been involved in this enterprise for 5 years. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a farmer. 

The proceeds from Aba's business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Aba wants to use the loan to increase her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years to support her husband. Together with her husband, Saima manages their household while operating a business. Saima is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Due to lack of funds, Saima unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani Rupees (PKR) from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy spools of threads in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and ribbons. This will help Saima to increase revenue so that she may able to generate a better source of income. 

Saima is in her third loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers and ribbons.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Aba is a successful businesswoman. 

Aba operates a local chop bar in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 10 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Aba uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase more ingredients for her tasty local dishes, helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her tasty local dishes, helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 57 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Luis, su esposo desde hace 26 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 28 años.Todos los días camina largos tramos, para llegar a sus terrenos agrícolas, alli siembra alfalfa, habas, maíz, zanahoria y papa.Cuenta con 18 años de experiencia en el rubro y en cada cosecha comercializa sus sembríos en una ciudad cercana, donde los comerciantes mayoristas de un reconocido mercado comprar los alimentos que producen la tierra que cuida Rosa. Pero como es una mujer muy comprometida con el trabajo en el campo, también se dedica al trabajo de peón en otros sembríos, dedica este tiempo en sus horas libres, ya que de esa manera puede ver sus sembríos y no dejarlos de lado. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes y burros, los primero le sirve para alimentar a sus familia y vender su carne cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica apremiante, lo segundo lo utiliza para carga.Este es el tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente feliz por el apoyo financiero que recibirá para continuar en su negocio.Rosa, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
57-year-old Rosa is a hard-working woman who lives with Luis, her husband of 26 years.  The couple have two children who they care for in their own home which they bought 28 years ago.  Every day, Rosa walks long stretches to arrive at her farmland where she sows alfalfa, beans, corn, carrots and potatoes.  She has 18 years experience in this line of work and, every harvest time, she sells her crops in a nearby city where wholesale buyers from a well-known market come and buy the food produced on the land that Rosa cares for.  However, as she is a woman who is very dedicated to her farming work, Rosa also works as a day laborer on other people's crops.  She does this in her free time as it allows her to keep an eye on her crops too and not neglect them. She also raises animals such as guinea pigs and donkeys.  She uses the former to feed her family and sells their meat whenever she finds herself in financial difficulty.  She uses the latter for carrying loads.  

This is Rosa's third loan from Kiva and she feels happy to be receiving this financial support as it will enable her to continue in her business.  Rosa will invest the 3,000 soles she has requested in buying organic fertilizers with which to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, different barriers and ice cream for resale in his stall.

loans.name: Kishver

texts.en:
Kishver is a 39-year-old vigorous and married woman. She has been in the business of hand-embroidery for a period of about two years. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a salesperson in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well.

Kishver’s embroidery patterns are very popular in her locality. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand without fail. She shared her dream of opening her own shop in the market to show her worth.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna has been engaged in a cattle-breeding business for many years. Susanna is a mother of three school-age children. Together with her husband, Susanna keeps a cow and three oxen. She milks the cow and produces cheese while her husband sells the cheese at the local market.

This is the sole income for the family. This is why Susanna and her husband work hard to have a stable income and cover their children’s' daily costs. By applying for this loan, Susanna wants to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock. This is very important for her to enlarge the production of cheese and gather more income for the family.

Susanna also owns a plot of agricultural land where she grows different type of trees such as peach, apricot, cherry and nut. She dreams of having a big farm and works hard to make her dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any kind of formal education. Yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Ekua prepares and sells kenkey, a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough that is wrapped in banana leaves, in her village of Asafora, which is near Cape Coast. She has been doing this business for about 15 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have nine children. 

Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall kenkey sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize.

loans.name: Robi

texts.en:
Robi is a very hardworking lady and the mother of three children. She excels in her work of stitching to support the needs of the family as her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the expenses of their household, including the educational needs of the children. 

Robi has become famous in her town for stitching fine clothes. She has now requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a high-quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads and packs of buttons, zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Even though Ama grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Ama is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells Banku for a living.  Banku is a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish and consistent paste. She primarily sells her Banku in Asafora (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 10 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 5 children.

Ama has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her Banku. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity, so she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty Banku. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty Banku

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Grace is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cassava dough in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years.

Grace is married and has 6 children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

Grace will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales

loans.name: Fehmeeda

texts.en:
Fehmeeda, age 53, is a hardworking housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a furniture shop, which is the only source of income for the family.

Fehmeeda is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase wood for manufacturing furniture. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. Fehmeeda hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wood for manufacturing furniture

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 42-year-old married woman who lives with her four children. For the past ten years, she has been running a school café (canteen) nearby her house. She offers a variety of food items at reasonable prices to students and makes a reasonable amount of income through her business. She initiated her business to support her husband financially.

At this time she is asking for a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy stock of food items including juices, biscuits, sweets and mineral water. It will help her to meet the demands of her customers time after time.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle, with a good repayment history. With this loan she would be able to generate more revenue, which will be used in meeting her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock of food items including juices, biscuits, sweets and mineral water

loans.name: Kula

texts.en:
Kula lives and works in St. Paul, which is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Kula is 34 years old and married with four children between 2 and 15. They are in school and live at home. For the past four years Kula has been operating a table business where she sells rice, pepper, oil, etc. She says that sometimes the buying goes slowly. Kula says she started this business by selling around in the communities with the little goods she could afford, and learned this way of selling from her friends. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, etc. for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa is single and has 4 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Adwowa is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Asafora (near Cape Coast). 

She has been actively involved in this business for about 2 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Adwowa uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwowa plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Hinviton Group

texts.fr: HINVITON est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. La représentante du groupe du nom de Akouavi F. Omonlda N. (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 35 ans. Akouavi F. Omonlda N. a très peu fréquenté l’école. Akouavi F. Omonlda N. est divorcée avec un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. Akouavi F. Omonlda N. vit avec son enfant. Akouavi F. Omonlda N. assure seule les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à cela, Akouavi F. Omonlda N. vend des friperies( habits)à son domicile depuis deux ans. Akouavi F. Omonlda N. s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses, Akouavi F. Omonlda N. sollicite ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe HINVITON, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: HINVITON is a group composed of three persons who live together. The representative of the group, Akouavi F. Omonlda N. (seen with her hand raised in the photo) is 30 years old. She did not attend much schooling. She is divorced and has one child whom she takes care of, who attends school. She lives with her child, and takes her of her family's needs. In order to do so, she has been selling second hand clothes from her home for the past two years. She stocks up at the market in Benin. In order to better respond to the requests from an increasing customer based, Akouavi F. Omonlda N. is asking for her second loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the HINVITON. The previous loan was successfully reimbursed.

loans.use: purchase second hand clothes

loans.name: Nazra

texts.en:
Nazra is 36 years old and an energetic married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of their house. The man shown in the picture is her husband who assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, where he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Nazra is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to expand her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to consistently meet increasing demands.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a 49-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 6 children. The oldest is 26 while the youngest is 10. She engages in tailoring services. She accepts dressmaking. Her husband is a fisherman. 

In order to sustain her tailoring services, Esterlita requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy cloth, garments and plywood to meet the demands of her customers, and so she could deliver the customer's order on time to avoid delay. 

In the future, Esterlita would like expand her tailoring services to be able to send her children to school and to have a one happy family.

loans.use: to buy cloth, garments and plywood.

loans.name: Haoua

texts.fr:
Mme HAOUA est célibataire et mère de deux (02) enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 21ans. Les 02 vont à l’école et elle a 09 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 2009. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 et avec ses amis grossistes. Ses clients sont un peu partout dans la ville car elle est ambulante.
HAOUA veut s’acheter 10complets pagnes simple, 04pagnes Bazin et 01pagne dentelle.
Mme épargne ses bénéfices pour faire face à ses échéances. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de mercerie et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Haoua is single and the mother of two children.  Her oldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 21.  Both her children go to school.  Haoua supports nine additional persons.

Haoua has been selling "pagnes" (West-African colorful fabrics) since 2009.  She buys her merchandise at the District 10 market and from friends who are wholesalers.  She works as an itinerant seller and has customers throughout the city.

She wants to buy 10 sets of plain "pagnes" (each measuring 1 x 3 meters), four damask sets, and one lace set.

She saves her profits to meet her repayments.  Her ambition is to open a sewing supplies store and to take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy some "pagnes" (West-African fabrics): 10 plain sets measuring 1 x 3 meters each, 4 damask sets and one lace set.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en:
Umar is married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker and has no source of income. Umar has been involved in agriculture for 15 years and grows mainly wheat and grapes. He sells his products in the market located near his place of residence. With the profits he earns from sales he helps cover family expenses. He lives with his family in his own home.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies to help with his cultivating activity, such as fertilizers and seeds. What he sells now is not enough to cover these expenses, so the loan will help him continue covering household expenses without limitation.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for the land where he grows wheat and grapes.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Munawar is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for a period of about 20 years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the basic necessities of his family members. 

Munawar is a motivated mother of five children. She reliably provides them with good quality food, education and clothing through her business. She contacted the Kashf Foundation for a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantities, along with some spools of thread to complete her orders on time. 

She is in her 3rd loan cycle and is hopeful of getting an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities, along with some spools of thread.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling palm kernel oil in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. 

Ama is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

She wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of palm kernel oil. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of palm kernel oil.

loans.name: Mireille Vicky

texts.fr: Mireille est une femme de 26 ans, célibataire et sans enfant. Elle possède et gère un restaurant dans un quartier de la ville depuis 3 ans. elle a vu au cours des années sa clientèle grandir et elle est déjà juste au niveau de ces approvisionnements. elle sollicite ce crédit pour lui permettre de renforcer son stock de matières premières (vivres frais) afin d'augmenter le nombre quantité de repas et satisfaire sa clientèle. les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'augmenter sa capital.
texts.en: Mireille is a 26 year old single woman without children. She has owned and managed a restaurant in a neighborhood of the city for the past three years. During this time, she has seen her customer base expand rapidly, and is today reaching the limitations of her supplies. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase more raw materials (fresh food) in order to increase the number of meals she can provide to her customers. Any profits generated will allow her to increase her working capital.

loans.use: purchase fresh food

loans.name: Nirgas

texts.en:
Nirgas is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She has been stitching clothes in her locality for the past three years to support her husband financially. She very well knows the techniques of stitching, as her mother was an expert tailor.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community who are satisfied with her services. She earns enough to live a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs.15,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and unique buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is in her 4th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and unique buttons.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Ekua sells charcoal in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. She is married to a fisherman, and together they have 5 children. Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal.

loans.name: Ramata

texts.fr:
Madame Ramata, une dame de 49 ans qui évolue dans le secteur de l’agriculteur vient solliciter pour une seconde fois un crédit afin de préparer la campagne agricole. Elle n’aura besoin que de 150000F CFA afin d’acheter de l’engrais et des semences. Ramata est mère de 10 enfants, elle ne reste pas les bras croisés, car elle participe à la dépense quotidienne et appuie beaucoup son mari dans ce domaine.
Malgré son âge, elle continue à aller au champ et à s’activer car elle adore son métier.
Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait exploiter d’autres périmètres culturaux pour maximiser son profit.
texts.en: Madame Ramata, a 49 year old woman working the agricultural sector, is asking for her second loan in order to prepare for the agricultural season. She is asking for 150,000 FCFA (approximately 300 USD) in order to purchase fertilizer and seeds. Ramata is a mother of 10 children, who does not stay idly at home, and supports her husband in taking care of the daily family needs. Despite her age, she continues to spend time working in the field, and loves this role. In the future, she hopes to be able to cultivate on other nearby plots of land in order to maximize the family's profit.

loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer to prepare for the agricultural season

loans.name: Wazeer

texts.en:
At the age of 47, Wazeer is an energetic married woman. She has been in the business of flower-making for the past four years. She knows very well the method of making beautiful flowers which are used in decorating parties, weddings and other events. She sells them to the people of her community and also sells in the local market. The immense experience in the art of flower making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her clients' needs.

It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation, and for the improvement of her business she requires a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy raw materials such as fabric, glace papers and packs of paints in various colors. In this way she would be able to consistently meet with the increasing demands of her customers. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, glace papers and packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling fish in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years.
