Abena is married and has five children; her husband works as an electrician. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Abena will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. 

With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Iyee

texts.en:
Iyee lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas of the country, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

She is 44 years old. A widow with four children aged between 20 and 30, Iyee has been operating a cook shop where she sells rice and soup for the past 8 years. She started this business by selling palm oil around for her mother, and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter balls, peppers, onions, vita fish, meat and other items for her business. Her plan is to increase her business even more. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter balls, peppers, onions, vita fish, meat and other items for her business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells fish in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 6 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 7 children. Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Fariha

texts.en: Fariha, 34, is a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es:
Bernardino es originario de  la Ciudad de Estelí es casado y tiene un hijo en edad escolar se caracteriza por ser una persona humilde, responsable y trabajadora su oficio es carpintero o ebanista, el cual su trabajo consiste en elaborará mueble para el hogar con la venta de estos muebles el facilita para los gastos familiares.

Esta solicitando un financiamiento para compra de materiales de construcción, tales como arena, inodoro , cerámica, tubería, cemento, madera y ladrillo, esto para construir servicio sanitario en su vivienda. 

Don Bernardino agradece a kiva y ceprodel por el apoyo brindado ya que esta manera podrá ser posible instalar el sistema de servicio sanitario y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia y también protección al medio ambiente.
texts.en:
Bernardino is from the city of Estelí.  He is married and has one school-age child.  He is noted for being a humble, responsible, hard-working person.  He is a carpenter, or cabinetmaker, by trade and his work consists of making household furniture.  It is through selling these items of furniture that he covers his family's expenses.

Bernardino is requesting a loan to buy building supplies such as sand, a toilet, tiles, pipes, cement, wood and bricks in order to build a bathroom in his home.  He is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support they are providing which will make it possible for him to install a bathroom, provide his family with better living conditions and also protect the environment.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to build a bathroom

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es originario de la linda Ciudad de Estelí ubicada en la parte norte de Nicaragua, es casado tiene 63 años de edad  y su núcleo familiar está compuesto por 4 hijos todo ellos independiente. 

Domingo se caracteriza por ser una persona muy honesta responsable y sobre todo trabajadora, actualmente su oficio es vender medicamento humano, esto lo realiza cada tres veces por semana ya que su producto lo vende en algunas comunidades aledaña de Estelí.

solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena, ladrillo, cemento, cerámica inodoro y lava mano ya que los requiere para instalar el sistema de servicio sanitario en su vivienda.

A la misma vez Domingo manifiesta sentirse alegre y motivado por el apoyo que le puedan brindar  ya que de esta manera  podrá darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia y también aportar a no contaminar más el medio ambiente.
texts.en:
Domingo is from the beautiful city of Estelí, in the north of Nicaragua.  He is 63 years old, married, and has four children who live independently.

Domingo is noted for being a very honest, responsible and, above all, hard-working person.  He currently sells medicines for a living and does this work three times a week, selling his products in neighboring communities.

Domingo is requesting a loan to buy building supplies such as sand, bricks, cement, tiles, a toilet and a sink.  He needs these items so that he can install a bathroom in his home.

Domingo says that he feels happy and encouraged by the support that he is receiving because it means he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions and he will also no longer be polluting the environment.

loans.use: to buy building supplies to build a bathroom

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 38 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from Talibon, Bohol. Eva operates a retail store, which she has been doing for five years. She sell items such as noodles, coffee, vinegar, canned goods, and soaps.

Eva is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stock and expand the diversity of her store. In the future, she would like to save some of her profits to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stock to expand the diversity of her store

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 57 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposo León con quien tiene 6 hijos, todos ellos independientes. Ahora vive con una de sus hijas, su esposo y su nieto en la casa que heredaron de sus padres. Su día se centra en diversas actividades, a una hora de caminata quedan sus terrenos agrícolas donde siembra quinua, alverja, habas, maíz y demás hortalizas. Las cuales cuida con la ayuda de su esposo quien le enseñó todo lo que sabe de la agricultura. Cuando cosecha las verduras, los vende a la capital del país, pero las demás cosechas en conjunto con los granos verdes que compra los vende al mercado de la ciudad de Jauja, donde comercializa 2 veces por semana, siendo este su principal actividad económica y donde obtiene mayores ingresos. Los demás días de la semana los dedica a cuidar sus animales pues posee vacas, cuyes, cerdos y burros. De las vacas obtiene la leche que comercializa todos los días.Es el segundo crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo brindado para continuar con su trabajo.
Victoria, invertirá los S/. 4000 soles en la compra de sacos de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
57-year-old Victoria is a cheerful woman.  She lives with her husband, León, and the couple have six children who are all independent.  Victoria now lives with one of her daughters, her husband and her grandson in a house that they inherited from her parents.  

Victoria's day is focused on a number of activities.  Her farmland is located one hour's walk from her home.  There she sows quinoa, peas, beans, corn and other vegetables.  She cares for her crops with her husband's help.  It was her husband who taught her everything she now knows about farming.  When she harvests her greens, she sells them in the country's capital city but she sells the rest, together with the raw coffee beans she buys, at the market in the city of Jauja twice a week.  This is her main business activity, from which she makes the most income.  On other days of the week she cares for her animals as she owns cows, guinea pigs, pigs and donkeys.  She obtains milk from the cows, which she sells every day.

This is Victoria's second loan from Kiva and she feels grateful for the support she is receiving which helps her to continue with her work.  Victoria will invest the 4,000 soles she has requested in buying sacks of organic fertilizer with which to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Even though Esi grew up in poverty without an education, that has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Esi is an entrepreneur. She sells fish in Asafora (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began some time ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their six children. 

Esi has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira, age 38, is a trader in children's clothing. She is doing her business with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Nasira’s husband. They buy a variety of children's clothes from the main city market and sell them to the people of her local community. They are happily doing it together for the sake of the family members. They have three children and are responsible for providing them food, health, clothing and education. 

Nasira is requesting a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of children’s clothes of the summer season to attract more customers and to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of children’s clothes of the summer season to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling footwear in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Aba is married and has eight children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Aba wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of footwear. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of footwear.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz María es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí ubicada en la parte norte de  Nicaragua, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos, es una mujer trabajadora honesta y comprometida con su familia.

Su actividad económica es la venta de cosmético de la diferente marca Avon, zermat entre otras el negocio es ambulante ya que lo distribuye en diferentes barrio de la ciudad de Estelí.

solicita un financiamiento para la compra de algunos materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento cerámica ladrillo entre otros, ya que le he necesario instalar servicio sanitario en su vivienda. 

Doña Luz agradece a kiva por el apoyo que le pueden brindar ya que de esta manera va realizar las mejora en su vivienda y por tal razón darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
protegiendo su salud y la de su familia, conservando el medio ambiente, este es la idea de esta alianza de saneamiento mejorado.
texts.en:
Luz María is originally from the city of Estelí, located in the northern part of Nicaragua.  She is a single mother of two children.  She is a hardworking and honest woman who is committed to her family.

Her economic activity is selling cosmetics from brands like Avon, zermat, and others.  She sells door to door and distributes her products in the different neighborhoods within the city of Estelí.

She is requesting financing in order to buy some construction materials, like sand, cement, tiles, bricks, and other items; it is necessary for her to install a toilet in her home.  

Luz is thankful to Kiva for the support that has been offered to her.  In this way, she is able to make improvements to her home so that she can provide better living conditions for her family.  She is protecting her health, as well as that of her family, while preserving the environment; this is the idea behind her desire for improved sanitation.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Nayeli

texts.es:
Nayely, de 19 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser alegre y amable. Esta casada con Marco y tiene un hijo de un año de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su madre.La actividad que realiza Nayely es la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños de diversos modelos. Tiene más de 03 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un buen ingreso económico, además de estar en casa cuidando a su pequeño. Por otro lado, comenta que tiene conocimientos en costura, teniendo planes de comprarse una maquina de coser e incursionar en este negocio, de esa manera generarse más ingresos económicos.Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles comprará ropa de diversos modelos, para tener un stock disponible para la venta, por lo que espera conseguirlos a un menor precio en sus compras al por mayor.
texts.en:
19-year-old Nayely is a hard-working, determined woman who is also cheerful and friendly.  She is married to Marco and has has a one-year-old child.  They live in their own home together with her mother.

Nayely's business is selling men's, women's and children's clothing.  She has been in this business for more than three years and, up to now, she has worked alone.  Nayely enjoys her business as it makes her good income and means she can be at home to take care of her little one.  She says that she is also able to sew and has plans to buy a sewing machine and start a sewing business so that she can make more income.

This will be Nayely's second loan from Kiva.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as it makes her feel certain that she will advance in her business.  She will use the 1,000 soles that she has requested to buy different types of clothing so that she has stock available to sell.  She hopes to obtain her products at a lower price by buying wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Basri

texts.en: Basri, age 39, is a married woman. For the past three years, she has been involved in a business of sewing clothes. She knows very well the methods of styling and designing clothes according to changing consumer tastes. She has regular customers and earns enough to contribute to the family income. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy thread with packs of zippers, buttons and ribbons in different colors. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to pay for educational expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy threads, zippers, buttons and ribbons in different colors.

loans.name: Granito De Mostaza Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Noemí mujer de 32 años de edad, casada, con dos hijos de 7 y 11 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon, desde hace 8 años que se dedica a esa actividad, tiene 10 años de ser clientes de la institución quien ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos, su esposo le apoya en el negocio, su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos como cremas faciales, cremas para cuerpos, cremas para manos, cremas para pies, lociones de varón, perfumen de varón, perfumen de damas, delineadores, máscaras, champo, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, etc., Nidia tiene 39 años su negocio es la venta de perecederos y verduras en el mercado oriental de la capital y Martha tiene 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y ropa nueva y tiene una mini pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three entrepreneurial women.  One of them is 32-year-old Noemí, who is married and has two children aged 7 and 11.  Noemí has been running a business selling Avon products for eight years.  She has been a client of the institution for ten years and has always been punctual in making her loan repayments.  Noemí's husband supports her in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying cosmetics such as face creams, body creams, hand creams, foot creams, men's lotions, men's perfumes, ladies' perfumes, eye liners, mascaras, shampoo, nail polish, lipsticks, etc.

Nidia is 39 years old and her business is selling perishable goods and vegetables in the eastern market in the capital city.  Martha is 41 years old and her business is selling used and new clothing.  She also has a small convenience store in her home.

loans.use: to buy Avon products (face cream, body cream, hand cream, foot cream, men's lotions, men's perfume, women's perfume, eye liner, mascara, shampoo, lipstick, etc.)

loans.name: Jesus Pan De Vida Group

texts.es: El grupo “JESUS PAN DE VIDA” está conformada por socios responsables y empeñosas en mejorar su calidad de vida. Nicolaza  tiene 46 años es conviviente con un hijo dependiente. Años atrás trabajo en el comedor Santa Mónica de Nicolás de Piérola. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de hierbas medicinales, frutas, flores en el mercado 8 de Febrero de Nicolás de Piérola hace  5 años que viene realizando dicha actividad. Hace 2 meses implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda en el cual le ayuda su hija. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de frutas, flores, y hierbas medicinales. Su mayor deseo es ampliar la bodega que implemento en su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Nicolaza es la segunda del lado derecho viste polo azul. De la misma manera está incluida la foto de Katherine en la parte superior derecha que no puedo estar presente en la reunión.
texts.en:
The group "Jesus Pan de Vida" [Jesus, Bread of Life] is made of up of responsible members who are determined to improve their quality of life.  

Nicolaza is forty-six years old and lives with a son, who is her dependent.  Years ago, she worked in a restaurant called Santa Mónica de Nicolás de Piérola.  Currently, she making a living selling medicinal herbs, fruits, and flowers in a market (called 8 de Febrero de Nicolás de Piérola).  She has been doing this for five years.  Two months ago, she started a small store in her home where her daughter helps her.  

She will invest the loan in the purchase of fruits, flowers, and medicinal herbs.  Her greatest wish is to grow this store that she has in her home.  

The group is thankful to the Kiva investors for the loan that has been offered to them.  Nicolaza is pictured second from the right, in the blue shirt.  A small photo of another member, Katherine, is in the upper-right-hand corner, since she could not be present at the meeting.

loans.use: to buy flowers, medicinal herbs, and fruit.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Araba is an entrepreneur. She operates a local chop bar in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. 

Araba is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Araba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of ingredients for her local dishes, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of ingredients for her local dishes, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra, age 36, is a married woman. For many years, she has been involved in the business of shoe sales. She buys shoes in bulk from the market at wholesale rates then sells them to the people of her community. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and earns a good amount of income through her business. 

Azra is a mother of five and she is motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life, good education, food, and clothing. Azra has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation in order to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

Currently, she has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase a greater variety of shoes, in various designs and sizes. It will help her to increase sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash. Azra is in her seventh loan cycle, with good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of shoes, in various designs and sizes.

loans.name: Patron San Cristobal Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PATRON SAN CRISTOBAL”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Hilda ella es soltera  tiene 60 años de edad y tiene 05 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cosméticos como perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otros, la socia vende de forma independiente a todas sus amistades, familiares entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de ropas, salón de belleza y trabajadores de empresas privadas.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “Patron San Cristobal.”  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.  

One of the members is Hilda.  She is single.  She is 60 years old and she has five children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling cosmetics like perfumes, colognes, creams and so on.  She sells in an independent manner to all of her friends and family members among other people.  She has been in this business for years which is going well for her thanks to the efforts that she puts into her business every day.  In this way she is able to get ahead with her family.

Hilda is requesting the loan to purchase ladies' perfumes for her business.  The other members work selling clothes, in a beauty salon and as workers in private companies. 

She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream by means of this method and she promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the established period of time.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' perfumes for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 51 años de edad es una mujer esforzada  y emprendedora. Vive en sola en su casa propia.Sus hijos ya son independientes y viven en lugares diferentes.Betty se dedica a confeccionar ropa para damas y niñas como blusas, polos, ropas interiores,  entre otros. Su actividad la realiza en un local de su vivienda . Lleva 6 años en este trabajo y se inicio junto a unas amigas confeccionando vestidos para señoritas que cumplían 15 años, se dio cuenta que el negocio era muy rentable ya que tiene muchos clientes que la recomiendan  por los buenos diseños que confecciona. Antes de iniciar su negocio no contaba con maquinas de coser, ni remalladoras, estas maquinas son esenciales para poder trabajar en este rubro. Su familia la apoyo financieramente para que comprara su primera maquina de coser. En el futuro quiere  formar una pequeña microempresa junto a sus amigas ya que sus clientes se incrementan . Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles comprará implementos en mayor volumen como telas, hilos, algodón,entre otros.
texts.en:
Betty, 51 years of age, is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She lives alone in her own house. Her children are already independent and they live away from home. 

Betty earns a living making clothes for women and children such as blouses, t-shirts, undergarments and other items. She does her sewing in a workshop in her house. She has been in the business for 6 years now. She started out with her friends making dresses for young ladies for their 15th birthday celebrations, and soon realized that it was a profitable business. She has many clients who recommend her because her designs are good. 

Before beginning this business she owned neither a sewing machine nor a darning machine. These machines are essential to be able to work in this business. Her family gave her the financial support to buy her first sewing machine. In the future, together with her friends, she wants to establish a small business because their client base is increasing. 

With the requested 1500 Peruvian Soles she will buy a greater quantity of supplies such as fabric, thread, and cotton among other items.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, and cotton among other items.

loans.name: Bahtiniso

texts.ru: Бахтинисо 49 лет. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 1 сына, которому 3 года. Она более 13 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она красиво и аккуратно шьёт женские одежды. Бахтинисо имеет много учеников и обучает их этому ремеслу. Бахтинисо в течение 13 лет привлекла своих клиентов, благодаря честности и хорошему сервису. Она планирует сделать крышу для своего дома, но так как она не имеет сбережения, она обратилась за займом в сумме 5000 сомони для покупки шифера и другие строительные материалы. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahtiniso is 49 years old. She is a hard-working woman. She is divorced and raising a 3-year old son. For over 13 years, she has been providing services as a seamstress.  Her women’s outfits are beautiful and well-made. Bahtiniso has many trainees and teaches them her trade. For 13 years, Bahtiniso has been building her customer base thanks to her integrity and good service. She plans to change the roofing on her house, but lacks the savigns for it. She has applied for a loan in the amount of 5,000 in order to buy slate and other construction materials. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy slate and other building materials to install roofing on her house.

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Iuri lives in the small village of Zana, Senaki district, with his 57-year-old wife, 35-year-old son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren, who are 10 and 13 years old. Iuri requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.
 
The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They have: two milk cows, two calves, and one pig. Also, they own a plot of agricultural land, where nut trees and maize are grown. The whole family is involved in their agriculture. Iuri’s wife and daughter-in-law are milking the cows and producing dairy products. Iuri and his son are cultivating the land and growing the harvest. All the products are sold among the villagers, or at the local market, and the family earns a small monthly income.

Iuri has requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Iuri has now been approved for a loan, within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up Loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restart-up credits, with soft conditions, to rural poor people, who do not have access to other credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With his credit, Iuri will purchase chickens. He wants to develop a poultry business, in order to expand his agriculture. After the chicks are grown, they will be sold at a higher price and Iuri will make a good profit. With the increased profit, he will be able to improve the living conditions of the family and provide a better life for them.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 38 years old. He lives in the small village of Kobuleti District with his mother, who receives a retirement pension.

Gia requested loans from local financial institutions on several occasions for a family business start-up. But he did not have any success securing loans from the local institutions: his loan requests were rejected each time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.

The sole source of income for his family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow different kinds of fruits and vegetables. They then locally sell the harvested fruits and vegetables. But the income they generate is hardly enough to support the family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Gia requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Gia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-startup credits with lenient conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income.

With the loan proceeds, Gia would like to purchase a car. After purchasing a car, he feels he will be able to better distribute fruits and vegetables for sales purposes. He will also purchase chickens to re-sell. By doing so, he believes that he will increase his family's income. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to more easily sell fruits and vegetables by purchasing a car and to purchase chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for cleaning and maintaining her coffee crops

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Although she grew up in difficult circumstances, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling charcoal in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for a while now. Esi is divorced without any children. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her support herself and her extended family. 

Esi wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of charcoal

loans.name: Novaira

texts.en:
Novaira, age 37, deals in plastic sales with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Novaira’s husband. Four years ago they opened a shop near their house and started selling plastic items such as plates, bowls and baskets. As her customers are satisfied with the quality of their goods, their demand is increasing day by day. 

For this reason, Novaira applied a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase more items such as bowls, glasses, plates and tubs. This will help them to grow their sales and profits alongside. Novaira is a mother of four; one of her daughter is also shown in the photo. Novaira dreams of providing quality education to her children for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as bowls, glasses, plates and tubs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell banana leaves.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 52 years old, a married woman and running a business of milk sales with her husband for a period of about 15 years. She has two cows in milk; she sells their milk to the people of her community and makes enough to meet her household expenses. She also looks after the cows and performs the task of collecting milk on a daily basis. 

Sakina has three daughters and two sons, among them two are school-going. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make larger profits, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000/- to buy one more cow to carter to more customers. She is confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy one more cow.

loans.name: Naana

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Naana did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Naana prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) in her village of Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 15 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have three children. Naana uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

 Naana will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in growing her ‘Kenkey’ sales. Naana wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in growing her ‘Kenkey’ sales

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married  and is from Talibon, Bohol. She engages in seaweed farming, which she has been doing for almost five years. Aside from seaweed farming, she also sells fish and crabs to customers in the community. 

Josephine is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishing net and crab net to increase the volume of her catch. In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing  business to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and crab net

loans.name: Rostalina

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 8 filhos todos maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende frangos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra, e outros) para construir capoeiras para criação de frangos. 
No futuro deseja concluir as capoeiras e tornar mais sustentável seu negócio, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de trabalhar mais e saber lhe dar com a concorrência do mercado e melhorar a sua vida.
texts.en:
Rostalina is single and the mother of 8 children, all of age. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and sells chickens. With this loan she plans to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to build hencoops to raise hens for slaughter.

In future, Rostalina hopes to finish building the coops and make her business more sustainable. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work harder, to understand how to handle the competition in her market and to improve her life.

loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to build hencoops to raise hens for slaughter

loans.name: Zaida

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 6 filhos que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É negociante vende produtos diversos e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (feijão, cervejas, refrescos, óleo, e outros), para aumentar e a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
No futuro deseja ampliar o seu negócio investindo na criação de gado bovino, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de se empenhar mais para obter mais rendimento e garantir a formação dos seus filhos.
texts.en:
Zaida is married and the mother of 6 children who go to School. She lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a trader and sells various products. With this loan she plans to buy goods (beans, beers, refreshments, oil and others) to increase the quantity of her stock.

In future Zaida hopes to expand her business by investing in raising cattle.  To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work even harder to obtain more income and guarantee her children's education.

loans.use: pretende comprar produtos (feijão, cervejas, refrescos, óleo, e outros), para aumentar e a quantidade da sua mercadoria.

loans.name: Julio C. Tello Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Raquel tiene 30 años es conviviente con un hijo aun educando en la escuela. Ser socia del grupo “JULIO C. TELLO AL PROGRESO” le ha ayudado a mejorar su economía familiar. Años atrás daba clases de danza a jóvenes del colegio La Cantuta. Hace 2 años  trabaja en la municipalidad de Santa Eulalia como secretaria. En sus tiempos libres vende producto de belleza. Su mayor deseo es tener su casa propia. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Raquel es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Raquel, 30, lives with her common-law husband and son, who is still in school.  She is a member of the communal bank "JULIO C. TELLO AL PROGRESO" which has helped her improve the family economy.  She used to teach dancing at a school called La Canuta but for two years she has been working in the municipality of Santa Eulalia as a secretary.  In her free time she sells beauty products.  Her greatest goal is to have her own house.

She plans to use the loan to buy more beauty products.  The communal bank is grateful to KIVA lenders for the loan.  Raquel is the first one on the left.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, además de tener mucho entusiasmo y ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Liborio quien es empleado y padre de sus 04 hijos  de 25, 23, 22 y 18 años de edad, habitando cómodamente todos juntos una casa que es de su propiedad.El negocio de Rosa consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas, dicha venta la realiza en su propia casa, para eso cuenta con 02 refrigeradoras donde guarda sus productos a temperaturas heladas y como le agrada a sus clientes.Le gusta su actividad ya que cuenta con un ingreso económico con el cual puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar y asi brindar los necesario a sus hijos .Este es el quinto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo .
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles comprará bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, en mayor cantidad y a menos precio, para así obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45, is a hard-working, cheerful woman who is very enthusiastic and determined to get ahead.  She lives with her partner, Liborio, who is an employee and the father of her four children, ages 25, 23, 22 and 18.  They all live together in their own house.  Rosa has as business she runs from home which is selling sodas.  She has two refrigerators where she keeps the drinks ice cold just like the customers want.  She enjoys her work because it provides her with an income she can use to help cover household expenses and give her children what they need.  This is her fifth loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving so she can continue her work.

She plans to use the 800 PEN loan to buy different brands and types of sodas in larger quantities at lower prices.  This will give her a greater profit margin.

loans.use: To buy sodas.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo, ella tiene un pequeño negocio hubicado en su casa de habitacion, un pulperia, su esposa labora para una empresa privada y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, en la actualida ella sufre los estragos del invierno ya que su casita tiene ciertas partes de Zinc como divicion y ella sueña con poder construirla de Bloques con este credtio compra materiales como: Cemento, Arena Bloques, Hiero. asi su casita tendra mejor seguridad y no se procupara por las inundaciones, Agradece el apoyo que esta recibiendo de Afodenic y Fondos Kiva con esta nueva oportunidad.
texts.en: Josefa lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband.  She runs a small grocery store from home to help cover household expenses. Her husband works for a private company.  Right now they are suffering the consequences of winter because parts of the house are divided with metal sheeting.  She wants to use concrete bricks to renovate the house, and will use the loan to buy materials such as cement, sand, bricks, and iron so her house will be safer from flooding.  She is grateful for this support and new opportunity from Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: La Roca Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Gloria tiene 37 años de edad, casada, con cuatro hijos de 19, 17,6 y 18 meses de edad, tiene 5 años de hacer y vender tortillas y nacatamales, anteriormente trabajaba como doméstica, de ser cliente de  la  institución dos años consecutivos, su hija mayor y ella le ayuda hacer tortilla y hacer nacatamales, estos los comercializa en su domicilio y es bien conocida en su comunidad como buen producto de calidad, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maíz, cal, leñas, adquisición de equipos de trabajo como mesa, perol, materia prima para hacer nacatamal carne de cerdo, maíz, perecederos, achiote, hojas de chagüites, mecate, naranja agria, hierba buena, papa, arroz, sal etc. Elba tiene 27 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y Verónica tiene 28 años su negocio es la venta de elotes.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurial women, one of whom is Gloria who is 37 years old, married and mother of four children aged 19, 17, 6 and 18 months. She has been making and selling tortillas and nacatamales for five years. She previously worked as a domestic employee. She has been a client of this institution for two consecutive years. Her oldest daughter helps her to make tortillas and nacatamles which she sells at her home. She is well known in her community for having quality products.

The loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, salt and firewood to make tortillas, the purchase of equipment including a table and a pot, and the purchase of raw material for nacatamales including pork, corn, perishable items, achiote, banana leaves, rope, sour oranges, mint, potatoes, rice, salt, etc. Her partners are Elba who is 27 years old and sells used clothing and Verónica who is 28 years old and sells corn on the cob.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make tortillas and nacatamales including corn, pork, banana leaves, perishable items, achiote, sour oranges, mint, potatoes, rice, salt, firewood and rope, and for equipment including a table and a pot.

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha is 26 years old and he lives with his family and parents in Tsovazard village which is in Gegharkunik region. Misha is married and has a one-year-old son. His wife is a dental technician, but now she does not work, since she is taking care of their son. Misha’s mother is retired and his father is in the Russian Federation working abroad. 

Misha has no higher education. For several years he worked at the local lemonade factory as a worker. Now he is unemployed but he is engaged in agriculture and farming. He has a private plot of land and he keeps three cows, one bull, three calves, six pigs and ten piglets. Misha’s mother helps him a lot with the agricultural work. She gives good advice on how to choose plants and cultivate different vegetables and fruits.

Misha is asking for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams to buy a hay mowing machine. He hopes very much that Kiva lenders will support him to develop his agricultural activities.

loans.use: To buy a hay mowing machine

loans.name: Paul Agusto

texts.es:
Paul tiene 29 años edad y  nació en la ciudad de Gamitana y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él continúa con la venta de productos agrícolas pues él tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra diferentes productos como por ejemplo yuca, maíz, arroz y otras cosas, él también se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.
Paul en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. 

Paul es integrante del banco comunal de “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” de la Asociación Arariwa en la selva del Perú.
texts.en:
Paul, 29, was born in the city of Gamitana and still lives there.  He continues selling farm products that he grows on his cropland, such as cassava, corn, rice and other products.  He also buys and sells wood.  He has been in business for several years and it is going well for him because of the hard work he puts into it.  On this occasion, Paul is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

He is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana" which belongs to the Arariwa Association in the Peruvian forest.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Las Leonas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Lea es una mujer de 43 años de edad, casada, con un hijo de 7 años, su negocio es la venta de oro y plata y ropa variada desde hace dos años estos los comercializa   a sus vecinos a trabajadores de empresas privadas y estatales, tiene de ser cliente de la institución cinco años lo cual demuestra la capacidad de pago en sus préstamos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de prendas de oro, como cadenas, pulseras, tobilleras, chapas, anillos, así como  también ropa como pantalón de varón,  pantalón de mujer, camisetas de varón, camisas de varón, blusas, camisolas etc. Ana es una mujer que tiene 58 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa de paca y ropa nueva y Vilma tiene 58 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y sandalias.
texts.en:
This group consists of three entrepreneurial women.  One of them, Lea, is 43 years old, married, and has a 7-year-old son.  Her business is selling gold and silver jewelry, and clothing.  She has been in this business for two years and sells to her neighbors as well as to people who work in both private and state-run companies.  She has been a client of the institution for five years which shows that she is able to make her loan repayments.  

Lea will invest this loan in buying gold jewelry such as chains, bracelets, anklets, earrings and rings.  She will also buy clothing such as men's trousers, women's trousers, men's t-shirts, men's shirts, blouses, sports shirts,etc.

Ana is 58 years old and her business is selling used and new clothing.  Vilma is also 58 years old and her business is selling clothing, shoes and sandals.

loans.use: to invest in buying gold jewelry such as chains, bracelets, anklets, earrings, rings, and clothing such as men's trousers, women's trousers, men's t-shirts, blouses, sports shirts, etc.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is single and has five children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She sells cloth in Asafora (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 15 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ekua will use the loan to buy more cloth, thus helping her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, thus adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en: Marat lives in Tsovagyugh village in the region of Gegharkunik. He is married and has two school-aged sons. His wife is unemployed. Marat has no higher education, and he has never been employed. Since he was married, he and his wife have been engaged in farming and agriculture. They have a small plot of land and some cattle; two cows, one bull, two calves and thirty chickens. The meat and the milk that they produce is sold with the help of re-sellers. Despite all this, his family’s living conditions are very poor, and they have many financial problems. Marat has taken loans from Nor Horizon three times in the past, and this time he is applying for support from Kiva lenders. Marat needs 800,000 AMD (Armenian drams) to buy two calves and animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy two calves and fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard has been involved in land cultivation for 10 years. Particularly, she cultivates tomatoes and sells them locally. For an unemployed single mom with three children, agriculture is her only source of income. 

Alvard owns a greenhouse where tomatoes are grown. Unfortunately because of recent bad weather conditions, her greenhouse got damaged and needs to be renovated. As Alvard has no financial means for doing that, she has applied for this loan.

The other part of the loan will be used for purchasing fertilizer which is very important for successful cultivation of the land. Alvard waits for your support and she hopes that this loan is a small step to her dream of having a big and profitable farm.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse and for fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb, located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Elizabeth is 50 years old, married, with three children between 28 and 15 years old. Only one lives at home and is in school. She completed 12 grades. 

Elizabeth runs a shop business, selling used shoes. She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business 21 years ago, using money given to her by her husband. Typically, she works at her business from 8am to 5pm, Monday to Saturday and she transports her goods to her business by a shared taxi. She cites her greatest challenge as small capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more used shoes for her business. In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes for her business.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Condega un municipio conocido como tierra de alfareros por su artesanía y gente trabajadora. En una comunidad aledaña conocida como Darayli, Vive el señor Julio, con su esposa y sus cinco  hijos al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios, él de profesión, agricultor, en el área de granos básicos y la ganadería en pequeña escala, es conocido  como una persona honesta y trabajadora con más de 30 años de experiencia.

Su propiedad tiene un área de 56 manzanas de extensión aptas para cultivo de granos básicos y la ganadería.

Recientemente visitó Ceprodel y está solicitando un crédito para compra de abono, fungicidas, foliares, herbicidas  y gastos en mano de obra, para darle mantenimiento al cultivo de maíz y frijol  donde piensa salir beneficiado.

 El impacto y beneficios que tendrá  él y su familia son de una forma positiva ya que trabajan  su finca a través de estos rubros cada año,  mejorando su nivel de vida y condiciones económicas con los ingresos obtenidos en cada cosecha realizada.
texts.en:
The town of Condega is known as the 'land of potters' owing to its handicrafts and hard-working people.  Julio lives in a neighboring community known as Darayli together with his wife and their five children who he has to support and provide with an education.  Julio is a farmer by profession.  He grows basic grains and engages in small-scale cattle raising.  He is known for being an honest, hard-working person with 30 years experience.

Julio owns 56 'manzanas' (1 manzana = 1.73 acres) of land where he is able to grow basic grains and raise cattle.

Julio recently visited Ceprodel and requested a loan to buy manure, fungicides, foliar fertilizers and herbicides.  He also needs money to pay workers to maintain his corn and bean crops.

This loan will have a positive impact and benefits for Julio and his family as they work their farm this way every year, improving their standard of living and their financial situation with the income they make from each harvest.

loans.use: to buy inputs (manure, fungicides, foliar fertilizer) and to pay workers

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en: This is Naomi’s Group, made up of four hard-working and responsible women who, through their businesses, are improving their lives every day. Naomi, 39, is married and has three children who are in school. Naomi decided to take over her old mother's business, selling fresh fish and smoked fish at a small market at Teshie. She makes a living from this activity. She feels happy that ID-Ghana has come with this loan facility, which has helped her household. Her keenest desire is to own a cold store as in this way she will have better profits. The loan she is applying for will be allocated to buying more fish to meet customer demand. The other members are Ogbede, Grace and Odoi. They are also engaged in selling fish. Naomi’s Group needs GHS 5,300 to help them increase their stock.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Venoria

texts.en: Venoria lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. She is 39 years old, married, with a 15-year-old who lives at home and is in school. She completed 12 grades. She runs a shop selling used clothes. She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business 15 years ago, using money given to her by her husband. Typically, she works at her business from 7 AM to 6 PM from Monday to Saturday, and she transports her goods to her business by bus. She cites her greatest challenge as her small capital. She is proud of her business because it supports her home. Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to buy more used clothes for her business. In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her child. She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Lemsik

texts.en: Lemsik is a farmer from Tavush region. He is involved in cattle breeding, and he grows various type of trees (plums, nuts, apples, and pears). He works hard to bring in a good harvest and sell it locally. The income from agriculture is important for Lemsik to cover his family's daily costs. He lives with his wife and 24-year-old son. Lemsik has applied for this loan to add four little pigs to his livestock. He plans to raise those pigs and then sell them at higher prices. This is an important step for Lemsik to expand his agricultural business and ensure better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to  add four little pigs to his livestock.

loans.name: Weedor

texts.en:
Weedor lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Weedor is 39 years old, married with two children aged 11 and 8, who live at home and are in school. She completed 12 grades.

She runs a cook shop business selling rice and soup.  She describes herself as a serious businesswoman. She started her business ten years ago, using money given to her by her husband.  Typically, she works 7 am to 8 pm from Monday to Saturday at her business and transports her goods to her business by shared taxi.  She cites her greatest challenge as not enough capital.  She is proud of her business because she makes a lot of profit.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more rice, peppers, oil, Vita, onions, fish, and dried bush-meat for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, oil, Vita, onions, fish, and dried bush-meat for her business.

loans.name: Alamby

texts.ru: Аламби 51 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 8 детей, возраст у которых составляет от 10 до 25 лет. Ее муж пенсионер и получает маленькую пенсию. Аламби более 17 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры как пшеница и хлопок. Она имеет 4 га земли. Аламби в течение 1 года получает 2 раза урожая. Она работает упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера и в этом деле помогает ей ее сын и невестка. Она старается обеспечить своих детей с хорошим условием проживания и поэтому она планирует увеличить доход. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки семена, минерального удобрения и топлива. Она ждет вашу доброту и как добросовестный человек обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Alamby is 51 years old and she is married with eight children whose ages range from 10 to 25 years.  Her husband is retired and he receives a small pension.  For more than 17 years, Alamby has been raising crops like wheat and cotton.  She has four hectares of land and she gets two harvests per year.  Alamby works hard from early in the morning to late at night, and she gets help from her son and daughter-in-law.  She tries to ensure a good quality of life for her children, which is why she plans to increase her income.  She is asking for a loan of 1,500 US dollars to buy seeds, mineral fertilizer and fuel.  She is awaiting your kindness and since she is a responsible person, she promises to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for a plot where she grows wheat and cotton

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush has 14 years of experience in agriculture. In addition to running a farm, Artush is a village veterinarian. He keeps cows, bulls, and sheep. He also cultivates wheat and sells it at the local market.

Realizing that agricultural income is very important for him to sustain his family, Artush wants to enlarge his business. He has requested this loan to purchase seeds and fuel for transporting the harvest to the market. The loan is very important for Artush to increase his income and improve the standard of living for himself, his wife, and his son.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fuel

loans.name: Fotemogoban 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Fotemogoban 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs, avec Aminata debout au milieu sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 90.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of one the Fotemogoban 1 Group are all married women with an average age of 36 years and an average of six children. They are all living in traditional families in Kokouna, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

The group has collaborated with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan cycle with the institution and their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Aminata (shown in the photo standing in the center of the back row), grows crops of corn. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the Sikasso Market to a clientele composed of men and women.

Aminata hopes to earn an income of 90,000 FCFA per agricultural cycle. The money she earns will allow her to repay her loan and help the family pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining half a hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to make her local dishes to sell.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Fotemogoban 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Bintou  debout au milieu sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Fotemogoban 2 Group are married women with an average age of 39, and an average of five children. They are all living in traditional families Kokouna, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan cycle with the institution, and all of their prior loans have been repaid in full.

Bintou (shown in the photo standing in the center of the back row), grows crops of corn. With her ​​loan, she intends to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining two hectares of farmland. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village to a clientele composed of men and women.

Bintou hopes to earn and average income of 150,000 FCFA per agricultural cycle. The income she earns will allow Bintou to repay her loan and help her family pay for their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and pay for the labor cost of maintaining two hectares of farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of meat, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional amount of hair products, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Los Luceros Group

texts.es: Formado por tres socias exitosa una de ellas es Martha mujer de 50 años de edad, acompañada, con tres hijos mayores su negocio es la venta de sandalias, cosméticos de la Avon, productos Arabela, venta de ropa nueva, de tener su actividad tiene 16 años consecutivos, estos productos los comercializa en su comunidad, y a trabajadores de empresas privadas y públicas, su hija mayor le ayuda en la administración de negocio. Tiene 7años de ser cliente de la institución. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón jingo, pantalón de dama, camisas hollister de varón, camisas de damas, camisolas, zapatos de dama, zapatos de varon,cosméticos de la Avon como cremas para manos, cremas para cuerpos, cremas para pies, cremas faciales, champó, tintes, delineadores, pintura de labios, pinturas de uñas, etc. Ana tiene 65 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de prendas de zafiros, cosméticos de la Vogue, Lizeth tiene 42 años de edad y su  negocio es la venta de cosméticos Arabela y cosméticos de la Vogue.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three successful partners.  One of them is Martha, a 50-year old woman, who has three grown children.  Her business is the sale of sandals, Avon cosmetics, Arabela products, and new clothing.  She has been in this business for 16 consecutive years.  She sells these products in her community, and to employees at public and private companies.  Her oldest daughter helps her manage the business.

She has been a client of the institution for 7 years.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing such as Jingo pants, ladies' pants, men's Hollister shirts, ladies' shirts, camisoles, ladies' shoes, men's shoes, and Avon cosmetics such as hand creams, body creams, foot creams, face creams, shampoos, dyes, eyeliners, lipsticks, nail polishes, etc.

Ana is 65 years old, and her business is the sale of Zafiro garments and Vogue cosmetics.  Lizeth is 42 years old, and her business is the sale of Arabela cosmetics and Vogue cosmetics.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of ladies' and men's clothing, ladies' and men's shoes, and Avon cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall ‘Kenkey’ sales.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther lives and works in St. Paul.  St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port.  It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.

Esther is 59 years old and married with three children between 37 to 23. She did not go to school but she is good at managing her business. Esther runs a table business selling pepper, bitter ball, okra etc.  She describes herself as a serious business woman. She started her business ten years ago, using money given to her husband.  

Typically, Esther works from 7am to 6pm, from Monday to Saturday at her business and she transports her goods to her business by taxi.  She cites her greatest challenge as a lack of capital.  She is proud of her business because she is able to use it to support her home.

Using the proceeds of this loan, she intends to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, okra etc for her business.  In the future, she plans to build her house and educate her children.  She sincerely thanks you in advanced for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, okra etc for her business.

loans.name: Las Amigas De Mi Niño Jesus Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 7 mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LAS AMIGAS DE MI NIÑO JESUS ” una de ellas es Mercedes  de 33 años soltera y sin  hijos, mercedes  se dedica ya hace 7 años a la venta de ropa  tanto parta damas como para caballeros   en un pequeño local  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante y tener un ingreso mas ,  Con el fruto de su esfuerzo  mercedes   ha logrado mejorar la  vivienda  de su mamá y  también  Seguir mejorando en su  negocio, , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar más ropa   y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of 7 responsible women who sell merchandise. Together, they make up the group called "Las Amigas De Mi Nino Jesus."  One of the group members is Mercedes.  She is 33 years old, she is single, and she doesn't have any children.  For the past 7 years, Mercedes has sold both women's and men's clothing every day in a small store with the objective of getting ahead and earning more money.  With the fruit of her efforts, Mercedes has been able to make home improvements to her mother's home and she has also continued to improve her business.  

With this loan she will buy more clothing and therefore be able to earn more money.  She wants to send a big hug to Kiva and Edaprospo and thank them for the loan that they have provided to help make her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es:
Hilaria tiene 22 años edad y nació en la ciudad de Gamitana, ella continua dedicándose a la agricultura, a la compra y venta de madera y a la venta de productos de  primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas y otras cosas.

Hilaria en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para invertir para comprar productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más.  
 
Hilaria es integrante del grupo “Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana” de la Asociación Arariwa en la selva del Perú.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 22 years old and she was born in the city of Gamitana. She continues to make a living with agriculture, buying and selling wood, and selling necessary products like rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, and other things. 

Hilaria is asking for a loan at this time to invest it in the purchase of staples such as sacks of sugar, rice, and other things. Hilaria is a member of the community bank Nuevo Amanecer de Gamitana, from the Asociación Arariwa in the forests of Peru.

loans.use: to buy staples like sacks of sugar, rice, and other things for example.

location.town: Gamitana - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Maria Barbara

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 35 años de edad soltera la cual tiene un grado de educación de primaria completo cursado hasta el sexto. Ella vive en la casa de su madre en compañía de sus hermanos los cuales se dedican a la agricultura. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el cultivo de papa ya que es una actividad que practica hace más de 15 años y su lugar de trabajo está a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación. En la actualidad su mayor desafió es la falta de energía eléctrica en la zona donde está construida la casa ya que no se tiene planeado por un tiempo la instalación de energía eléctrica por lo cual es necesaria hoy en día para mantenerla iluminada la cual lo hace mediante leña de ocote, candiles de gas y vela comercial.

Pero con la ayuda que hoy en día ella solicita podrá comprar un panel solar el cual será de apoyo para mantener la casa iluminada y evitar la quema de palo de ocote, candiles u otros que sean dañinos para la salud y para el medio ambiente.

Su sueño es lograr con el paso de los años comercializar su producto en grandes escalas ya que por medio de eso ella podrá generar más ingresos para su familia como los de seguir ampliando sus cosechas. Pero su meta es poder comprar el panel solar para poder disfrutar de su hogar en compañía de su madre y sus hermanos sin perjudicar el medio ambiente y la salud.
texts.en:
Maria is 35 years old, she is single, and she has completed school through the sixth grade.  She lives in a house with her mother and her siblings, and they all work in agriculture.  She has a lot of experience growing potatoes and it is an activity that she has done for more than 15 years.  Her workplace is only 5 minutes from her house.  

Currently, her biggest challenge is that there is no electricity in the region in which her home is located.  Furthermore, there are no plans to install electricity in the area.  Nowadays, it is necessary to have lighting in the home and so she has to use wood, gas lamps, and candles.

But with the help she is asking for today, she will be able to buy a solar panel which will help her keep the house lit and she can avoid the smoke from the wood and candles that harms her family’s health and the environment.

Her dream is to someday sell her products in large quantities because this will help her to generate a higher income for her family and then they can expand their crops.  But her goal right now is to be able to buy a solar panel so that she can enjoy being home with her mother and her siblings without harming the environment and their health.

loans.use: to buy solar panels to light her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of accessories.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул 28-летний женатый молодой человек, проживающий в городе Турсунзаде, который находится в 60 км к западу от города Душанбе. Прекрасные погодные условия, обилие солнца и тепла делают территорию района благоприятной для ведения сельского хозяйства. Абдурасул в числе большинства жителей занимается растениеводством. Хотя он окончил высшее учебное заведение, однако по специальности не работал. Абдурасул на протяжении 10 лет занимается выращиванием овощей и является опытным дехканином. Он на большом участке земли сеит картофель, помидоры, огурцы и т.д. Абдурасул берет кредит для закупа минерального удобрения для улучшения качества урожая. Абдурасул за счет дохода от деятельности планирует расширить своё дело.
texts.en: Abdurasul is 28 years old and married.  He lives in Tursun-Zoda, Tajikistan which is about 60 kilometers to the west of Dushanbe. Beautiful weather, much sun, and lots of heat makes the area great for agriculture.  Abdurasal, like most in the region, is involved in farming.  Although he has a degree, he never worked in the field he studied.  For 10 years he has grown vegetables and he is an experienced farmer.  He plans things like potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers on a large plant of land.  Abdurasal is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers to increase the quality of his harvest.  With the profits, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: Araceli es una mujer joven, microempresaria tiene 39 años de edad, casada con dos hijos adolescentes de 19 y 13 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de comida almuerzos a domicilios,  les vende a trabajadores de empresas privadas a su comunidad, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, anteriormente vendía ropa usada ambulante, actualmente cuenta con dos trabajadoras que le paga salarios, y cinco años de ser cliente de la institución, con este crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de una res destazada  y la compra de un freezer con capacidad de 250 lbs  para mantener guardada la carne de res, actualmente su mama le apoya en guardarle ella en su freezer el producto.
texts.en:
Araceli is a young woman. She is a 39-year-old micro-entrepreneur that is married and has two children, aged 19 and 13. Araceli sells food. She delivers lunches to employees of private companies located in her community. She has been doing this for six years now, but she used to sell used clothes as a street vendor. Two other women help her and she pays them their salary.

Araceli has been a client of the institution for five years. She will use this loan to buy a butchered cow and a freezer with a 250 lb. capacity to store it. At the moment, she is using her mother’s freezer to store her products.

loans.use: to buy a butchered cow and a freezer to store it.

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.ru: Шокирджону 41 год. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Шокирчон более 18 лет работает в заводе. Он является единственным кормильцем в семье, так как его жена домохозяйка и дети еще не совершеннолетние. Шокирджон вместе со своей семьёй живет в старом доме, который не отвечает стандартам жилья. Он хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Необходимо отремонтировать все комнаты, а также заменить окна и двери. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки окон и дверей. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время. Этот займ поможет ему улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en: Shokirjon is 41 years old, married and has four children.  For more than 18 years he has worked in a factory.  He is the sole breadwinner for the family since his wife his a homemaker and his children are still young.  Shokirjon lives with his family in an old building that does not meet housing standards.  He wants to make repairs, and it is necessary to renovate all rooms and to replace the windows and doors.  He is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy these doors and windows.  He awaits your kindness and assures that he will repay the loan on time.  This loan will help improve the standard of living for him and his family.

loans.use: To buy doors and windows for his house

loans.name: Lucy
