texts.es: Lucy, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación, así como también es amable y cordial, esta divorciada, vive en compañía de su hija de 24 años de edad en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Lucy es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una maquina de coser con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganar  su aceptación y así una buena clientela.Le gusta su negocio ya que adora la costura, además de las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por lo contrario comenta le incomoda un poco el cansancio físico por estar sentada en una misma postura que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima, continua trabajando y esforzándose. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, comprar maquinas de coser y dar trabajo a otras personas.Este será el préstamo número 08 con kiva, se siente agradecida con la ayuda financiera que viene recibiendo y desea continuar con este apoyo, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/. 2500 nuevos soles comprará 01 maquina de coser y materiales de costura como telas, hilos, y demás.
texts.en:
Lucy is 59 years old and she is a happy woman that strives to overcome all hardships.  She is very friendly and cordial.  She is divorced and she lives in her own home with her daughter who is 24 years old. Lucy is a seamstress, which is a profession that she learned by studying in an occupational school.  With her savings, she bought a sewing machine for her home which she uses to provide services to her customers who always come to her because she does great work.  She has managed to secure a loyal clientele.

She likes her work because she enjoys sewing and she can also earn good money. However, it is a bit uncomfortable as it is physically demanding work and she has to sit in the same position for a long time, which gives her back pain.  This does not discourage her as she continues working and getting stronger.  

She has plans to grow her business by buying more sewing machines and doing work for more customers.  This loan will be her 8th with Kiva.  She is thankful for the financial help that she has received and she wants to continue working with Kiva.  She promises to comply with the repayment schedule and pay punctually.  With the 2,500 soles that she is asking for, she will buy a sewing machine and sewing materials such as fabric, thread, and more.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Juntos Triunfaremos En Cocachacra Group

texts.es: “JUNTOS TRIUNFAREMOS EN COCACHACRA”  es un nuevo grupo conformado por 07 socios todos dedicados a diversas áreas del comercio así como también brindan servicios al público. Rosa es una de las socia tiene 39 años es conviviente con 2 hijos dependientes. En el grupo cumple la función de presidenta. Rosa hace 5 años implemento una pequeña bodega en su vivienda en donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y algunos productos de belleza. Con el cual ha podido ayudar a su esposo a mejorar la economía de su familia. Su mayor deseo  es tener una distribuidora en donde pueda ofrecer productos al por mayor. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de de arroz, azúcar y perfumería. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Rosa es la tercera del lado derecho tiene a su hijos en brazos.
texts.en:
Juntos Triunfaremos en Cocachacra is a new group made up of seven members who work in different areas of commerce as well as offering services to the public.

Rosa, 39, is one of the members.  She has a live-in partner and two dependent children.  She's the president of the group.

Five years ago Rosa set up a small grocery store in her house where she sells necessity items and some beauty products.  With this business she has been able to help her husband improve their family finances.  Her biggest desire is to have a distributorship where she can sell products wholesale.

She'll invest the loan in rice, sugar, and perfume.

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Rosa's the third one from the right; she has her child in her arms.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and perfume

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, de 39 años, es una mujer alegre y amable. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Antonio, quien es obrero de construcción civil. Tienen 3 hijos de 14, 08 y 03 años de edad respectivamente.Graciela se dedica al diseño, confección  y venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. Realiza esta actividad en un local de su vivienda. Lleva 04 años en esta actividad. Comenta que se  inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad de conseguir un empleo y una amiga le enseño a diseñar  y confeccionar para que pueda emprender en este rubro. Su conviviente la ayuda en las compras de sus materiales. Realiza esta actividad económica junto a unas amigas con quienes ha formado una sociedad. Considera rentable este negocio porque las empresas solicitan sus servicios para la confección de los uniformes de sus obreros al por mayor. Antes de iniciar este negocio su esposo se hacia cargo de los gastos de su hogar, pero su sueldo no alcanzaba para pagar las deudas que tenían por eso decidió aprender a diseñar y confeccionar. Espera en el futuro poner una tienda en el mercado de la ciudad para poder vender sus confecciones.Este será su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará de mercaderia tales como telas , algodón ,hilos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Graciela, 39 years old, is a happy and friendly woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Antonio, who works in civil construction. They have 3 children, who are 14, 08 and 03 years old. 

Graciela works in the design, manufacture and sale of clothes for ladies, gentleman and children. She carries out this activity from a premises in her home. She has been running this business for 04 years. She says that she started this activity because she needed a job. A friend taught her to design and make clothes, so that she could set up in this line of work. Her husband helps her purchase materials. 

She carries out this activity with some friends, with whom she has set up a society. She thinks that this business is profitable because companies request their manufacturing services for workers’ uniforms at a wholesale level. 

Before setting up this business, her husband took responsibility for the household expenses. But his salary did not cover all their debts. Therefore, she decided to learn how to design and make clothes. In the future she hopes to set up a shop in the city market where she can sell her clothes.

This will be her fourth loan with Kiva. She is grateful for the financial support she has received that helps her keep her business going. With the amount requested, S/.1000 soles, she will buy merchandise, such as fabrics, cotton and thread, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, cotton, etc.

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Unidos” el cual se encuentra ubicado en el distrito del Cusco. 

La socia Laura nació en la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, la socia tiene 05 hijos y es soltera, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de comida, la socia tiene un pequeño restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como aceite, arroz entre otros. La socia se siente agradecida con los inversionistas de Kiva y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, venta de ropa, tienda de abarrotes, venta de papa, venta de comida, preparación de bebidas.

La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
El socio que aparece a la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Laura belongs to the “Siempre Unidos” (Always United) communal bank located in Cusco District.  She was born in the city of Puerto Maldonado and she’s single and has five children.  She continues with her business selling food.  She has a small restaurant that she’s had for some time now.  She does well due to the daily effort she puts into her business. She wants to continue working in order to continue supporting her family this way.  She’s requesting the loan to buy ingredients like oil and rice, among others.  She feels grateful to Kiva lenders and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

The other members sell mobile phones, clothes, groceries, potatoes, food and make beverages.

The person with the blurred face is not a member of the communal bank. The borrower in the photo at the bottom left arrived late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida, de 40 años vive con Leandro su esposo. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: María y Fabricio a los que cuidan en la casa que compraron hace muchos años.Aida se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeña pero cuando conformó su familia incrementó sus fuerzas y comercializó sus sembríos de papa, alverja, maíz y habas. A un inicio negociaba sus propias cosechas de manera eventual, conforme pasó el tiempo mejoró sus clientes y tuvo que aumentar y comprar a otros agricultores . En la actualidad no solo vende las verduras y alimentos que siembra, también vende queso en otra ciudad. Ahora ella desea seguir creciendo y obtener más prestigio.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo recibido, ya que le ayuda a invertir en sus sembríos. Promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues gusta de ser honesto y responsable.Aida, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Forty year-old Aida lives with her husband Leandro with two of their five children, Maria and Fabricio, whom they care for in the home they bought many years ago. 

Aida has worked in agriculture since she was very young but when she began to build a family she increased her efforts and began selling her potato, pea, corn and broad bean crops. She initially sold her own harvests but over time she increased her client base and had to expand by purchasing from other farmers. She currently not only sells the vegetables and foods that she harvests, but also sells cheese in another city. 

She now hopes to continue growing and to become more established. This is her first KIVA loan and she is thankful for the support she has received. It enables her to invest in her crops. She pledges to make her repayments on time because she likes to be honest and responsible.

Aida will use the money to purchase organic manure to nourish her crops as harvest time approaches.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure.

loans.name: Alianza Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALIANZA” iniciará el vigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sarah es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de deportivos, venta de chancaca y dulces, artesana, venta de awayos, ropa de bebe, confección de deportivos, tienda de barrio, artesanía en latas, venta de queso, macramé de mantas, tejido de prendas de vestir.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sarah es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de su madre y al ver la necesidad que se tenía en su zona.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra arroz, fideo, azúcar, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene una hija.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alianza" [Alliance] will begin its twentieth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana [Focal Point of Pan-America].  The group is made up of twelve members and is led by a committee of directors; Sarah is the Secretary.  The members are involved in different types of businesses, like sewing sports clothing, selling corn cakes and sweets, making handicrafts, selling woven textiles, children's clothing, making sports clothing, having a neighborhood store, tin craftwork, selling cheese, blanket macramé, and weaving clothing.  The loan that they will take out will benefit these small micro-businesses.  

Sarah is a group member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for ten years, joining through the invitation of a friend who was already a member of the institution.  Presently, she has a neighborhood store.  She began this business at the recommendation of her mother, and because she saw the need in her neighborhood.

The loan she will take out is to grow her capital (by buying rice, noodles, sugar, etc.).  She will buy these items from stores and will later place them in her shop.  This form of work allows her to generate revenue in order to maintain her home.  She is married and has one daughter.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: John Esteban

texts.es:
John de 20 años, es un joven emprendedor que desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su madre y hermanos, por lo cual hoy tiene un sueño que espera hacer realidad con la solicitud de un crédito. Dedicarse al comercio de ropa, es hoy su gran reto, ya que tendrá la oportunidad de tener un trabajo estable que le permita colaborar con los gastos del hogar y acceder a la educación superior. 
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de calzado, jeans y camisas. 
Espera que con dicha inversión mejore su condición económica y pueda garantizarle a su familia estabilidad.
texts.en: John is 20 and is a hardworking young man who wants to give his mother and his siblings a better quality of life. He hopes to make this dream a reality by applying for a loan. His goal is to sell clothes for a living, which will give him the opportunity to have a stable job and thereby contribute to the household costs and attend higher education. He will invest the money in buying shoes, jeans and shirts. He hopes that with this investment he will be able to improve his economic situation and guarantee his family's stability.

loans.use: To buy shoes, jeans and shirts.

loans.name: Yunior Rafael

texts.es:
Yunior e sun joven de carácter muy alegre y sobre todo carismático, vive en el distrito de Parcona, caracterizado por la amabilidad de su pobladores.  Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Yunior solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Mecanica Automotriz, ya que le gusta mucho arreglar vehiculos.

Cada Dia Yunior trabaja como chofer de taxi, y con este oficio el puede apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar y asimismo apoyar a sus hermanos menores con los gastos de su escuela, Yunior trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al dia y puede atender hasta  20 clientes diariamente; Yunior cree que esta saliendo adelante cada día porque es responsable y porque tiene fe en va a mejorar cada día.

Yunior esta muy agradecido con el apoyo que le están brindando los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado el podrá apoyar a su madre en la compra de un horno, ya que su madre tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de tortas y bocaditos, de esta manera podrán mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y Yunior seguirá trabajando muy duro para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener una gran panadería al lado de su madre y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Yunior is a young man with a very happy demeanor, and above all he is very charismatic. He lives in the district of Parcona, known for the friendliness of its residents. Due to a lack of financial resources, Yunior was only able to study through the fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to have studied for the career of Auto Mechanic, as he really likes to fix vehicles.

Each day Yunior works as the chauffeur of a taxi, and with this position he is able to support his mother with the living expenses and also help his younger siblings with their school expenses. Yunior works about 10 hours a day and may attend to as many as 20 clients a day. Yunior believes that he is getting ahead each day because he is responsible and because he has faith that he is getting better every day.

Yunior is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are providing him, as thanks to the support they have provided he will be able to support his mother in the purchase of an oven. His mother has a small business selling cakes and snacks. In this way he will be able to improve his family's quality of life, and Yunior will keep working very hard to be able to make his biggest dream come true: "To have a bakery with his mother and to study for a university career."

loans.use: to buy an oven

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 60 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, a los que cuidaron y criaron con mucho amor. Ahora ellos viven solos en la casa que compraron hace muchos años atrás. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, durante las mañanas vende dulces y bebidas en la escuela estatal de su localidad. Además hace algunos años compró 2 autos, con los que realiza trasporte público cubriendo varias rutas, en este negocio le ayuda su esposo, quien maneja uno de los carros. Por otro lado vende habas crocantes a diversas tiendas, donde ella visita 3 veces por semana, ahí recibe buenas ganancias, pues es conocida. Luz siempre aprovecha las fechas festivas, donde puede vender distintos productos con mayor demanda.Este es el quinto crédito con KIVA y está contenta con el apoyo financiero que recibe ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio , por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Luz; invertirá los S/.4500 soles en la compra de dulces para su venta y demás golosinas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Luz is sixty years old and is a simple woman.  She lives with her husband.  Together, they have five children, whom they take care of and raise with a lot of love.  Today, they live alone in the house that they bought many years ago.  

She is a hardworking woman.  In the mornings, she sells sweets and drinks in the state school in her neighborhood.  Two years ago, she also bought two cars, which she now uses to provide a public transportation service covering several routes.  In this business, her husband helps her; he drives one of the cars.  She also sells popular crunchy Andean beans to different stores; she visits three times a week.  She makes good profits since she is well-known.  Luz always takes advantage of the festive dates, where she can sell distinct products with a lot of demand.  

This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and she is happy with the financial support that she receives, since she thereby feels secure in advancing her business.  She also promises to pay her installments in a punctual manner.

Luz will invest S/.4500 soles in the purchase of sweets to sell and other snacks wholesale.

loans.use: to buy sweets and snacks wholesale.

loans.name: Jonh James

texts.es: Jonh de 37 años de edad, ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a laborar en talleres de mecánica y soldadura, experiencia que hoy desea utilizar en la creación de su propio negocio, con el fin de comenzar a laborar como independiente y garantizarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un compresor e insumos para abrir su negocio. Sueña con crecer dentro del mercado local y tener un gran almacén de repuestos.
texts.en:
Fidel, 37 years old, has spent most of his life working in garages and welding shops. He now wants to use this experience to start his own business, in order to start to work independently and to ensure better living conditions for his family. 

He is requesting a loan that he will use to invest in a compressor and supplies to start his business. He dreams of growing in the market and having a large warehouse of spare parts.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and mechanic supplies.

loans.name: Segundo Ricardo

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre de 60 años, vive en la ciudad de Camana con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que   junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar, Segundo no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Segundo trabaja alquilando un pequeño local comercial a diversos vendedores y comerciantes de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Segundo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de piso en su hogar, de esta manera Segundo y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una vivienda adecuada.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 60 year old man. He lives in the city of Camana with his wife and their two children, whom he loves. They are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person. He and his wife dedicate all of their efforts to helping their family get ahead.

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the necessity that he work, Segundo wasn't able to study a professional degree. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends. At times, he cooks a delicious Peruvian shrimp chowder to share with his family.

At his own initiative, and with a lot of persistence and dedication, Segundo works renting a small business space out to various vendors and merchants in his city. He works every day for approximately 10 hours and he thinks that it is going well for him because of the kind way in which he treats others.

Segundo is very appreciative of Kiva lenders, because he will be able to improve his home thanks to the help that they provide. He wants to plaster and paint his walls and lay down floors. In this way, Segundo and his family will have better security and well-being, and he will continue working and pushing himself to achieve his great dream of having adequate housing.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Jesus Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento JESUS ES MI PASTOR, Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres,   la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Aida tiene 55 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, su panadería  que se encuentra ubicado  en la localidad de el Torno,  es cliente antigua de la institución, saco los anteriores créditos siempre para mejorar su negocio, La Sra. Aida va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción como tejas para la construcción de un techo para el lugar donde se encuentra su horno, La Sra. Aida es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: The "Jesus es mi pastor" communal bank is made up of eight members, all of whom are women.  The bank's president is Aida - she is 55 years old and makes a living baking and selling bread.  Her bakery is in Torno and she has been with the communal bank for some time.  Aida's previous loans have always been taken out to improve her business.  Aida will use this loan to buy construction material such as tiles to build a roof on the place where her oven is.  Aida wants to overcome problems and is happy with and grateful to the institution for the support provided as this is the only work she has to support herself.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Carmen Paola

texts.es: La Sra. Carmen tiene 21 años, casada y  tiene un hijo de la edad de 2 años,  se dedica  a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir desde hace ya 3 años ella confecciona variedad de ropa,  su taller se encuentra en su mismo domicilio que se encuentra en la  zona de Plan 3000, la Sra. Carmen va a utilizar este préstamo para la  compra de telas para la confección de prendas de vestir por mayor, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital de inversión ya que ella tiene pedidos y también  que entrega el producto terminado a distintas ferias donde venden sus productos,   la Sra. Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son aumentar sus ingresos y va a utilizar los beneficios invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para la confección de prendas de buena calidad y así tener más pedidos de clientes,  la Sra. Carmen es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Carmen, 21, is married and has a two-year-old child. She is a seamstress and has been making and selling all kinds of garments for three years. Her workshop is located at home, in an area called “Plan 3000.”

Carmen will use this loan to buy fabrics in bulk for her garments. The reason why she requests this loan is the need to increase her investment capital, since she has orders to fulfill and she also takes some of her creations to different fairs to sell them.

Carmen wants to increase her profits, something she sees as a challenge. She will use the profits to buy materials to produce good quality garments and attract more customers. Carmen is a hardworking person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the help she has received from them.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make clothes.

loans.name: Tatiana Yiselth

texts.es: La Señora Tatiana humilde trabajadora, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella labora para una clinica privada como enfermera, y tambien se dedica a trabajar la tierra cosechando Piña, actualmente tiene  una manzana sembrada y  requiere de Mantenimiento con este credito comprara los insumos y ferlizantes necesarios tales como: Urea, Triple, Completo etc, Agredece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado estos años.
texts.en: Tatiana is humble and hard-working and lives in the town of Ticuantepe.  Her biggest dream is to improve her living conditions.  She works in a private clinic as a nurse and also makes a living growing pineapple plants.  She currently has an area of land where she has sown the seeds and now needs to maintain the plants.  Tatiana will use this loan to buy the necessary supplies and fertilisers, such as urea, Triple and Completo (both fertilisers).  Tatiana is grateful for the support that Kiva and Afodenic have given her in recent years.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional amount of fish, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
La señora Ana Eluvia es madre soltera, cuenta con 23 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 1 hijo, ella se dedica a la comprar pollos de engorde y lu7ego los vende, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado y hasta la fecha lleva 11 años de experiencia; también cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de 50 pollos y concentrado para alimentarlos, en el futuro desea tener una granja grande para obtener mejores ganancias y sacar adelante a su hijo; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades agricolas.
texts.en:
Ana Eluvia is a single mother.  She is 23 years old and didn't have the opportunity to study.  She has one child.  Her business is buying, fattening and re-selling chickens.  She started this business with a little capital that she had saved up and currently has 11 years experience.  She has the support of her family.

Ana Eluvia formed a group so that she could request a loan to buy 50 chickens and concentrated feed for them.  In the future, she would like to have a large farm so that she can make more profits and provide for her son.  The other members of this group work in farming.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es:
Socias que forman un grupo solidario de tres socias emprendedoras, de éxito, una de ellas es Ericka tiene 27 años de edad, casada con tres niños de 8,7,y 4 años de edad menores, su negocio es la venta de ropa, perfumen, cosméticos de la Vogue, Zermat y esta actividad tiene cinco años de tener su negocio. De ser cliente de la institución tiene  tres años consecutivos lo que demuestra responsabilidad en sus pagos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra ropa como pantalón de varón, pantalón 
de mujer, camisas de varón, camisolas de damas, blusas, faldas de mujer, cosméticos como perfumen de varón, perfumen de damas, lociones, delineadores, máscaras, pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, champo, tintes para cabellos, cremas para manos, cremas para cuerpos, cremas para pies, cremas faciales, cremas para todo el cuerpo, etc. Maricela tiene 29 años de edad y su negocio es  la venta de sandalias y cosméticos variados y Digna tiene 48 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The members form a united group of three enterprising and successful women. 

One of them is Ericka, 27, who is married with three children aged 8, 7 and 4. Her business is selling clothes, perfume and cosmetics from Vogue and Zermat. She has been running this business for 5 years. She has been a customer of the institution for three years and has shown responsibility in her payments. She will invest the loan in purchasing clothes like men's and women's trousers and shirts, blouses, skirts and cosmetics like cologne, perfume, lotions, eyeliners, mascaras, nail varnish, lipstick, shampoo, hair dye, hand, foot and face creams and body lotions etc.

Maricela, 29, has a business selling sandals and various cosmetics and Digna, 48, has a business selling food from her home.

loans.use: to buy new clothes like trousers and shirts for men and women, skirts and blouses and cosmetics like cologne and perfume, lotions, eyeliner, mascara, nail polish, lipstick, shampoo, hair dye, hand and foot cream and body lotion etc,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 63 años, es viuda y vive sola en su casa propia. Sus hijos ya son independientes, viven en otras ciudades con sus respectivas familias.El trabajo de María consiste en  la confección y venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños. Realiza esta actividad en un local en el interior de su vivienda. Lleva 08 años en esta actividad y comenta que se  inicio en esta actividad desde muy joven, porque siempre le gustó diseñar  y confeccionar. Comenta que le gusta su actividad ya que le permite diseñar su creatividad y seguir adelante a pesar de estar sola. Espera en el futuro poner una tienda en el mercado de la ciudad para poder vender sus confecciones.Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 08 con Kiva, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por darle la oportunidad que necesita para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará materiales como telas, blondas, elásticos e hilos para seguir confeccionando  y produciendo ya que tiene muchos pedidos  para hacer  vestuarios para las fiestas de su localidad.
texts.en: María is 63 years old and lives alone in her own house.  Her children are now independent and live in other cities with their respective families.  María makes a living producing and selling clothing for men, women and children.  She does this work from home.  She started eight years but has been doing similar work since she was very young as she enjoys designing and producing items.  María likes the work as it allows her to use her creativity and to move forward in life, even though she is on her own.  She hopes to open a stall in the city's market in the future, so that she can sell her clothes.  This will be María's eighth loan with Kiva and she is very grateful for being given the opportunity that she needs in order to get ahead.  With the loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles she will buy items such as material, blond lace, elastic and thread in order to continue producing clothing.  She has a lot of orders to prepare articles of clothing for the towns' festivals.

loans.use: to buy materials, blond lace, elastic and thread.

loans.name: Fernando Gabino

texts.es:
Fernando es un hombre de 64 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Fernando pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las playas de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Estofado de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Fernando se dedica a la agricultura, el cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra frejoles, el trabaja todos los días realizando labores de campo y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 8 horas, el Fernando se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Fernando se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la compra y pago de mano de obra del abono que necesita para su cultivo, de esta manera Fernando podrá asegurar una buena cosecha, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fernando is 64 years old and lives in the city of Camaná, along with his wife and two children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for life.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, along with his wife, puts forth all his efforts to getting his family ahead.  Thanks to his efforts, Fernando was able to study for the career in agriculture that he wanted.  He likes to go to the beaches in the city in his spare time and sometimes cooks a delicious “Estofado de Pollo” to share with his family.

He is a farmer on his own initiative and through great dedication and effort, and he has a parcel of land where he raises beans.  He works every day in the fields and can do so for about eight hours.  Fernando is comfortable doing his work and believes that things are going well for him because of his experience and the good treatment he provides others.

Fernando is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because he will be able to cover his cost of supplies and labor for the fertilizer he needs for his crops.  In this way Fernando will be able to ensure a good harvest and continue working toward achieving his greatest dream of completing his home.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus helping her improve her overall sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize and cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Banku’

loans.name: Karen Lorena

texts.es:
Karen es una joven de 27 años de edad emprendedora, con muchos sueños, mucha energía y ganas de salir adelante junto a su pareja y sus 2 hijos. Ella tiene una educación de secundaria completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres graduándose de bachiller en Ciencia y Letras. Ella es una joven con deseos de superare en la vida y es por eso que decidió emprender una idea de negocio y ponerla en práctica aperturando una venta de comida, golosinas entre otras variedades ubicado en un punto estratégico en el centro de la zona donde ella habita en sus cercanías están las bodegas, carnicerías, abarroterías, etc.

Ella actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de equipo de cocina como ser: electrodomésticos, mesas y sillas plásticas para poder iniciar su negocio con una buena base. 

Sus planes en un futuro es tener su negocio bien establecido, sólido y más acondicionado ya que sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos crecer y darles una buena educación la cual sea de beneficio y apoyo para ellos en un futuro.
texts.en:
Karen, 27, is a young enterprising woman with a lot of dreams, energy and desire to succeed alongside her partner and 2 children. She has a secondary school education, which she was able to study for thanks to her parents support and graduation with a diploma in science and language. She is a young woman with desires to do well in life and this is why she decided to set up a business and make her dreams a reality by opening a food sales shop, selling snacks among other things, located in a strategic location in the centre of the zone she lives in, in the surrounding area there are bodegas, butchers and grocery stores, etc.

She is currently requesting help to buy kitchen equipment like electrical appliances, plastic chairs and tables so she can start her business in a good position.

Her future plans are to have a solid, well established business as her dream is to see her children grow up and to provide them with a good education that will aid and support them in future.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs, electric household appliances and tables for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cooking stove

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Claire's Group

texts.en:
Claire's group consists of two hardworking women. Claire is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past two years, Claire has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells poultry chicken. 

To help expand her business, Claire has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicks and feed for the farm, and will help Claire generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young sister. Claire hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a commercial house for herself. 

Claire is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and feed for the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Gwendoline

texts.en:
Gwendoline is 22 years old. She is married and lives in the busy town of Lusaka, Zambia. She is expecting her first child. She runs a mobile money transfer business in the city centre. 

Gwendoline is a hard working woman who has been able to increase the commissions she receives from the money transfer transactions. She has managed to employ one person at her trading booth. She is convinced that her business will be successful because it is what her customers need, and is located at the city centre, convenient for everyone.

Her greatest challenge is the lack of money in the business. Right now, Gwendoline is operating with a minimum working capital of $1000. This is not enough because it limits the number of customers she can attend to, especially since she is located at one of the busiest places in town.

As her customers are very important to her, Gwendoline wants to use the loan money to increase her working capital. This will also enable her to serve her customers that are sending and receiving larger sums of money. She says having more money in the business will also help her earn more profits. The anticipated increase in her profit margins will give Gwendoline a chance to give her unborn child a better life. 

Gwendoline dreams of expanding her business by opening more mobile money transfer shops.

loans.use: To grow her business by adding to the working capital of her mobile money transfer outlet, allowing her serve more customers and to send and receive larger amounts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stock e.g cooking oil, maize flour,sugar etc.

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es: Mirta, de 40 años de edad, está divorciada. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijas de 21 y 17 años respectivamente, quienes la ayudan en los que haceres del hogar de su casa propia, la cual logro construir con el apoyo de sus hijas.El trabajo que realiza Mirta  es la  venta de ropas para damas, caballeros  y niños, de diversas marcas y modelos que están a la moda, los cuales trae a pedido, contando con muchos clientes, esta actividad la realiza de modo ambulatorio, y reparte a domicilio, ya lleva como 5 años en éste negocio, la cual lo realiza sola pero de manera muy alegre.Lo que le gusta de ésta actividad es que le genera un ingreso económico con el cua genera un sustento para la economía de su hogar, se siente contenta  ya que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones. Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva, se siente muy contenta con la oportunidad brindada ya que desea seguir creciendo laboralmente.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1200 nuevos soles, comprará más ropas de niños y damas al por mayor para obtener mayores márgenes de ganancia.
texts.en:
Mirta, 40, is divorced. She lives with her two daughters, aged 21 and 17, who help her with the household tasks in their own home, which she was able to build with the help of her daughters.

Mirta works selling clothes for men, women and children of various brands and designs that are in fashion, which she collects to order, relying on her customers. She works as a travelling salesperson and delivers to homes. She has been running this business for 5 years, which she does alone but happily. She likes it because it generates economic income, which maintains the household finances. She is happy that she has brought a lot of satisfaction. 

This will be her second Kiva loan, she is very happy with the opportunity offered and wants to continue growing in her business. With the requested sum of 1200 PEN, she will buy more clothes for women and children at wholesale prices in order to gain the best profit margins.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Rossadeic's Group

texts.en:
Gladys, 35, is married with two adorable children who are of school-going age. She did not have the opportunity to go to school herself. She sells foodstuffs like cassava and plantains. She began this business by learning it from her mother and now she has ten years of experience. She joined this group and has decided to request a loan of GHS 800 to be used to purchase of cassava and plantains. In this way, she can increase her working capital. 
The other members are Sampson, Rita, Peter, Edith, Nancy, Comfort and Sabina, and the other members of the group make their livings in sales.
Their businesses include secondhand vehicle spare parts, dress materials, manufacturing of sandals and shoes, fish, and provisions.
In the future she hopes to have enough capital to be able to supply to her numerous customers, which is her ambition.

loans.use: To purchase cassava and plantains.

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Emise quien con su credikiva pudo comprar una máquina de coser. Emilse logró aumentar la productividad de su taller y sus ventas tambien se han incrmentado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una máquina recubridora industrial, la cual dará un perfecto acabado a sus productos, especialmente a la ropa en tejido de punto. Ella envia un mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva: "Valoro enormemente todoa la ayuda recibida" haciendo notar lo feliz que se encuentra por su gran apoyo a los microempresarios.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Emilse who used her previous Kiva loan to buy a sewing machine.  She managed to increase the productivity of her workshop and her sales have also increased.  She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy an industrial cover stitch machine.  This will allow her to give her products a perfect finish, especially knitted clothing.  Emilse sends this message to Kiva lenders: "I really value all the help I have received".  Emilse shows how happy she is for the great support that Kiva lenders are giving to micro-businesspeople.

loans.use: to buy an industrial cover stitch machine

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
This is Jean, 44, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Pomposo, a maintenance staff member, and is a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jean operates a peanut butter making business. What she basically does is buy raw peanuts and other ingredients needed to make her product from the market, process it, then repackage it and sell it per piece to individuals, general store owners, and the local community. Peanut butter is repacked in 250 and 500 grams plastic bottles. She also has a food stall. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy products like peanut butter, margarine, oil, sugar, meat, rice and other ingredients for her products.

Jean hopes that her business will grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for products like peanut butter, margarine, oil, sugar, meat, rice and other ingredients for her products and food stall.

loans.name: El Injerto Group

texts.es:
El señor Carlos de estado vicil casado tiene 46 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene 9 hijos y de ellos 5 estan estudiando, él se dedica a la agricultura, inició este negocio por la necesidad de generar ingresos económicos para sostener a su familia y hasta la fecha lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien lo ayuda en la agricultura.

Organiza un grupo y decide solitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos, como: fertilizante, semillas para sus cosechas, en el futuro desea tener mejores y abundantes cosechas cada año; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la agricultura, sembrado café, maíz y frijol. En la fotografía aparecen 11 personas pero solamente a 7 de ellos se les concedió el préstamo.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 46-year-old, married man. He has completed six years of primary education and he has 9 children, 5 of whom are currently in school. He makes his living as a farmer. He started this business in order to generate income to sustain his family. He has 20 years of experience and he has the support of his wife who works with him on the farm. 

He organizes a group and they decided to request a loan that will be used to purchase supplies, such as fertilizer and seeds for their crops. In the future they hope to have better and bountiful harvests every year. 

The other members of the group work in agriculture, growing coffee, corn and beans. In the photo there are 11 people, but only 7 of them were given the loan.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Roberto hombre humilde, trabajador habita en el municipio de La Concepcion su mayor sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de Vida y darle a su familia un  mejor porvenir, su esposa lo apoya con las tareas del hogar y el cuido de sus hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de la tierra actualmente tiene sembrada piña la cual necesita de Mantenimiento, con este credito el comprar los insumos y fertilizantes necesarios para darle un optimo Cuido y Mantenimiento comprara: Urea, Triple,Completo etc. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Roberto is a humble, hard-working man who lives is the municipality of La Concepcion. His main dream is to improve improve his living conditions and provide his family with a better future. 

His wife helps with the household tasks and takes care of his children and he works on the land and has planted pineapple seeds, which need maintenance. With this loan he will buy supplies and fertilisers necessary to give his crops optimal care and maintenance. He will buy urea, fertilisers, etc. 

He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have offered.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camana con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Melissa no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por las playas de su ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Melissa trabaja como obrera de campo en algunas parcelas agrícolas de su ciudad, ella realiza labores de sembrado, recojo de cultivos y otros, Melissa trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas.
Melissa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar  el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea poder tarrajear y ponerle piso de concreto a su hogar, de esta manera ella y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Melissa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Melissa, 20, is single and lives in the city of Camana with her parents and siblings. She is friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic, and eager to succeed. Melissa wasn't able to study agronomy as she wished because, sadly, she lacked the money to do so and had to work to help her parents. In her free time, she likes to walk on the city beaches and occasionally cook a delicious traditional chicken dish to share with her family.

With dedication and on her own initiative, Melissa works as a farmhand on several city plots, planting and picking crops every day from early morning for about 10 hours. She is grateful to Kiva lenders because their support will let her remodel her house. She wants to plaster the walls and lay a concrete floor, which will make her family safer and improve living conditions. Melissa will also be able to continue working and striving to achieve her great dream to study for a professional career.

loans.use: to remodel her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Doña María Victoria es una mujer de 41 años de edad casada y madre de 4 hijos dedicada a la agricultura y que además es ama de casa. Ella solo pudo cursar hasta el primer grado de educación primaria por la falta economía ella no pudo continuar.  El mayor de sus hijos ya está casado en un hogar a parte, la siguiente hija está en 8 grado, el que le sigue en 6 grado y el ultimo en 5 grado. Ellos tienen mucha experiencia y se dedican a la agricultura en lo que es la siembra de maíz y frijol hace más de 10 años y las tierras que ellos trabajan son propias gracias a una herencia familiar. Sus clientes son los diferentes compradores e intermediarios que llegan a la zona donde ella habita para revender. 

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para dar asistencia a sus cultivos de maíz ya que de esa manera ella podrá fortalecer su producción y aprovechar su cosecha al máximo.  

Su sueño como madre es apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios, en su vida y en todo lo que en sus manos esta para que ellos se superen y tengan una mejor condición de vida y mejores oportunidades ya que la tierra que ellos cultivan será su herencia y patrimonio.
texts.en:
María Victoria, 41, is married and the mother of four children.  She makes a living in agriculture in addition to being a housewife.  She only managed to complete the first grade of elementary school because she didn't have the economic resources to continue.

Her oldest child is already married and lives on his own.  The next daughter is is eighth grade, the next one in sixth, and the last in fifth.  They have a lot of experience in agriculture growing corn and beans for more than 10 years.  The land they farm is their own, thanks to a family inheritance.  Her customers are the various buyers and intermediaries who come to the area where she lives to resell.

Currently she's requesting a loan to buy inputs and fertilizer to take care of her corn plants because this way she'll be able to strengthen the crop and make the most of the harvest.

Her dream as a mother is to help her children with their studies, their lives, and everything she can so they can improve themselves and have better living conditions and opportunities, because the land they farm will be their inheritance and their patrimony.

loans.use: to buy inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Retina

texts.es: Retina, de 28 años de edad vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos.El trabajo de Retina consiste en la venta de ropa de segunda. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local en el  interior de su vivienda propia, pero también vende sus productos en las comunidades alrededor de la ciudad.Lleva 06 años en este negocio. Cuando tenía 18 años ayudaba  a su mamá a atender en su negocio, desde ahí tuvo la idea de tener  su negocio propio.Comenta que su  trabajo es rentable porque tiene muchos clientes. Además como compra al por mayor obtiene ganancias positivas. Comenta que antes de empezar con este negocio, no contaba con local propio y tenia que trasladarse de un lugar a otro, entonces decidió alquilar un establecimiento en una avenida muy transitable ,para luego construir un local presentable y cómodo en su hogar.Este será su sexto préstamo con Kiva razón por la cual se siente agradecido con el apoyo financiero brindado.Con el monto solicitado de S/. 3200 soles comprará ropa al por mayor para luego venderlo en su local.
texts.en:
Retina, 28, lives in her own home with her husband and 2 children. She sells second-hand clothes for a living, which she does at a store based in her own home, but she also sells her products to the communities in the surrounding area. 

She has been running this business for 6 years. When she was 18, she helped her mother to run her business and since then she planned to have her own business. She comments that her business is profitable because she has lots of customers and also that because she buys wholesale she makes a good profit. She tells us that before she started her business, she did not have her own site and had to move from place to place, then she decided to rent an establishment on a busy street and since then she has set up a comfortable and presentable store in her home. 

She will be her sixth Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support that it offers. With the requested sum of 3200 PEN she will buy wholesale clothes to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Las Estrellitas Group

texts.es: Aurora tiene 44 años  es soltera con 2 hijos educando. Es socia del nuevo grupo “LAS ESTRELLITAS”  el cual está conformado por 07 socios trabajadores y emprendedores. Aurora hace 31 años se dedica al cuidado de personas de la tercera edad. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a sus padres y hermanos ya que ellos no contaban con una economía estable. Actualmente vive con sus padres. Rosa es el único sustento de su familia en sus tiempos libre arregla cocina a gas. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos de cocinas a gas y también en los uniformes de sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Rosa es la tercera del lado derecho viste chompa roja.
texts.en: Aurora is 44 years old, is single, and has two children in school.  She is a member of the new group "Las estrellitas" (little stars), which is made up of 7 hard-working and entrepreneurial members. Aurora has dedicated herself for the past 31 years to caring for people in their old age.  From the time she was very young she had to work to help her parents and siblings since they could not count on a stable income.  Currently she lives with her parents.  Rosa is the only income earner in her family.  In her free time she fixes gas stoves.  Her loan will be invested in the purchase of parts for gas stoves and also to purchase school uniforms for her children.  Her greatest desire is to see her children become professionals.  The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan.  Rosa is the third person from the right side dressed in a red sweatshirt.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for gas stoves and school uniforms for their children.

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es: José de 40 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Siempre ha realizado su trabajo con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son: maíz y fríjol. José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: José is 40 years old and is very responsible when it comes to his household obligations.  He has always provided the best he could for his family.  José works with joy and enthusiasm, making a living in farming.  Every year he grow the main basic grains found in his part of the world: corn and beans.  José wants to increase his sales and so has come to the "Apoyo Integral" offices to apply for a loan in order to buy seeds, manure, fertiliser, pesticides and more.  He would like to count on the support he is requesting as he has no other income.  With the loan he will be able to continue bringing home his daily bread.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertiliser, pesticides and more.

loans.name: Ntalasha

texts.en:
Ntalasha is opening a second shop. It is for this reason that he is requesting another Kiva loan. When Ntalasha receives his new Kiva loan, he will use it to top up the $1,000 in savings he has put aside from the profits of his first shop. This will provide the working capital for his new location. He is very excited for the chance he has been given to grow his business.

Ntalasha is happy to let Kiva lenders know that the money they raised for him before has really helped his business grow. Today, he is able to serve more customers who want to send and receive money from his shop. The growth at his shop has given him enough courage to set up a second shop, in a different location.  He is very excited for the future.

loans.use: To open his second mobile money transfer shop

loans.name: Zukhra

texts.ru: Зухра замужняя женщина c одним ребенком. Ей 38 лет. Она живет со своей семьей в городе Турсунзаде. У нее среднее образование. Она трудолюбивая и отзывчивая женщина. Зухра начала работу в области земледелия 10 лет назад и все еще продвигает свою деятельность. Она получает хорошую выручку от сельского хозяйства, который позволяет ей поддерживать быт. Зухра занимается посевом помидоров, огурцов, картофеля и других видов овощей. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения минерального удобрения, чтобы улучшить процесс выращивания овощей. Зухра в дальнейшем намерена расширить свою земледельческую деятельность.
texts.en: Zukhra is 38 years old, married, and has one child. She lives with her family in the city of Tursun-zoda. She has a high-school education and is a hard-working, kind-hearted woman. Zukhra has been a farmer for ten years and earns a good living planting tomatoes, cucumbers, potatoes, and other vegetables. She is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers that will help her vegetables grow. In the future, Zukhra intends to expand her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a market stall.

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es María mujer de 32años, casada, su negocio es la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio que desde hace 8 años lo viene promoviendo, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cal, leña etc. María del Carmen tiene 57 años de edad y su negocio es la de una pulpería y un molino, Luz Marina tiene 31 años de  edad y su negocio es la venta de frijoles y venta de nacatamales.
texts.en:
This communal bank comprises three entrepreneurs, one of whom is 32-year-old María. She has been making and selling tortillas in her house for the past eight years. She will use this loan to buy corn, lime, wood, and more. 

María del Carmen is 57 and has a small grocery shop and a mill. Luz Marina is 31 and sells beans and nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy commodities such as corn, lime, wood, and more.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 51 años de edad vive con su hija en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 51 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter.  She has a shop where she sells staple goods, such as beans, milk, eggs, bread and more.  She has had the business for many years and this has given her sales experience, allowing her to earn higher profits.  María runs the shop out of her home and is known by the locals.  She has many customers as the place is always stocked up.  María wants to expand the business and invest more but she needs capital.  So, she is applying for a loan that will allow her to buy necessary items for her shop.  She assures us that she will pay off the debt and is confident that this loan will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, milk, eggs, bread and more.

loans.name: Miriam Luisa

texts.es:
Miriam es una mujer de 25, años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Miriam no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Miriam trabaja en su pequeño negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet, ella cuenta con un aproximado de 5 computadoras y brinda sus servicios en un pequeño local en el centro de su ciudad, Miriam trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Miriam se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un monitor y dos CPU, ya que desea renovar y aumentar el número de maquinas para su internet, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Miriam, 25, is single and lives in the city of Pisco with her parents.  She's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a great desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately, because she lacked the financial resources and had to work from a young age to help her parents, Miriam hasn't been able to study business as she would have liked.  In her free time she likes to play sports, and sometimes she cooks a delicious Carapulcra con Sopa Seca [a spicy Peruvian stew] to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Miriam works in her small business renting Internet connections.  She has approximately five computers and she offers service in a small space in the center of town.  Miriam works approximately 12 hours every day, and she thinks it's going well for her because of her good prices and the friendly way she treats people.

Miriam's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy a monitor and two CPUs.  She wants to update and increase the number of computers in her Internet cafe so she can continue working and making the effort to realize her big dream of being able to study for a profession.

loans.use: to buy a monitor and two CPUs

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
Arthur lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and blessed with three children. Two of them attend school. For three years now, Arthur has been operating a retail shop where he sells items like sugar and maize flour.

Arthur learned of Milango Financial Services through a friend. He now seeks a loan of KES 31,450 (Kenya shillings) to buy sugar and maize flour. He is also a mechanic and earns an income. He has ambitions of owning a whole shop in five years' time. The major challenge he faces in the business is competition. He also feels the rent he pays for the shop cuts down his income.

The income he will generate from the loan will pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seven bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Ena

texts.es:
Ena 
1000,000
2013-83
	Ena es una madre de 58 años de edad tiene  5  hijos,  todos mayores de edad vive en Puntarenas, ubicada en la costa pacífica de Costa Rica. Ena vive con su hijo, 2 nietas y una joven que  ayuda con  las tareas domésticas. Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa ubicado en el centro de Puntarenas, sin embargo, su negocio no se limita a este local. También tiene clientes en Nicoya, Guanacaste, Playa Samara y Garza. Se vende todo tipo de ropa: para los niños, hombres, mujeres, ropa deportiva, ropa íntima, ropa casual y de vestir. Ena sabe que sus clientes dependen de ella, por lo que se ha localizado su punto de venta principal en una ubicación central en esta ciudad.


	Ena tiene previsto utilizar el préstamo para financiar la compra de ropa de hombre, mujer y niño. Ella tiene un contacto al que se le garantizaba un buen precio, todo lo que necesita es un aumento de capital de trabajo para tomar ventaja de esta tarifa favorable. Microempresaria muy trabajadora. Ella se despierta muy temprano a las 4:30 AM para llevar a cabo las tareas de mantenimiento del hogar. A las 7:00 am se dirige a Puntarenas, a 10 kilómetros de su casa, donde instala su puesto de venta en el centro de la ciudad. Ena trabaja de 8 am a 5 pm, después del trabajo se dirige a las clases nocturnas en la que está trabajando en la finalización de la escuela primaria.

	 Ella espera ganar suficiente dinero para poder apoyar económicamente los estudios de sus nietos, así como hacer mejoras al hogar. Un obstáculo importante para Ena ha pasado por el proceso de solicitud de los permisos legales necesarios que necesita para vender de su ubicación en Puntarenas. Como resultado de su perseverancia, ha sido capaz de conseguir los permisos, aumentar sus ingresos y el nivel de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Ena, 58, is the mother of five grown children who live in Puntarenas, located on the Pacific coast of Costa Rica. She lives with her son, two granddaughters, and a young woman who helps with the housework. Ena owns a clothing business in the center of Puntarenas; however, her business is not limited to this location. She has clients in Nicoya, Guanacaste, Playa Samara, and Garza. She sells all types of clothing: for children, men, and women; sportswear; underwear; casual clothes; and formal clothing. Ena knows that her clients depend on her, so she has set up a shop in the center of the city.

Ena plans to use the loan to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing. She has a supplier who has guaranteed a good price, and she just needs more working capital to take advantage of this favorable offer. She is a hardworking, small businesswoman, who gets up at 4:30 AM to do housework. At 7:00 AM, she heads to Puntarenas, 10 kilometers from her house, where her shop in the city center is located. Ena works from 8 AM until 5 PM. After work, she attends night classes to finish her primary education. 

She hopes to make enough money to help pay for her granddaughters' education as well as to remodel her house. Through perseverance, she has overcome a big obstacle and obtained the permits necessary to sell at her location in Puntarenas and has increased her income and improved her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her stand, mainly stockings and tights.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:
This four-member subgroup of 'In God', is led by Sarah, a 46-year-old mother of two children who are 18 and 20 years of age. Sarah sells vegetables on a table in front of her house to customers from all walks of life.

The challenge that Sarah faces is providing efficient customer service, so she will use her first loan from ID-Ghana to purchase more wholesale vegetables to stock her business and satisfy customer demand. She will use the loan's benefits to improve her family's quality of life, as this is the only activity that enables her to support her husband and children.

Sarah is happy and grateful to the institution for the support offered to her and the other members who will use their loan portions to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth and materials used in embroidery.

loans.name: Misozi

texts.en:
Misozi is now 23 years old. Misozi continues to pursue her accounting studies through evening classes while managing her growing Zoona mobile money transfer business. She would like to thank her lenders for the first loan they gave her. The loan helped her increase her working capital and paint her shop. This enabled her to serve more customers and earn more profits since her shop is now more visible to potential customers and she has cash to transact. She has been saving most of her profits in order to open two more shops; one in Kitwe's Chimwemwe compound and another right next to her main shop in downtown Lusaka. 

She is requesting a second Kiva loan, so that she can increase her working capital for her newest shop which is located in the main Lusaka town. Misozi says in the business of mobile money transfers, money is always moving and as such the more customers you have, the more money you need to satisfy them. Misozi's new shop sees a lot of customers coming and going since it is located very close to many banks and the main post office. This has the potential to give Misozi a lot of customers, but unfortunately she does not have enough working capital float to satisfy them all. With her Kiva loan she hopes to never have to turn away a customer.

loans.use: To grow her business by expanding the working capital of her new shop so she can perform more customer transactions and increase her commissions.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru:
Феруза женщина в возрасте  37 лет.  Феруза замужем, мать троих замечательных детей. После окончания средней школы, она не стала поступать в ВУЗ, так как для этого не было возможности.  Фируза очень трудолюбивая и энергичная девушка. Муж Фирузы находится на заработках в РФ. Один заработок мужа не хватает и поэтому Фируза не стала сидеть дома и начала помогать своему мужу. Она решила самостоятельно зарабатывать деньги. 
 Два года назад в центре района она открыла свой магазинчик, где предоставляла услуги ксерокопии.   За эти два года  Фируза привлекла к себе достаточно клиентов. 
 В данный момент она хочет расшириться и открыть компьютерные  услуги.   Чтобы осуществить свои планы ей необходимо купить компьютер, но для этого у неё недостаточно денежных  средств.   По этому поводу Фируза обратилась за кредитом в организацию Арванд.    Феруза заранее выражает свою благодарность организацию Арванд  за оказанную помощь.
texts.en: Feruza is a 37 year-old woman.  She is married and a mother of three remarkable children.  After finishing school, she did not go to a university due to a lack of opportunity.  Feruza is a very hardworking and energetic young woman.  Her husband is working in the Russian Federation.  The husband's salary alone is not enough, and this is why Feruza decided not to stay at home and to help her husband.  She decided to earn money independently.  She opened her store, where she provides copy services, two years ago in the district center.  Feruza attracted enough customers over these two years.  Currently, she wants to expand and start providing computer services.  In order to realize her plans, she has to purchase a computer, but does not have enough money for this.  This is why Feruza requested a loan from the Arvand organization.  Feruza expresses her gratitude to the Arvand organization for the provided help in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a computer

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro lives in Kaloleni, near Mariakani, Kenya. He has sold motorcycle spare parts for five years. He started with capital from family contributions.

He heard of Milango from friends and now seeks a loan of 10,650 Kenya shillings to buy one carton of oil, 20 motorbike tubes and 20 breaks. The extra income from the loan will contribute to his savings.

He wishes to have a big garage in the future.

loans.use: to buy one carton of oil, 20 motorbike tubes and 20 breaks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of farming chemicals, so she can improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical spares.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 27-year-old micro-entrepreneur who owns a mobile money shop in Lusaka’s Kamwala compound. She lives with her two nieces and one nephew. In her shop, Pamela offers money transfers and airtime. She does all of her customers' transactions using a mobile phone, allowing her clients to send money around Zambia and top up airtime in an easy, quick and safe manner. 

She has been running her business for five months now and has been able to hire two employees for her booth. Her business benefits her community because it provides an accessible and affordable financial services platform, allowing customers to move their money around Zambia safely.  Pamela has requested a Kiva loan so that she can increase her working capital float. This will enable her grow her business and service more customers, since expanding her client base requires more funds on hand.

Pamela is hopeful that once she has increased her float money, she will get more commissions, and will therefore be able to save up enough money to find another location where she can set up a second shop. Pamela describes herself as a simple lady who loves to smile and encourage people around her. Her biggest dream is to grow her business so that she can take better care of herself, and her late brother’s children.

loans.use: To grow her mobile money transfer business by adding more working capital so she can increase her customer transactions.

loans.name: Delisa

texts.en:
Delisa, age 29, is a mother, a wife, and a guardian. She has two sons, ages ten and seven. She lives with her family in a rented house. 

Delisa runs a business which provides a mobile money transfer service for people in Zambia. Her business helps her to provide for her family, even though it is not an easy undertaking. The major challenge she faces in her business is that she lacks capital to expand. This has incapacitated her growth. She says she has been running her business for some time now and it has remained the same. She had applied for a loan at a bank, but it was rejected because she did not have any collateral. 

Delisa is grateful for the opportunity to be on Kiva. When she gets her Kiva loan, she intends to open another outlet in a township called Mtendere.  She explains that she has already found the space, but does not have the start-up capital to start running her new shop. The capital will be used to purchase a trading booth for the new outlet. 

Delisa‘s biggest dream is to grow her business, so that she can one day build a house from the proceeds of her business because the cost of rent in Lusaka is high.

loans.use: to grow her business by purchasing a trading booth to run a new mobile money transfer outlet in Mtendere compound.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en:
Harold lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. He is married and has eight children. He does welding as a career and business. He has been doing this for fifteen years now.

He came to know about Milango through friends and now he is seeking a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine, steel and a grinding disk.
