Hayde is a 27-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three young children, ages 2, 3 and 4 months old respectively. She is engaged in a fish vending business. Her husband is a fisherman. She sells fish to customers in the community. She and her husband work hard to earn a living. 

She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fishing net, lift weights and floaters,to gain more catch. 

In the future, Hayde would like to augment her business to provide her family with good food and to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, lift weights and floaters.

loans.name: Katrina

texts.en:
As a  parent of two children, Katrina works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Katrina is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of fish to sell for her business.

Katrina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Giovanni

texts.es:
Giovanni es hombre dedicado a su familia y apasionado a su trabajo, desde hace más de 15 años aprendió el oficio de mecánica empleándose en un taller. Hoy busca la forma de independizarse y crear su propio negocio con el fin de mejorar su condición económica y garantizarles a sus tres hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación. Razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de repuestos, lubricantes y herramientas.
El taller lo abrirá en un pequeño garaje de propiedad familiar, por lo cual tendrá mejores rendimientos. Sueña con posicionar su negocio y convertirlo en el mejor de su localidad. Asegura que el bienestar de su familia es lo más importante por lo cual trabajará fuertemente para garantizarcelo.
texts.en:
Giovanni is a man who's dedicated to his family and passionate about his work. Over 15 years ago he learned the trade of auto mechanics by working for a repair shop. Today he seeks to become independent and start his own business so that he can improve his financial situation and ensure better living conditions and a good education for his children. That's why he's requesting a loan which he'll use to purchase spare parts, lubricants and tools.
He will set up the shop in a small garage his family owns, which will result in better profits. He dreams of establishing his business and turning it into the best shop in town. He guarantees that his family's well-being is the most important thing, which is why he'll work very hard in order to ensure it.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, lubricants and tools.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 31 years old and lives in Highway Lawis, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has no children. 

Ruth has a pig raising business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to pay for a sack of feed.

Ruth has been a member of PMPC since just 1 month ago. In the future, Ruth hopes to have enough savings for additional capital in her business.

loans.use: to pay for a sack of feed.

loans.name: Lorlain

texts.en:
This 46-year old mother with three children is from San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is Lorlain, who runs a "sari-sari" (general) store that sells a variety of products. She supports her family with this business. 

She is applying for a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy additional inventory for sale. She sees the high demand at the store. 

Lorlain deeply wishes to repay her obligations in a timely fashion. She dreams to own a house and lot someday.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for sale.

loans.name: Everlides

texts.es: Everlides de 49 años de edad, es una mujer echada para adelante que tiene claro que el bienestar de sus hijos es lo más importante, por lo cual se ha convertido en su mayor reto. Desde hace 30 años, labora en la plaza de mercado de su localidad, como ayudante y desde hace algún tiempo logró adquirir un puesto en la plaza e independizarse. Labora diariamente comercializando frutas y verduras, actividad que le permite generar los recursos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Con el fin de aumentar las ventas, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido. Sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar y tener una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Everlides is 49 years old and is determined woman who has made the well-being of her children (which she believes is of the greatest importance) her top priority.  She has worked in the town market for 30 years, starting out as an assistant.  Some time ago, she was able to gain her own spot in the plaza and start her own business.  She works every day selling fruit and vegetables and this allows her to help provide for her family.

With the goal of increasing her profits, she is asking for a loan that she will use to stock up on goods.  She dreams of improving the quality of life in her home and having greater financial stability.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Flor Àngela

texts.es:
Flor tiene 55 años de edad. Se ha ganado la admiración y el respeto de las personas de su comunidad, apreciada por su valentía y deseos de sacar adelante  su familia. 
Labora en una cafetería en semana y desde hace 4 meses decidió alternar esta actividad con la venta de prendas de vestir en el parque principal de su localidad, negocio que abre los fines de semana. 
Con su pujanza le ha brindado una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar. 
En la actualidad desea mejorar su condición económica y colaborarles a sus hijos con la universidad. Asegura que gracias a su trabajo muchos de sus sueños se han cumplido. Hoy Flor se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de satisfacer las necesidad des de sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Flor is 55 years old and has gained the admiration and respect of those in her community due to her courage and desire to help her family get ahead.

She works in a cafeteria during the week and decided to complement this job with selling clothing on the weekends.  She sells in her town's main market.

Through her efforts, she has offered her family a higher quality of life.

Currently, she seeks to improve her financial stability and put her children through college.  She is sure that it is thanks to her work that her goals have been accomplished.  Today Flor is asking for a loan that she will use to stock up on items to sell.  In this way, she will meet the needs of her customers and increase her income.

loans.use: buy clothes.

loans.name: Inés Gladis

texts.es: Inés a sus 43 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos. Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir a terceros desde hace 10 años. Su trabajo se caracteriza por el amor y el compromiso que le impregna a casa prenda elaborada. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una máquina botonadora, con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos y hacer entrega en el menor tiempo posible de los pedidos solicitados. A futuro desea expandir su taller y generar nuevas fuentes de empleo a su comunidad.
texts.en: At the age of 43, Inés is a mother of four children. She has been sewing clothing for third parties for the past 10 years. Her work is defined by the love and commitment she puts into every garment she makes. She's currently requesting a loan in order to purchase a button attaching machine, so she can increase her profits and deliver the requested orders within the shortest possible time. In the future she wishes to expand her dressmaking shop and provide a new source of employment for her community.

loans.use: to purchase a button attaching machine.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
A hardworking Melita is 49 years old and lives at Gango, Ozamiz City. She earns a meager income from her laundry services to support and help her family. 

Melita has maintained a good repayment record after being a member of PMPC for 5 years. Now she is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 for house repair.  

Melita hopes to live comfortably with their house being repaired and makes it a point to pay her obligations to PMPC on a timely manner from her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house repair.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 28-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two children, ages 3 and 7 months old. She raises hogs. She has been raising hogs for almost two years. Her husband is a tricycle driver. His income would not be enough for the family's daily expenses. 

Marife requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed and additional piglets to have an extra income to cater to the family's daily needs.

In the future, Marife would like to expand her piggery business to provide her family with good food and a higher status of livelihood.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Trixia

texts.en:
Trixia is married with two children. She is 32 years old and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. She is engaged in buying and selling dried fish and longaniza (pork sausage) to earn a living. She has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work.  

She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 for additional stock for her buy-and-sell business. As a PMPC member for one year, Trixia hopes to have more savings in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Geneveive

texts.en:
Genevieve is 42 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Genevieve is married with 4 children. 

Genevieve has a sand and gravel business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to pay for labor and incident costs for her sand and gravel business . 

Genevieve has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Genevieve hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to pay for labor and other incident costs.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah has been a member of PMPC for eight years. She is married and has two children. Dinah is 41 years old and lives in Caputol, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Dinah is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for twenty years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to redeem pawned coconut land. 

She hopes to have a brighter future ahead.

loans.use: to redeem pawned coconut land.

loans.name: Hansel

texts.en:
Hansel is 22-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 3 children ages 5, 2, and 4 months old. He is engaged in fishing. He catches and, at the same time, sells fish to customers in the community. He has been fishing for more than 2 years. His wife raises hogs to earn additional income.

In order to improve his livelihood activity, Hansel requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing materials, additional piglets, and groceries for the family to increase more catch and create more sales to provide his family with proper food and save some profits for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, additional piglets, and groceries for the family.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven estudiante de Ingeniería Mecánica en una universidad local
Jorge quiere trabajar en una empresa de prestigio dedicada a la industria automotriz o minera, por eso se esmera en ser un buen estudiante y le dedica muchas horas a sus estudios. Actualmente Jorge está realizando sus prácticas como electricista automotriz, este trabajo le sirve para adquirir más conocimientos y desarrollar todo lo aprendido, está agradecido por su préstamo porque le permitirá matricularse y pagar pensiones de la universidad, se siente afortunado y quiere agradecer a los inversionistas de KIVA y les quiere decir: “Gracias por confiar en nosotros!”
texts.en:
Jorge is a young mechanical engineering student at a local university.

Jorge wants to work at a respected company in the automotive or mining industries.  For this reason, he takes great pains to be a good student and spends many hours studying.  Currently, Jorge has an internship as an automotive electrician.  This work helps him obtain gain more knowledge and put his knowledge into practice.

He is grateful for the loan, because it will allow him to enroll in classes and make school payments.  He is grateful and wants to thank KIVA lenders and say "Thanks for believing in us!"

loans.use: MATRICULA Y PAGO DE PENSIONES

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is 64 years old,  married and lives Tuyabang Proper, Oroquieta City, Philippines. Pedro is a farmer and grows palay (unhusked rice) to earn a living. This has brought an income to the family for 8 years already.

Pedro has kept his membership with PMPC for 8 years and maintains a good repayment record. He seeks a loan of Php 49,000 to pay for labor and other related costs including the redemption of coconut pawn land. 

In the future, Pedro hopes to have a better future with his family and wants to save for his retirement.

loans.use: to pay for labor and other related costs, including the redemption of coconut pawn land.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 32-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 2 children ages 8 and 2 months old, respectively. She runs a variety store. She sells various items like coffee, cooking oil, canned goods, detergents, shampoos, and eggs. 

Sharon requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional goods like beverages, soft drinks, and condiments to fill her store with stock to cater to the needs of her customers. 

In the future, Sharon would like to expand her business to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional goods like beverages, soft drinks, and condiments.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 45-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 3 children aged 21, 20 and 9 years old. She grows seaweed to earn a living. She has been farming seaweed for more than 10 years. 

Wilma requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy straw, nylon and additional seaweed seedlings, to generate more harvest and an increase in sales. In the future, Wilma would like to expand her seaweed farming to provide her family with good food and to set some of the profits aside for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy straw, nylon, and additional seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Ma.heide

texts.en:
Ma.Heide is a 33-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children ranging in age from 14 to 2. Married to a fisherman, she sells fish, crabs and sea shells to customers in the community. Both she and her husband are working hard to earn a living and improve their business.

Ma.Heide has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy a diving mask, water-resistant flashlight and battery to increase the volume of their catch. In the future, she would like to expand her fishing business to better provide her children with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a diving mask, water-resistant flashlight and battery

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married, with one child; she is 57 years old and lives in Pobalacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.

To earn a living, Marilou has operated her own sari-sari/convenience store for 18 years.  Each month, she earns 4,500 PHP. 

She has requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy an additional stock of groceries for the store. 

Marilou has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 53-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has ten children; the oldest is 34, while the youngest is 18.

Virginia is engaged in fishing. She sells fish, crabs, and sea shells to earn a living.  Her husband is a fisherman, and she has been fishing for almost ten years.

Virginia  has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fishing materials like fish nets and crab cages, and to pay school fees. This will help her get a bigger catch to increase sales, as well as to meet the family's daily needs. 

In the future, Virginia would like to expand her fishing business to provide her family with good food, and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fish nets and crab cages, and to pay school fees.

loans.name: And Suxali Sine Saloum N°2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit And Suxali Sine Saloum n°2 rassemble cinq femmes qui logent dans le même quartier et qui s’activent dans le commerce de tout genre.
La dame Oulimata, qui est la présidente du groupe qui tient le carnet sur la photo, fait de la vente de légumes devant chez elle. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans ce domaine. Le crédit lui permettra d’acheter des variétés de légumes pour satisfaire sa clientèle qui n’aura pas besoin d’aller jusqu’au marché.
Grâce aux bénéfices réalisés, elle participe à la dépense quotidienne de la famille.
Elle désire diversifier ses activités, si elle a un fond stable.
texts.en:
The “And Suxali Sine Saloum #2” loan group is composed of five women living in the same neighborhood and working as vendors of various merchandise.
Mrs. Oulimata, the group’s leader and the one holding a savings account book in the photo, sells vegetables in front of her house. She has over five years of experience in this field. This loan will allow her to buy a variety of vegetables in order to meet her customers’ needs, saving them a trip to the market.
Thanks to her revenues, she contributes to everyday household expenses. She would like to diversify her business once she has a stable working capital.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gittel

texts.en:
Gittel is a 40-year-old married woman, and the mother of four children. They live in CPG, Bohol. 

Gittel runs a  sari-sari, or variety store, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. This is the source of her income. 

Gittel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap, and toiletries. This will help her cater to more customers, and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Eloy Alfaro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  19, 14 y 6 años de edad, todos estudian en universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Ana con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos hace tres años atrás instalo en su casa un pequeño negocio, allí ella se dedica a preparar chifles ya sean de plátano o de maduro, en todo este tiempo ya tiene muchos clientes que le piden sus productos, ella vende en su casa en fundas aunque sus mejores ventas son a domicilio ya que ella envía a su hijo a entregar en diferentes negocios en la ciudad ya sea en cevicherías o tiendas de la localidad. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar plátanos, manteca y fundas plásticas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. 

Sus sueños son tener un negocio más industrializado y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Eloy Alfaro Community Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are renowned nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous straw hats (Panama hats).  

In this place lives Ana, who is 37 years old.  She is married, and of this relationship she has three children -- 19, 14 and 6 years of age -- all of whom are studying in university and school.  Her husband is a brick layer.

Three years ago, Ana started a small business in her home, with the aim of earning her own income. Here, she makes a living making plantain chips, both of green and ripe plantains.  She has a lot of customers who ask for her products.  She sells from her home in plastic bags, although her best sales are home deliveries.  She sends her son to deliver to various businesses in the city, whether they are ceviche restaurants (fish/seafood restaurants) or neighborhood stores.  She works every day from 6am to 2pm, and sometimes later when she has orders to fill.

She will use this new loan to buy plantains, shortening and plastic bags.  She has been with the Community Bank since the beginning, and she likes it for the help they always give her with the loans.  Her dreams are to have a more industrialized business and to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy plantains, shortening and plastic bags.

loans.name: Coster

texts.en:
Coster has requested a third loan from Kiva so that he can open a second mobile money transfer shop. This is the update that he sent in:

Dear lenders, 

I am doing well in my business; the loans you gave me helped expand my business. I started to sell airtime, and this gave me some new customers. I took the chance to market the money transfers business to the walk-in airtime customers, and this has helped me have more customers.

I am asking for another Kiva loan so that I can open another shop. I will use the money to buy a new booth and cell phone and fund all my start-up costs. I have been encouraged by how my business has grown in the last months, and I am sure that opening another shop will help me to earn more commissions.

I am working very hard because I would like to own my own house someday. I am hopeful that, once I open another shop, the combined profits will put me in a position where I can be able to build my own house and continue to pay for my children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy a new booth and cell phone and fund all his start-up costs for a new mobile money transfer shop.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Precy is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She and her husband work hard together just to sustain the needs of their family. They plant and harvest rice to sell. They were able to earn PHP 20,000 each harvest season twice a year. It was just enough to cover their expenses, and she hopes to keep improving their sales and income. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay the labor fees for their farm. It will help nourish crops, and improve growth. 

Precy hopes to keep producing healthy crops to achieve a productive harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides, and to pay labor fees for her farm.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area. 

Gloria is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, soap and detergents, soda and beverages, canned goods, snack foods and other items. This will help her improve the variety in her store, allowing her to increase sales to her customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, soap,  detergents, soda and beverages, canned goods, snack foods and other items.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a farmer from the town of Alicia, Bohol. She is a married woman and has children. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. 

In the future, Jocelyn dreams of making her business a success and a stable source of income. Also, she wants to continue in sending her children to school for better learning.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Fotemogoban 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec  Malado debout au milieu sur la photo, 
elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Fotemogoban 3 group are married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have five children each.  They all live in traditional families in Kokouna, one of the villages of the Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali.

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are on their fourth loan with the institution and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Malado, grows maize.  In the photo, she is in the middle of the standing row.  She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 2 hectares (4.94 acres) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in the village and at the Sikasso market to a customer base consisting of both men and women.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 150,000 CFA francs per season.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to contribute to her large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman from the town of CPG, Bohol. She has been in the fishing business with her husband for more than six years, and this is the source of their income.

Evangeline is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and as additional capital to purchase a new fishing boat. This will help her husband improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Evangeline dreams of expanding their business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and as additional capital to purchase a new fishing boat

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina lives with her family in CPG, Bohol. She earns a living through the vending of homemade bread, and this is the source of her income. She has been in the business for more than four years. 

Lolina is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her food vending business, such as flour, sugar, milk, butter and other items. As a result of the loan, she will be able to bake more bread and sell it to the people in her locality.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business like flour, sugar, milk, butter, and other things.

loans.name: María Sarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal La Negrita se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo 4  hijos mayores de edad que  aun vive con ella a pesar de que ya están comprometidos.

Doña María para poder salir adelante con los gastos del hogar ya que esta sola sin el respaldo de su marido hace varios años empezó un negocio, tiene un pequeño comedor en su casa en el cual prepara deliciosos platos, trabaja todos los días todo el día ya prepara desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas, con ella  trabaja una persona a quien le paga un sueldo semanal por su trabajo. Tiene 6 años con su comedor y siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido salir adelante. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The La Negrita communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its artisanal crafts known nationally and internationally. It is where the famous paja toquilla hats come from.

Here lives María. She is 50 years old. Several years ago, her husband passed away but from her marriage she has 4 grown children who still live with her, despite being engaged.

In order to get ahead with the household expenses, since she is alone with out her husbands help, Maria started a business several years ago. She has a little restaurant in her house where she prepares delicious dishes. She works every day making breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. A person works with her whom she pays weekly. She has had her restaurant for 6 years and it has always gone well for her because her customers prefer her because of the way she seasons her food.

She is going to use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and other grocery items to make her food. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because with the loans she has been able to get ahead. 

Her goals are to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and other grocery items.

loans.name: Marie Jane

texts.en:
Marie Jane is 38 years old, a single mother of one. With her persistence and hard work, she’s able to provide the necessities for her child and her parents through her earnings from her mini-grocery business in their village. 

She is doing her best to provide a comfortable living for her family, despite the fact that she is the only hope of the family. 

Marie Jane wishes to improve her business to save for their basic commodities, the future of her child, and for her business needs. She is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, breads, milk, soap, and drinks. 

She hopes to use the loan to meet her customer's demands, because her mini-grocery is the center of almost all of a buyer's of household needs. This  will probably give her a chance to increase her income to save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, breads, milk, soap, and drinks.

loans.name: Fotemogoban A Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  Fotemogoban A  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Kokouna, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution et les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Mariam debout au milieu sur la photo, elle compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35 000 francs CFA  par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Fotemogoban A group are married women who, on average, are 40 years old and have six children each. They all live in traditional families in Kokouna, one of the villages of the Sikasso region, third administrative region of Mali.

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution and their previous loans have been duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Mariam, grows maize. In the photo, she is in the middle of the standing row. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectares (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop in the village and at the Sikasso market.  Her customers are both men and women.

She is expecting to make an average profit of 35,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to contribute to her large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds, and to pay for the cost of plowing.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Eloy Alfaro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 38  años de edad, está divorciada pero de esa relación tiene dos hijos de 11 y 5 años que estudian en la escuela.

Doña María estudia el último semestre de párvulo en una universidad de Manta  además de ser ama de casa y madre. Para que nada les falte a sus hijos también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, productos de plástico como: sillas, mesas, canastas, etc. negocio que tiene en su casa en el cual también vende bebidas y alimentos de picar. Ella lleva la ropa a su centro de estudios ya que sus mejores clientes son sus compañeras de clases, lleva tres años con su negocio el cual empezó con su primer crédito que recibió del banco y con el cual se gana el sustento de ella y sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio va a comprar ropa, productos de plástico, sodas y aguas Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 3 años y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: The Eloy Alfaro Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Cantón, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts which are recognized at both a national and international level. It is the place where the famous Panama hats are made. This is where María lives. María is 38 years old and divorced and has two children from her marriage aged 11 and 5, both of whom are in school. María is studying pre-school education at the University of Manta as well as being a homemaker and mother. So that her children do not want for anything, she also works selling various types of clothing, plastic products such as chairs, tables, baskets, etc. She sells from home and also sells drinks and snacks. She takes the clothing to her study center, and her best customers are her classmates. She has been running this business, which she started with her first loan from the bank, for three years,  She earns her living from her business which also provides for her children. She is going to use this loan to buy stock for her business and buy clothing, plastic products, sodas. and water. She has been a member of the communal bank for three years now and she likes it because her first loan helped her to start her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, plastic furniture, sodas and water.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn runs a sari-sari, or variety store, in CPG, Bohol. She sells a variety of goods to the people in her area. 

Madelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers, augmenting her sales and income. 

In the future, Madelyn hopes to make her business sustainable and a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her three children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chemicals and plaiting weaves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes, playing balls and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alexandra Isabel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Eloy Alfaro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Alexandra, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 6 y 2 años de edad, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es soldador. 

Doña Alexandra es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo para ayudar a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y los estudios de sus hijos. Hace 5 años empezó un negocio el cual lo tiene en su casa, allí  ella vende ropa de todo tipo, bisutería, zapatos, papel higiénico y varios productos más, también sale a vender por toda la ciudad  la ropa y los productos de catálogo los mismos que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio va a comprar ropa, bisutería, zapatos entre otras cosas que vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque con los créditos ella cada vez surte más su negocio. 

Su sueño es aumentar su negocio.
texts.en: The Eloy Alfaro Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial history as well as its handicrafts which are recognized on a national and international level. It is where they make the famous Panama hats. This is where Alexandra lives. She is 32 years old and is in a relationship from which she has three children aged 11, 6, and 2. The two eldest are in school. Her partner is a solderer. Alexandra is a very hard-working woman who likes to work to help her partner out with the household expenses and the school fees for the children. She started her business 5 years ago and works from home. She sells all types of clothing, jewelry, shoes, toilet roll, and other types of products. She goes out to sell clothing in the city and also sells clothing by catalog, which she lets people buy on credit and pay every two weeks. She is going to use this loan to buy stock for her business including clothing, jewelry, shoes among other products. She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years and she likes it because the loans allow her to buy stock for her business. Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jewelry and shoes, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita
600.000
2013-102


 Madre nicaragüense de 5 hijos, humilde y trabajadora, a sus 46 años lucha por sacarlos  adelante, mediante el estudio y un buen ejemplo de vida. Actualmente los menores están estudiando y obteniendo excelentes calificaciones, pese a las limitaciones que tiene en su hogar. El esfuerzo de Teresita y el apoyo de gente conocida le permiten abrir su tiendita hace 2 años y mantiene la venta de comidas, por lo que se hizo conocida en la zona, los fines de semana. Después de la visita y compartiendo las carencias de esta familia, se nota la educación buen trato y amabilidad de sus integrantes, que trabajan en equipo para lograr una mejor calidad de vida. Además 2 de sus hijos están en quinto año y son los primeros promedios y su hija menor esta en tercero de la escuela también con excelentes calificaciones.

 El trabajo en la venta de comidas y el apoyo de sus hijas le permite acondicionar el frente de su humilde vivienda y con materiales que muchos consideraríamos desecho, armo sus estantes, sus exhibidores y su escritorio de trabajo y caja y abrió su tienda en la comunidad. En 2 años de trabajo se ha establecido y ofrece mercadería de moda y sandalias muy populares en la zona de Puntarenas. Revisando los documentos del negocio, los ingresos adicionales con las comidas y el apoyo de sus hijas, la actividad, que es un conjunto de aportes de toda la familia, les permite atender sus clientes y ofrecer mercadería de muy buena calidad. El préstamo le va a permitir comprar y diversificar sus productos, crecer y apoyar a sus hijos en el estudio, que es su principal objetivo.

 La tiendita está localizada en un barrio pobre de la zona de Puntarenas, de piso de  tierra y estantería elaborada con  materiales de desecho, mantiene un orden y limpieza impecables. Ejemplo en la zona de esfuerzo y dedicación por sus hijos, su tienda es única en la zona y referencia para muchas personas para comprar ropa de moda y calidad pese a las condiciones humildes de su local. Los fines de semana venden comida y con el apoyo de sus hijos menores atiende el negocio. Desea que ellos sigan estudiando y logren sacar una carrera, mejorando así su nivel de vida. Sueña con mejorar su casa y su tienda en un futuro.
texts.en:
Teresita
600.000
2013-102


She is a hardworking and humble Nicaraguan mother of 5. At 46 years old, she fights to get them ahead with education and a being a good example.  Right now the younger ones are in school and getting good grades, despite the limitations they have in the home. Teresita's hard work and the help of people she knows allowed her to open a store 2 years ago where she sells meals. She became known in the area on weekends. After visiting and sharing the family's scarcities, the education, kindness and friendliness of its members can be seen. They work as a team to achieve a better quality of life. Two of her children are in the fifth year and they are getting top grades. Her youngest daughter is in the third year at school and she also has excellent grades. 

The work selling food and the help of her daughters has allowed her to improve her humble home with materials that many would consider scrap. She made her shelves, display cases, and her work desk and cash box and she opened her store in her community. After working for 2 years, she has become established and she offers clothing merchandise and sandals that are very popular in the area of Puntarenas. Going over the business' documents, the additional income with the meals and her daughters' help, one can see that the work, which is contributed to by the whole family, allows her to serve her customers and offer high quality merchandise. The loan is going to allow her to buy and diversify her products, and to grow and help her children, which is her main objective. 

The store is located in a poor neighborhood of Puntarenas, with a dirt floor and shelves made from scrap materials. She keeps things neat and impeccably clean. She is an example in the area of hard work and dedication to her children. Her store is the only one in the area. On weekends, they sell food and with the help of her younger children she tends to the business. She wants them to stay in school and have good careers, thus improving their quality of life. She dreams of improving her house and her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothing, sandals and jewelry.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano is a 46-year-old married man and a father of three children from CPG, Bohol. Mariano is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now. Mariano is asking for a loan to buy more materials for fishing, like nets and bamboo. Bamboo is used to make fish traps.

In the future, Mariano hopes to make his fishing business a sustainable success.

loans.use: to buy more materials for fishing, like nets and bamboo

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic runs a sari-sari, or variety store, in her place in CPG, Bohol. Marivic is a married woman and has two children. Marivic has been in the business for more than 7 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Marivic is asking for a loan to buy more bread, biscuits and snack foods, noodles and canned goods, soap, toiletries and other items to sell. Through this loan, she will be able to cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more bread, biscuits and snack foods, noodles and canned goods, soap, toiletries and other items to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is 22 years of age and he is not married. 

Peter sells second-hand furniture. He has been doing this for one year now. His main challenge in doing this business is raising capital and competition.

He discovered Milango through friends. He is now seeking a loan of 21,100 KES to buy some tables and beds.

The loan will raise the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy some tables and beds.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is 32 years of age and she is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. 

Loice sells charcoal. She has been doing this for two years now. Her main challenge in doing this business is raising capital. She found out about Milango through friends. She now seeks a loan of 21,050 KES to buy 5 sacks of charcoal for resale.

The loan will raise the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Las Vecinas Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por  tres socias una de ellas es Lila mujer de 69 años de edad, soltera, con hijos ya mayores, tiene 42 años de hacer y vender nacatamales los fines de semana en su domicilio, cuenta con dos trabajadores que les paga en el apoyo del negocio en la elaboración del producto, tiene cinco años de ser cliente de la institución, sus productos son reconocidos de muy buena calidad en su comunidad, el crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de materia prima como arroz, carne de cerdo, vegetales, sal, achiotes, hojas de chagüites, mecates, tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, manteca de cerdo, etc. Rosa tiene 48 años de edad su negocio es tener una pulpería y los fines de semana vende fritanga los fines de semana, Gloria tiene 18 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamal en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The group consists of three members. One of them is Lila, a 69-year-old woman who is single, with grown children. For 42 years she has made and sold nacatamales in her house on weekends. She relies on two paid workers to support the business and prepare the products. She has been a client of the institution for five years. Her products are recognized in her community as being of very good quality. She will invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials like rice, pork, vegetables, salt, achiotes, banana leaves, cord, tomato, onion, sweet peppers, lard, etc. 

Rosa is 48. Her business is a convenience store and on weekends she sells fried food.

Gloria has had her business for 18 years. She sells nacatamales from her home.

loans.use: to  purchase raw materials like rice, pork, vegetables, salt, achiotes, banana leaves, cord, tomato, onion, sweet peppers, lard, etc.

loans.name: Roserio Noemi

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Eloy Alfaro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosario, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos, 5 mayores de edad y el menor de 10 años que estudia en la escuela. Su esposo es carpintero.

Doña Rosario tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa, allí vende gaseosas, aguas, jugos, energizantes y varias bebidas mas, además de varias golosinas y bocadillos de picar. Los días que más vende son los fines de semana ya que ella vive al frente de unas canchas de football y de vóley y en estos días se reúnen muchas personas en este lugar con lo cual sus ventas mejoran en estos días. Gracias a este negocio ella gana algo por su cuenta que le sirven para comprar útiles para su hijo y medicinas para ella y su familia. Doña Rosario tiene una vida es muy sacrifica da ya que además de atender su hogar y su negocio también tiene que cuidar a su hijo que es especial.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar gaseosas, aguas, jugos, cervezas entre otros productos que vende. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Eloy Alfaro" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi area, which is known for its rich, precolonial culture and its artisan crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is from here that straw hats originate.

And it is here that Rosario lives.  She is 54 years old, married and has six children with her husband.  Five of her children are adults while the youngest is ten years old and in school.  Rosario's husband is a carpenter.

Rosario has a small business that she runs out of her house.  She sells fizzy drinks, water, juices, energy drinks and various other drinks, as well as sweets and snack foods.  Rosario has her highest sales at the weekend as she lives across from a football pitch and volleyball court and many people come to play.  Thanks to this business, Rosario earns money on her own, allowing her to buy materials for her son and medicines for herself and her family.  Rosario has a very hard life as, in addition to looking after her home and business, she also has to look after her son who has learning difficulties.

Rosario will use this loan to buy fizzy-drinks, water, juices, beer and other products that she sells.  She has been with the communal bank for eight years and likes the help they give to help her get ahead.

Rosario's dream is to progress in life.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, water, beer and more.

loans.name: Neyda Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Eloy Alfaro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Neyda, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14,  8 y 2 años, los dos mayores  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Doña Neyda con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto solventar ciertos gastos de los estudios de sus hijos hace mas de 10 años empezó un pequeño negocio en su casa el mismo que con el paso de los días y con la ayuda de los créditos ha ido mejorando, ella tiene una heladería en su casa allí vende helados de una marca nacional muy reconocida, allí también vende gaseosas, aguas, jugos, energizantes y varias bebidas mas, los días que más vende son los fines de semana ya que se reúnen muchas personas por el sector y son clientes que siempre llegan a su local por la buena atención que ella les brinda.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar helados, gaseosas, aguas, entre otros productos que vende. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ella mejora cada vez más  su negocio. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Eloy Alfaro" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi area, which is known for its rich, precolonial culture and its artisan crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is from here that straw hats originate.

And it is here that Neyda lives.  She is 35 years old, married and has three children - aged fourteen, eight, and two years old each.  The two eldest children are in school.  Neyda's husband is a construction worker.

In order to earn a little on her own and to cover the costs of her children's education, Neyda started her own little business ten years ago.  She runs it out of her home and as the days have gone buy and with the help of loans, the business has improved.  Neyda's business is an ice cream shop.  She sells a very well-known, national brand of ice cream, in addition to fizzy drinks, water, juices, energy drinks and other beverages.  She makes most of her sales on the weekend as many people in the area meet up then.  People come to Neyda's store because of the good service she provides.

Neyda will use this loan to buy ice cream, fizzy drinks, water and other products to sell.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because the loans help her to keep on improving her business.

Neyda's dream is to give her children the best she possibly can.

loans.use: to buy ice-creams, fizzy drinks, water and more.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Eloy Alfaro que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 20 y 13  años de edad, el menor estudia en colegio.

Doña Ana es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que ella es padre y madre  a la vez y hace lo que pueda para que a ellos no les faltara nada, ella tiene  un negocio en su casa en el cual se dedica a la venta de pollos por libras, aguas, collas, entre otras cosas. Todos los días ella de desplaza a una granja que hay por la ciudad donde compra los pollos, luego los faena y después los vende ya sea enteros o por libras, son 15 años que lleva realizando esta actividad con la cual ha sacado sola adelante a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su negocio va a comprar pollos, aguas, jugos y sodas. 

Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Eloy Alfaro" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi area, which is known for its rich, precolonial culture and its artisan crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is from here that straw hats originate.

It is here in Montecristi that Ana lives.  She is 39 years old and a single mother to two children, aged 20 and 13 years old respectively.  The youngest is in secondary school.

Ana is a feisty woman who has always liked to work in order to help her children prosper, as she is both mother and father to them.  She does what she can so that the children do not need for anything.  Ana has a business at home, where she sells chicken by the pound, as well as water and other items.  Every day she goes out to a farm in the city where she buys the chickens.  Later she slaughters them to then sell, either who or by the pound.  Ana has been doing this work for fifteen years and, with it, she has helped her children get ahead.

Ana will use this loan to stock up her business by buying chicken, water, juices and fizzy drinks.

Her dream is to give her children the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy chicken, water, juices and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets, a bicycle for carrying goods and to buy seafood in bulk.

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
Paulo de 19  años es un joven estudiante de Mecánica Automotriz en un Instituto Superior
Paulo ha pedido este  préstamo para continuar con sus estudios, eligió esta carrera porque le gustan los autos y porque siente q es una carrera competitiva, solo le faltan 5 meses para culminar su carrera y titularse, actualmente esta laborando en una empresa automotriz; esto le sirve para su carrera por los conocimientos que adquiere, por otro lado se siente aliviado por este préstamo que le servirá específicamente para iniciar los trámites de su titulación. Paulo está muy deseoso por lograr su meta y poder darle a su familia lo mejor, está feliz por saber que muchas personas lo ayudan en su objetivo.
texts.en:
Paulo is 19 years old and studying mechanics at a further education college.

Paulo has applied for a loan in order to continue with his studies.  He chose this course because he likes cars and because he feels it is a competitive career.  He has only five months left before he finishes and qualifies.  He is currently working for a car company, which is helping him develop his knowledge.  However, he feels relieved to have a loan that will help him specifically to start paying the costs for his final qualification.  Paulo has a great desire to achieve his goal and to be able to give his family the best he can.  He is happy to know that many people are helping him with his objective.

loans.use: to pay costs for a further education course.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol y también se dedica hacer viajes en su microbús, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas de granos básicos y de los viajes en el microbús ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, Guillermo esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar repuestos y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para seguir con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Guillermo works in agriculture, growing corn and beans.  He also earns money driving a "micro" (a small bus used for public transportation).  With the profits he earns from selling the grains and from the bus, he is able to help the family with household costs.  Guillermo is applying for a loan in order to buy spare parts and to maintain his vehicle so as to continue with his work and to provide his family with more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Reche

texts.en:
Reche is a married woman and a mother of two children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged the in hog-raising business for more than 20 years now. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store business in her place.

Reche is asking for a loan to buy more feed for the pigs and more stock to sell in her store, such as canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to improve her ventures and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more feed for the pigs and more stock to sell in her store, such as canned goods, candies, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and blessed with five children. She has been operating her own cafeteria for three years now. She sells cooked food to her customers.

Julia heard of Milango through friends when she really wanted credit to boost her business. She now seeks a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour. The major challenge she faces is a lack of capital.

She wants to open other branches of her cafeteria in five years. Income from this loan will uplift the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and a father of a one year old. Jackson, 29, has been operating a curio shop for more than five years. He sells artifacts, mostly to tourists, and raises his income from the business. He knew of Milango through friends and seeks a loan of 21,100 to buy some art items for his shop. The major challenge he faces is a lack of capital.

The loan will improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy art items, e.g., plaiting beads and maasai clothes.

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por seis socias microempresarias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es María Luisa mujer de 43 años casada, con tres   hijos menores, tiene 10 años de tener una pulpería en su domicilio y anteriormente vendía cosméticos de  la Avon, lleva cuatro años de ser cliente de la institución lo que refleja que paga los créditos que la institución le ha confiado, el crédito anterior ha logrado diversificar en variedad de productos como queso, huevo, y productos cosméticos expuestos en vitrinas en el local, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos de pulperías como granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas bigcolas, coca cola, cigarro, queso, crema, leche en bolsa, carne de pollo, carne de res, huevo, papel higiénico, etc., Vilma es una mujer de 36 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de hielo al por mayor, Aracely tiene 40 años su negocio es la venta de chicharrón, María tiene 58 años su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon, Engracia tiene 62 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de productos de cosméticos de  la Avon y Rosa tiene 36 años de edad y su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of six enterprising, successful micro-entrepreneurs, one of which is María Luis.  She is 43, married and has three minor children.  For ten years she has been running a grocery store out of her home and before that she sold Avon products.  She has been a member of the lending institution for four years, which means she has a good credit record.  She used the previous loan to diversify her grocery products, adding cheese, eggs, and cosmetic products on display.  This loan will be used to buy basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, sodas, cigarettes, cheese, cream, milk, chicken, beef, eggs, toilet tissue, etc.  

Vilma is 36 and sells ice wholesale.  Aracely, 40, sells pork cracklings.  María is 58 and sells Avon cosmetics.  Engracia, 62, sells Avon cosmetics and Rosa, 36, has a grocery store at home.

loans.use: To buy basic staples such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, sodas, cigarettes, cheese, cream, milk, beef, chicken, eggs, toilet tissue, etc.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan nació en la comunidad de Pumapaccha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 23 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Sus actividades económicas son la venta de palos, la agricultura, la ganadería y la crianza de animales como ovejas, vacas, cuyes, chanchos y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Tahuantinsuyo” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.   

(La comunidad de Pumapaccha pertenece al distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Juan was born in the community of Pumapaccha where he still lives.  He is 23 years old, married, has a son, and is a hard-working, enterprising person who makes every effort to get ahead.  He earns a living selling sticks, working in agriculture and raising animals such as sheep, cows, guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.  For several years he has been a member of the communal bank "Tahuanstinsuyo" and on this occasion he is in need of a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.

(The community of Pumpaccha belongs to the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Perú.)

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lkisarin

texts.en: Lkisarin lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He is married and a father of six. Lkisarin, 43, has been operating a curio shop for more than 15 years. He sells artifacts mostly to tourists and earns his income from the business. He learned about Milango through friends. He is seeking a loan of 21,050 KES to buy some art items for his shop. The major challenge he faces is lack of capital. The loan will improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy maasai cloths, beads and traditional bangles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour and a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Luz Adiela

texts.es: Luz Adiela a sus 46 años de edad es una emprendedora quien inicia su propio negocio con el fin de generar una fuente de ingresos para su sustento y el de su hijo. Se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo desde hace algún tiempo, actividad que alterna con la venta de comida rápida los fines de semana. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una nevera y artículos de belleza y aseo personal con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Con dicha inversión, Luz Adiela podrá generar mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén.
texts.en: Luz Adiela, 46, is an entrepreneur who began her business to generate an income for her and her son.  For some time she has been selling products by catalogue, which activity she alternates with fast food sales on the weekends.  Now she is requesting a loan to buy a new refrigerator as well as beauty and body care products to fill customer demand.  With this investment, Luz Adiela will be able to generate more income so she can have a better quality of life and meet her goal of having her own shop.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator as well as beauty and body care products.

loans.name: Maximo Dionisio

texts.es: Máximo, es un humilde campesino habitante de la comunidad Ojo de Agua en las afueras de Boaco, de oficio agricultor, casado, padre de 4 hijos . Él se dedica a sembrar granos básicos y hortalizas actividad que aprendió desde muy joven pues sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo. Actualmente el siembra maíz, frijol y hortalizas actividad que realiza junto con su familia.  El ciclo de siembra está por comenzar y necesita insumos para sembrar. Es por eso que está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar abono, fertilizantes, abonos y gasolina para la bomba de riego. El financiamiento le permitirá  tener los insumos que necesita y poder sacar su cosecha a tiempo. Uno de sus proyectos más próximos es terminar de construir su pozo y sembrar hortalizas.
texts.en: Máximo is a humble farmer who lives in the community of Ojo de Agua on the outskirts of Boaco.  He is married, has four children and grows basic crops and vegetables.  He learned the trade as a very young man from his parents who were also farmers.  Máximo is currently planting corn, beans and vegetables with his family.  The planting season is about to begin and he needs the proper supplies.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and gas for his irrigation pump.  The loan will enable him to buy the supplies he needs so he can begin planting on time.  One of his projects for the near future is to build a well and plant vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and gas for his irrigation pump.

loans.name: Nzilani

texts.en:
Nzilani lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married with five children and all of them attend school. She has been buying and selling fruits and vegetables for more than 10 years.
 
She heard about Milango from her friend and she joined. She now seeks a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and fruits for resale. The major challenge is the high cost of transportation, which cuts into her income. The loan will help her to educate her children and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy kale, oranges and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo nació en la comunidad de Pumapaccha y vive en la misma comunidad donde nació, él tiene 43 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Sus actividades económicas son la venta de palos y la agricultura. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Tahuantinsuyo” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar palos. 
 
(La comunidad de Pumapaccha pertenece al distrito de Colquepata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Eduardo was born in the community of Pumapaccha where he still lives.  He is 43, married, has four children and is a very hard-working, enterprising person who makes every effort to get ahead.  He earns a living selling timber and working in agriculture.  For several years he has belonged to the communal bank "Tahuantinsuyo" and on this occasion he is requesting a loan to buy wood.

(The community of Pumapaccha belongs to the district of Colquepata in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cusco, Perú.)

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 43-year-old mat weaver from the town of CPG, Bohol. She is a married woman and has eight children. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Regina is asking for a loan for her husband's fishing business. With a loan, they will be able to buy materials for fishing like nets, lead weights, hooks and others. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like nets, lead weights, hooks and others

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is a proud and experienced farmer who grows rice in Villa Domingo. He has been in the farming business for nearly 20 years, and he learned farming practices from his parents. 

Bernardo is now 41 years old and has three children. He works hard for his family's sustenance. He usually earns PHP 25,000 every crop season. Now, Bernardo would like to keep improving his crop production. He is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to invest in the farm inputs necessary for good nutrition for his crops so that he can harvest them profitably. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides to be used in farming. Additional revenue will be used to pay  the school fees for his children. 

With good income from their business, Bernardo and his family hope to achieve income stability in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to be used in farming.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 12 years now. This is the source of their income. Rosita is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, etc. This will enable her husband to enhance his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, etc.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en: Teofila is a married woman with three grown children from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. Teofila runs a sari-sari or variety store where she sells various goods and items to the people in her area. Teofila is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, soda, chips, biscuits and noodles. Through this loan, she will be able to attract more customers to her store, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, soda, chips, biscuits and noodles.

loans.name: Vita

texts.en: Vita is a married woman and a mother of seven children from CPG, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 15 years now. Vita is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Vita dreams of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and medicine for her hogs.

loans.name: Marìa Del Socorro

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos. Creó su propia fuente de empleo desde hace algunos años con el fin de generar ingresos y poder cuidar de sus hijos debido a su condición de madre soltera. Asegura que aunque el camino recorrido no ha sido fácil y ha tenido que afrontar situaciones dolorosas como el abandono de su pareja; sus hijos se convirtieron en su mayor fortaleza y en el motivo para salir adelante. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido como cerveza y gaseosas, lo que le permitirá aumentar el nivel de ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María, 55, has four children. She started her own business some years ago with the intention to generate income and be able to take care of them, since she is a single mother. María says that she has walked a difficult path and has had to confront painful situations in life, as when her partner left her. Her children gave her strength and became her main motivation to get ahead.

María is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as beer and sodas. This will help her increase her sales and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as beers and sodas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make some home improvements.
